name: Slicethepie
overview:
Slicethepie is a web based artist financing engine that raises money for artists to professionally record an album. It enables users to invest in, profit from, and trade in artists’ success by turning every music fan into a talent scout and investor.

This is done via a two step process. First the site harnesses the “Wisdom of Crowds” to objectively identify the best new artists. The top 2% of artists are then showcased on the site and every artist/band who attracts sufficient support from investors and fans goes forward to raise $30,000 to professionally record and release an album.

Investors can then trade in and out of their Contracts in artists they have invested in on a fully fledged trading exchange hosted on the site. The ultimate payout on Contracts is directly proportional to the number of singles and albums sold over a 2 year period.

Artists keep all of their copyright and publishing rights, paying a royalty to Slicethepie on the first two years of album sales. Slicethepie revenues are obtained from royalties from sales of albums, advertising, income based on sales of Contracts and commission on the trading of Contracts.
tag_list: music, bands, investment, gambling, artists, fans

Maestro is a socially connected cloud music platform that enables user’s to access and manage their entire music library on-demand from any connected device. With a hybrid client application and cloud-based solution, Maestro solves the consumer pain of ubiquitous remote access to your personal digital media library.

Combined with an interactive experience at Maestro.fm, Maestro empowers the user and brings their media library to life, enhancing the personal experience, connecting user’s within the network, driving social discovery, and incorporating a behaviorally targeted marketplace.

name: Handipoints
overview:
Handipoints features a virtual world for kids and a chore chart system for families. Parents create printable online playing charts and kids earn points by checking off their tasks.

The more chores they do, the more points they earn. Kids can redeem their points for games, movies and clothes for their CoolCat kitty avatars in HandiLand. This is an online world where they can also talk to and play with other kids.

Kids can also redeem their points for real life rewards to keep them motivated. Parents can use this system to set up allowance programs and more online.

Unlike other children’s sites, Handipoints is a practical chore solution for families married to a fun and motivational virtual world for kids.

name: Clipta
overview: Clipta was the largest video index on the web, and a destination for Internet users to find, discover, share, and interact with videos from any source worldwide. Clipta’s mission is to give users the freedom to select between hundreds of millions of free online videos as well as premium paid content, and television broadcasts, in one place. Beyond the ability to search for content, Clipta has created multiple platforms that allow users to have a tailored and personal video viewing experience. With a combination of new technologies including deep crawling and video search algorithms, Clipta quickly collects content and delivers relevant video search results based on user behavior. Clipta was founded in April 2008, and is available on 18 different languages.
tag_list: online-news, entertainment, video-search, video-community, video, search, movies, clips, watch

name: Zebtab
overview: Zebtab is an aggregated desktop widget that delivers the latest snackable content in a rich media format to the consumer for free. Zebtab is an ad platform with content from the worlds of Sport, Entertainment,News and TV.

acquisition.source_description: Motionbox Acquires Fellow Video Sharing Site Viddyou
name: Viddyou
overview: Viddyou is a custom-built video service that allows anyone to archive and express their life in short-form videos. Featuring intuitive organizational tools, Viddyou enables you to quickly record, organize, share and protect these video chronicles with friends and family.

name: Music Arsenal
overview: Music Arsenal is an online tool designed for the indie music industry. This site helps you keep track of all the valuable information necessary to manage your band efficiently–details like contacts, communications, schedules, concerts, and expenses. It allows you to delegate tasks, to keep track of your progress, and stick to your deadlines. The Music Arsenal Directory provides an ever-growing list of contacts to help keep your band on the radar. Record companies, retail, press, radio, venues–you name it, we’ve got it.

name: XIHA
overview: XIHA develops the world’s first multilingual social media platform and operates XIHA Life, an online community targeted at people who use multiple languages in their everyday lives.
tag_list: multilingual, social-networking, games, friends, photos, blogs, realtime, search

name: SonicSwap
overview: A music social network dedicated to iTunes users. SonicSwap automatically converts playlists into video playlists of original and live music tracks, allowing anyone to legally play their music anywhere. Because of the tight integration with iTunes, playlists don’t have to be recreated by hand on the website, and reflect exactly what people listen to in their own music collections. A member’s iTunes playlist collection is automatically kept in sync via an iTunes plug-in or by posting directly to the website. Members can see what friends are listening to, and find social peers with similar tastes to help introduce new music.
tag_list: music, social-network, playlists, itunes, apple, ipod, discover-music

name: Cozimo
overview: Cozimo is an online collaboration tool specifically designed for creative media professionals who would like to collectively edit graphical images and videos via a browser-based solution. Users are able to log in and view team members’ suggestions, with specific features for different types of content : during a video editing session individual frames can be paused and annotated, and when editing a presentation in group mode a moderator can control the navigation within the file. Cozimo is compatible with all flash-enabled browsers, and supports editing a wide variety of video and image formats. The company has offices in both Montreal and California.

acquisition.source_description: Zynga Acquires MyMiniLife, Looks To Expand Virtual World Portfolio (Updated)
name: MyMiniLife
overview:
MyMiniLife allows users to express their physical life on the web by creating virtual homes. The service also allows users to take photos of real life objects which they can then import into their online life.

Zynga officially announced the acquisition of MyMiniLife, whose technology supported FarmVille’s rise to 6 million daily active uniques in a month and half.

name: tunesBag
overview:
Austria based tunesBag is a music player with social features on the net. They offer an online audio library and let you upload your music collection onto their site. You can then play your tracks anywhere from the web and share them with your friends. The site offers the integration of various other services including Facebook (friend list), YouTube (music videos) or last.fm (submit listening habits).

The service is providing users with mobile applications (iPhone client) and a desktop application as well.

Users can upload and access their own tunes all over the world and in certain countries tracks can be shared between friends (streaming).

acquisition.source_description: 888 Holdings acquires online gaming firm Mytopia for $18M
name: Mytopia
overview:
Mytopia is a place for playing social games with friends on your computer or smartphone. We specialize in making cross-platform games that allow users on social networks like Facebook to play together with their friends connecting from a mobile device like an Android phone or iPad.

Mytopia was founded in 2006 by Guy, Galia, Yotam, Yudi and Alexei back when Smartphones were still called PDAs.

name: GoCrossCampus
overview:
GoCrossCampus (GXC) is a social, interative game popular on American campuses that pits dorms and colleges against each other.

Groups of players fight virtually over real-world territories in attempt for regional domination.

As of late June 2008, the game had spread across almost 40 universities and high schools. Google plans to use the game at its New York office for camaraderie-building purposes.

A political version of the game called GoCrossPoliticalBash08 involved over 2,000 presidential candidate supporters across the United States, while a competition between Ivy League universities brought on almost 11,000 students.

acquisition.source_description: 3Sixty Fishes DivShare Out Of The Deadpool
name: DivShare
overview:
divShare hosts videos, photos, and other files for free.

In November of 2007 the site was posted for sale on an online forum.

Divshare was purchased by 3Sixty in Jan 2009.

acquisition.source_description: Tech Crunch UK - Pikum
name: Pikum
overview: Backed by First Round Capital and Virgin, Pikum is a new kind of betting game created and played between friends online. It can be played for fun, or where possible, money. It’s simple, social, fun, and hopes to capitalize on people’s love of predicting, debating, and bragging when they’re right.

name: HungryFlix
overview:
HungryFlix provides audio and video downloads for iPod, iPhone, PSP, Apple TV, Mac and PC. The site is a distributor of premium independent media including feature films, short films, how-to video, music videos, sports, documentary, TV Shows and music. All content is DRM-free and offered as download-to-own without restrictions.

The company’s goal is to provide an effective way to market and distribute independent film and videos to audiences worldwide.

overview: ibeatyou is a video portal that allows its users to create competitions. Participants upload or import videos from YouTube, or capture video from webcam as competition entries. The community then votes on entries using a 5 point rating scale.

name: itbreaks
overview: Itbreaks is a community music site, where artists can upload music that gets voted on by listeners. The site hopes to simplify the process of finding good music by listening to songs through the lens of the collective community on itbreaks. Any artist can add their music to itbreaks in a process that’s fast and simple.

acquisition.source_description: Google Acquires Online Video Hosting Platform Episodic
name: Episodic
overview:
Episodic is an online video hosting platform that broadcasts both live and on-demand content to any web-enabled device.

The Episodic publishing platform is made up of the following six functional areas: video content management, content ingest and encoding, adaptive bitrate playback, monetization through advertising and credit card transaction, audience measurement and analytics, and syndication.

name: Rosterbot
overview: RosterBot is a web based athletic team management application. It serves to organize teams of any sport by polling each player to see if they’re coming to the next event and then showing coaches and other members the results, along with some other relevant information, such as player profiles, calendars, and locations. The service can also email users a summary of who’s coming on game day. The service is free to users.

name: Easyteammanager
overview: EasyTeamManager is a web based service that allows for the management of athletic teams by coaches, parents, and team members alike. Upcoming games, team rosters, events, locations, and bulletins can all be displayed on customizable team pages.

name: YourTeamOnline
overview: YourTeam Online offers a free global sports communication network that connects teams, players, coaches and fans. With YourTeam Online; teams can stay connected, players can track their entire career and build their own online player card and coaches can access and share drills with peers.

name: Realtime Worlds
overview:
Realtime Worlds is an entertainment software company with a focus on video games such as Crackdown and APB. The team behind Realtime Worlds has been involved with the development of hits such as Lemmings and Grand Theft Auto.

The company is the largest independent game producer in Scotland. It also has offices in Boulder, CO.

It has won two awards from the British Academy of Film and Television Arts for Crackdown.

name: AudioMicro
overview:
AudioMicro, Inc. operates a network of digital content licensing marketplaces, each targeted at a specific vertical - celebrity photos, stock music, sound effects, and YouTube monetization, as well as a few fun and undisclosed web projects.

Founded in 2007 and armed with a world-class engineering team, the Company has grown from a fledgling beta website to 3+ online brands and thousands of happy customers served. AudioMicro, Inc. is venture backed by DFJ Frontier, part of the largest VC network in the world with over $7B under management, and Fotolia LLC, a leading stock photo marketplace with over 12 million images and counting.

Details on the Company’s 3 brands:

AudioMicro.com = a collection of user-generated micro stock music, sound effects, production music, royalty free music, and music cues (“iStockphoto for Music.”)

ImageCollect.com = the micro stock photo licensing destination dedicated entirely to celebrity pictures with over 5 million royalty free images available via subscription (“Shutterstock for Celebrity Photos.”)

AdRev.net = a program that administrates the monetization of YouTube on behalf of music and video copyright holders such as record labels, publishers, production music libraries, TV studios.

name: stickychicken
overview:
stickychicken is a place for discovering and self-organizing local pick-up games. It’s easy to add your favorite pick-up game spot, find fun pick-up games, or create your own and invite friends!

stickychicken’s mission is to revitalize the local pickup game community and empower people around the world to self-organize both online and face-to-face games.

name: Cellufun
overview:
Cellufun is one of the world’s largest mobile communities where people socialize, play games, and buy virtual goods for self expression, gifting, and competitive advantage. People around the globe can access the Cellufun platform on any mobile network, on any phone, and in over ten languages to create personal avatars, compete, collaborate, chat, and celebrate special occasions.

Cellufun partners with global brands and media companies to deliver branded entertainment and custom-designed mobile marketing solutions. With a quarter billion monthly page views, Cellufun offers a unique brand-building opportunity for media, marketers and agencies seeking to broaden their reach to the ever-present “third screen.”

Cellufun was briefly rebranded as Tylted before being acquired by its original founders in 2013 and renamed Cellufun.

name: Zankapfel
overview:
Zankapfel is a competitive voting platform where you can settle everyday conflicts with friends or complete strangers. Users vote users arguments over a given time and the winner wins the collected votes as an internal currency. On top of that it is possible to fight it out over a jackpot. The winner takes it all.

Munich based Zankapfel was angel-founded in 2007 and is run by CEO Marcus Janietz. The website is live since January 17th 2008.

name: Harmonix Music Systems
overview:
Harmonix Music Systems, Inc. operates as a videogame development company in Cambridge. It offers music games. The company offers Beatles and Rock Band music games in North America, Europe, Australia, and New Zealand.

Harmonix Music Systems, Inc. was founded in 1995 and is based in Cambridge, Massachusetts. As of October 27, 2006, Harmonix Music Systems, Inc. operates as a subsidiary of MTV Networks Company.

name: Myplaylist
overview:
Myplaylist is a picture / music playlist compiler. Users enter any artist then the search engines will crawl the web, compiling all the images and music that can be found for the band or artist. These will then be compiled into a playlist that can be watched and listened too online or embedded into any web page.

The playlists can be also made manually using the quick register system (no email required) then the user has total control over the images and music which they compile their playlist with.

Other interesting features include : 1) did you mean ‘correct spelling’ function for incorrect spellings, 2) upon completing a playlist, the system will search through all its data to discover the most similar playlist to the previous, and continue playing playlists within the genre first selected.

name: Guitarati
overview:
Guitarati is an online music store with an unconventional color based approach to music discovery.

Musical notes can elicit diverse emotions and each emotion can be mapped to a color. So when someone is looking for soothing music, they may be more likely to pick softer colors and in the same way, softer-colored music. In the same vein, Guitarati users can follow their instinct by picking colors and quickly find music they actually like. While they listen to a song, they can also mark it with various colors they are intuitively attracted to. Each song thus has a dominant color, resulting from collective color markings.

The music is offered in DRM free mp3 format. Users can listen to 192 kbps or better full-length songs or free samples. They pay 1 cent for each full-length song streaming, and these cents get deducted from the download price when they download the song.

Guitarati provides multiple revenue streams for bands and labels, as they get paid for song downloads as well as streaming. They decide the price of their music and retain 75% of the earnings. Record labels can manage their entire roster and earnings through a single dashboard. The website is free to use and there are no hosting or registration fees.
tag_list: guitarati, online-music, music-discovery, music-color-relationship, music, intuitive-music-discovery

name: Teet
overview: Teet is a prize giveaway site based in Latvia. The site uses fairly complex gameplay to increase the time users spend on the site. A giveaway is offered 24/7, and by “rolling a dice” when a timer stops, a random user ends up winning the prize. Points are also allocated by dice-rolls, as well as correctly guessing when the timer will stop. Point leaders at the end of the month are awarded “teets” which are assigned a dollar value, and can be used to buy other merchandise, with free shipping worldwide.

name: South Park Studios
overview:
South Park Studios, a joint venture between South Park creators Matt Stone and Trey Parker and Comedy Central, allows fans of South Park to stream any episode of the popular television series.

Revenues from the joint venture are being split 50/50 between Comedy Central and Stone/Parker.

acquisition.source_description: TechCrunch
name: FoxyTunes
overview:
FoxyTunes began in August 2004 as a Firefox toolbar extension allowing users to control all major media players on all major platforms from their browser. Since then FoxyTunes has added support for more than 30 music players and operability on Mozilla Thunderbird, Seamonkey, Flock, and Microsoft’s Internet Explorer. Customizable buttons and skins have also been added, as well as numerous additional features such as album cover displays and twitter/song status signatures.

The company plans to expand its business from the simple extension with its creation of FoxyTunes Planet, a music portal and “personalized music aggregator” that integrates with the extension as well as numerous major music services and providers.

FoxyTunes was acquired by Yahoo in February 2008 for an undisclosed sum amidst a shakeup of the Yahoo Music property.

name: Yamelo
overview:
Yamelo is a Web 2.0 music video search engine that lets you relive popular music from yesteryear.

Music can be found using three main tools: the search box, tag cloud, and most interestingly, through a linear time line slider. Users can select any month and year on the time slide and see the artists and songs from that year. A large selection of the artists’ music is then playable on Yamelo via embedded video which Yameo pulls from 3rd party sites including YouTube.

milestones:
[{"id":177,"description":"Velocix Acquires Exclusive License of RawFlow Live Streaming P2P Technology","stoned_year":2008,"stoned_month":7,"stoned_day":10,"source_url":"http://www.tmcnet.com/usubmit/2008/07/10/3539336.htm","source_text":"CAMBRIDGE, England --(Business Wire)-- Velocix(TM) (www.velocix.com), provider of the world's leading Digital Asset Delivery Network, today announced that it has acquired an exclusive license for RawFlow's P2P Streaming technology. Under the terms of this agreement, Velocix now has sole responsibility for selling and supporting RawFlow's Intelligent Content Delivery (ICD) solution.

Managing Application Performance by Understanding Applications  Learn more, download free white paper.
The Compelling ROI Benefits of Contact Center Quality and Performance Management Technologies. Learn more, download free white paper.
Xceed Contact Center â€“ Diversifying on Existing Strengths Learn more, download free white paper.
Disaster Recovery and Your Voice Messaging Learn more, download free white paper.
Voice Peering: Reduce time to market and risk. Learn more, download free white paper.
Business Process Improvement - Dramatically enhance business performance with IP communications Learn more, download free white paper.


Velocix will market ICD under the Velocix Live Streaming product family brand, adding a Hybrid-P2P Live Streaming option to a service line-up that already includes Live Video Streaming for Adobe Flash & Microsoft Windows Media, and Live Audio Streaming.

All existing RawFlow ICD customer and reseller partner relationships will migrate to Velocix, as will the healthy pipeline of new business prospects already interested in this solution.


Find Solutions for Enterprises, SMBs & Service Providers at the INTERNET TELEPHONY Conference and EXPO West, September 16-18, 2008. Los Angeles, California.
Find Solutions for Enterprises, SMBs & Service Providers at the INTERNET TELEPHONY Conference and EXPO West, September 16-18, 2008. Los Angeles, California.
Find Solutions for Enterprises, SMBs & Service Providers at the INTERNET TELEPHONY Conference and EXPO West, September 16-18, 2008. Los Angeles, California.
Find Solutions for Enterprises, SMBs & Service Providers at the INTERNET TELEPHONY Conference and EXPO West, September 16-18, 2008. Los Angeles, California.
Find Solutions for Enterprises, SMBs & Service Providers at the INTERNET TELEPHONY Conference and EXPO West, September 16-18, 2008. Los Angeles, California.
Find Solutions for Enterprises, SMBs & Service Providers at the INTERNET TELEPHONY Conference and EXPO West, September 16-18, 2008. Los Angeles, California.

"Our companies have been working together for several years, and Velocix has previously provided the Content Delivery Network behind our ICD technology," said Mikkel Dissing, CEO RawFlow. "With our recent change in business direction, RawFlow will now move to focus 100% on our SelfCast consumer proposition. We are delighted that Velocix will now exclusively represent our ICD products in the market, and feel sure our existing customers will be well served and supported by them."

"This acquisition rounds out our digital delivery services portfolio, extending the Hybrid-P2P delivery capabilities already available with our download services, to now also be available as an option with our video and audio live streaming services," said Phill Robinson, CEO at Velocix. "Hybrid-P2P Streaming provides scalability to the largest global audiences for online video and audio broadcasts whilst fundamentally disrupting the economics of live streaming on the Internet. With this announcement, Velocix further extends its lead in the provision of digital delivery services for large digital assets, offering the widest variety of online delivery options available on the market today."

Live events, including news, sports and music concerts, present significant online delivery challenges. Unlike on-demand services for pre-recorded materials where viewing requests are spread over time, live services result in concentrated demand from a potentially huge audience, just for the duration of the event. As a consequence, event organizers are often forced to compromise quality or limit audience sizes when using conventional live streaming services.

Hybrid-P2P Streaming blends delivery of live streams from the Velocix Network caches as well as sharing bandwidth from peers. Each participant is not only watching or listening to the live broadcast but is effectively relaying the signal to the other audience members (peers) at the same time. This community distribution process is managed in real-time by sophisticated control and routing algorithms hosted on the Velocix Network, ensuring required service levels and an uninterrupted experience for the entire audience.

The Velocix Network is designed to enable content owners, studios, and broadcasters to deliver video and other large digital assets, such as software, games and audio over the web, with unprecedented performance, breakthrough economics and an asset delivery lifecycle management system that provides content owners the control, analytics and reporting they need to manage their asset libraries through the digital distribution chain.","source_description":"Velocix Acquires Exclusive License of RawFlow Live Streaming P2P Technology","stoneable_type":"Company","stoned_value":null,"stoned_value_type":null,"stoned_acquirer":null,"stoneable":{"name":"Velocix","permalink":"velocix"}},{"id":1867,"description":"Alcatel-Lucent Acquires CDN Technology Provider Velocix","stoned_year":2009,"stoned_month":7,"stoned_day":30,"source_url":"http://blog.streamingmedia.com/the_business_of_online_vi/2009/07/alcatellucent-acquires-cdn-technology-provider-velocix.html","source_text":null,"source_description":"ALU acquires Velocix","stoneable_type":"Company","stoned_value":null,"stoned_value_type":null,"stoned_acquirer":null,"stoneable":{"name":"Velocix","permalink":"velocix"}}]

name: Comcast
overview: Comcast Corporation is the largest mass media and communications company in the world by revenue. It is the largest cable company and home Internet service provider in the United States, and the nation’s third largest home telephone service provider. Comcast provides cable television, broadband Internet, telephone service and in some areas home security (including burglar alarms, surveillance cameras, fire alarm systems and home automation) to both residential and commercial customers in 40 states and the District of Columbia.

name: Monkeysee
overview: MonkeySee is a new destination website providing free access to a large collection of professionally-produced and user-generated how-to videos. Visitors to MonkeySee will find a rapidly-growing library of videos on a wide variety of topics, presented in deep detail by accomplished, credible experts. It’s a great way to learn something new, and the perfect platform for experts to share their knowledge and increase their credibility, while getting valuable promotional exposure for their business or hobby.

name: NEHST Studios
overview: NEHST Studios is a company involved in the financing, production, and distribution for content that lives on screens of all sizes, from the TV to the PC. The company leverages new technologies to further enhance film projects in the $2-50 million range. The company’s founder, Larry Meistrich, also started the production company responsible for indie hits like Billy Bob Thornton’s “Sling Blade.”

name: walabok
overview: Walabok is a click-to-video-email button. It allows anyone to click on the button and send you a video/audio message from their browser without launching an external application. The walabok button can be added anywhere that supports html. You can add it on your blog, your online classifieds, email signature.

name: Televisa
overview: Grupo Televisa is the largest media company in the Spanish-speaking world and a major participant in the international entertainment business. It has interests in television production and broadcasting, production of pay-television networks, international distribution of television programming, direct to home satellite services, cable television and telecommunication services, magazine publishing and publishing distribution, radio production and broadcasting, professional sports and live entertainment, feature-film production and distribution, the operation of an internet portal, and gaming. Grupo Televisa also owns an unconsolidated equity stake in La Sexta, a free-to-air television venture in Spain and beyond.

name: Beep Interactive
overview:
Beep operates a variety of web and mobile based services. These services include:

Quick.as - is your one homepage for all devices. Your personal homepage has a search bar where you can select which site to search (Google, Wikipedia, Amazon, dictionary.com, Yelp, etc.), and “Quick Links”. These are like bookmarks and are compiled by analysing your browser history when you first visit. Then when you access Quick.as from a mobile it will direct you to pages optimized for the device you are using (i.e. on an iPhone, it will take you to i.facebook.com instead of www.facebook.com or m.facebook.com).

Recordle.com - A service allowing users to record audio, video and take photos directly from a web site. Using Flash (so there is no software to download), it detects your microphone and/or web camera and allows users to record.

smsGeezer.com - A service that allows the purchase of low cost SMS messages online and send them from either a web page, through email, or by uploading an Excel spreadsheet.

19secret.com - A service that allowing users to send anonymous and “masked” SMS (in Australia only). This service is no longer in operation.
tag_list: sms, personalized-homepage, homepage, search, record-video, flash-video

name: PluggedIn
overview:
At first glance, music might seem to be a saturated market on the web. Sites like Last.fm have music suggestions, artists profile, and communities covered, the iTunes and Amazon music stores make purchasing a breeze, and music videos can be found littered across Youtube.

It’s time to make room for one more, and it has the potential to be big. Pluggedin, a music video and community site that sees itself as a Hulu for music, launched in public beta on April 15, 2008. The site’s biggest selling point is its high quality video content, featuring music videos from labels including EMI, Sony BMG, and Universal Music Group, along with a number of independent labels. Pluggedin is hoping to add the last of the ‘big four’ labels, Warner Music, in the near future.

The Hulu comparison is an apt one. The site is very clean, video quality is generally much better than what’s found on Youtube, and the amount of content is impressive, though there are some noticeable gaps. At launch the site features over 10,000 available videos, but most of them are not available in true HD quality (largely because existing footage is not hi-def). Pluggedin hopes that as the site gains popularity, content providers will have a greater incentive to film music videos in HD.

Pluggedin does a good job integrating with other sites on the web. Users are provided with direct links to Amazon and iTunes if they’d like to purchase a video or song they’ve just listened to. And the site has formed a number of partnerships with merchandisers, including Hot Topic for clothing and Thumbplay for mobile ringtones. All of this is presented in unobtrusive menus that don’t detract from the experience at all.

The site also features profiles for over a million musicians, including those that don’t have any videos on the site. Profiles are dynamically generated using content from a number of sources, including All Music Guide, Last.FM, and Wikipedia. And while these pages don’t feature any ‘HD-quality’ material, they do provide a list of each artist’s music videos found elsewhere on the internet, all of which play seamlessly in the page.

Despite all of these features, the site still has a few issues. Searching for specific videos can be tricky - it seems that users can only search by artist name, not song title. And for a site that promotes its video quality, there are surprisingly few videos available in HD at launch (though this is mostly a fault of content providers).

PluggedIn looks like it could really explode. The social networking aspect is minimal, but sufficient for sharing music between friends. It’s a great timewaster - clicking through random music has never been this fun. And the playlist feature be will great for impromptu parties. As long as PluggedIn continues to add content and doesn’t go overboard with their ads, this site will be one to watch.

The site is backed by one of Will Smith’s companies.
tag_list: pluggedin, music, sony-bmg, umg, emi, music-videos, videos, hulu, will-smith

name: Sutros
overview:
Sutros is an audio management platform based on sharing and openness.

Sutros is a place where musicians can share their music through the creative commons. Listeners can download free music, listen to mp3s, and discover great new and local musicians.

name: imcandy
overview:
imcandy.com is a place for scripted videos. All videos are generated by users and based on clear structure, easy to watch and easy to find. Creators who wish to create videos according to imcandy’s scripts are rewarded for their efforts with bonuses and ad revenues sharing (adRoyalties).

imcandy presents a new concept for user generated video content (UGC). The company has developed a platform for scripted video content that offers videos based on the same story structure in different categories. Between online video and TV, imcandy is aiming to offer advantages of both: videos which are easy to watch and easy to find yet with high level of production. The company, co-founded by rich experienced web entrepreneurs, Avihai Ozana and Guy Bashan, who also formed Amadesa LTD, launched its Beta version in early Aug. 2008.

name: TiBconcerts
overview:
In popular music, independent music, often abbreviated as indie is a term used to describe genres, scenes, subcultures, styles and other cultural attributes in music, characterized by their independence from major commercial record labels and their autonomous, do-it-yourself approach to recording and publishing.

TiBconcerts.com provides independent music with a DIY solution to promote and sell their own concerts online.

TiBconcerts.com provides local music fans with complete listings of upcoming shows.
tag_list: concerts, concert-listings, independent-music, indie-bands, live-music, live-performance, local-shows, concert-promotion, concert-tickets, concert-sales

acquisition.source_description: KUDELSKI GROUP ACQUIRES MEDIOH!
name: Medioh!
overview:
Medioh is a video search engine powered by RSS video aggregation. Medioh! claims to enable users to create their own tailored viewing experience, “with access to the broadest range of content available on the web.” They offer an API to allow developers to manipulate a database of aggregated video feeds and create their own customized customer-facing application.

Features available through the API include searching and filtering by all sorts of information about a video, including its title, description, and tags, as well as information about its quality including resolution, duration, and codec.
tag_list: video, search, RSS, API, set-top-box, iPhone, mobile-video

name: Podbean LLC
overview:
Podbean is a podcast service provider which opened in Feb, 2006. The initial idea was simple: The site allows users to start podcasting in an easy point-and-click blog-like environment with little-to-no technical knowledge.

This web-based system allows users to publish, manage and promote podcasts in just a few clicks. it supports RSS 2.0 and atom feeds as well as the extended Apple iTunes podcasting tags. The web 2.0 based podcast player can be embedded into websites, blogs and social networks around the web.

All Podbean accounts come with a personalized podcast site and include the ability to extend branding efforts by integrating Podbean into their own website seamlessly and feed to the user’s own domain. In addition, the reporting and statistics system allows publishers to measure the success and growth of their podcasts.

The company extended the service to business clients in January, 2008. Podbean Business Podcasting Solutions provides private podcasting and multi-casting features to benefit businesses even creating multiple podcasts for selected target audiences, while allowing multiple authors and administrators so teams and department representatives can collaborate and connect with each other to delegate different types of podcasting responsibilities.

name: Drop Magazine
overview: Drop Magazine is an online magazine that provides a comprehensive range of content geared towards hip hop consumers. The site creates original content, accepts user-generated content submissions, and aggregates content of interest to hip hop consumers from around the internet.

name: MUBI
overview:
MUBI is your online cinema, anytime, anywhere. MUBI will give you the latest buzz from the Cannes Film Festival or a restored masterpiece personally chosen by Martin Scorsese (he’s a member, too!). A social network that can let you find a visual gem that will definitely not be released in the local multiplex and allows you to find a girl in Tokyo who loves Kubrick (she actually exists, her name is Yuko and she’s into Wong Kar-Wai too!). MUBI invites you to watch, discover and discuss distinctive visionary films from all over the world.

Founded in 2007 by Efe Cakarel, MUBI is backed by Celluloid Dreams, The Criterion Collection and Costa Films, supported by the MEDIA Programme of the European Union, and is the exclusive partner of The World Cinema Foundation and SONY Electronics. MUBI is based in Palo Alto, London, Paris, and New York.
tag_list: film, movie, cinema, video, art-house, social-media, social-network

name: Astream
overview:
Astream is a leading streaming hosting provider. Encoding and Hosting is provided in all formats via their own international servers and Live CDN. Also Live Webcasting, Net TV & Radio, IPTV, DRM and Streaming to cell phones. Customers include Nokia, BAFTA, Orange, History Channel, News International, Cadburys, Ofcom, Reebok & NDS.

Astream is the ‘Best Streaming’ provider 2007 & 2008 (ISPAs).

They have provided the live webcasting for The Who and extensive Video On Demand for Elton John for as well as conducting webcasts for New Order and Warner music artists. Astream has worked for such leading companies as CNBC Europe (NBC Universal, GE), Discovery Channel, History Channel, News International, BAFTA, Cadburys, Ofcom, Pearson, Procter & Gamble, Lonely Planet, NDS, Blackwell Publishing, Reebok, Mazda, Toyota, Citroen, and Mercedes Benz.

name: SuperVirals
overview:
SuperVirals Pty Limited was established to develop and launch the SuperVirals consumer-generated content platform for brands.

Operating since late 2006, the Sydney based company has been operating the website since August 2007 and has conducted international campaigns for brands including Fosters (VB beer), Hutchison Telecom (3 mobile), Mambo and Krispy Kreme Doughnuts.

The company has engaged a US sales development partner and expects to conduct its first US brand competition in early 2008.
tag_list: viral, video, media, UGC, consumer, brands, competition

name: Oortle
overview: Oortle is looking to bring the community aspect of media sharing to the web. Their products feature chats, emoticons, and other community interactions, centered around photos and video.

name: weeloop
overview: Weeloop is a social networking site, dedicated to the electronic music community. The site’s goal is to connect all aspects of the music world; from DJs, producers and labels, to event coordinators, clubs, associations and fans.

name: YouBeats
overview:
YouBeats.com is a hip hop music community that gives artists the opportunity to gain prime exposure through multiple rankings systems. Artists are ranked in charts based on the personal feedback of radio DJs, such as DJ Wonder of Sirius Radio and Hot 97. YouBeats also has automatically updating category charts, which ranks a song based on the number of times a track is played. YouBeats also offers customizable personal pages, free unlimited music hosting, and a discussion forum.

Listeners have access to free streaming and downloadable hip hop music, organized by genre, in addition to a customizable playlist.
tag_list: hip-hop, music-social-network, music-hosting, music-charts, indie-music, underground-music, rap

name: Calabash Music
overview: Calabash aims to apply the principles of microfinancing to the music industry. Calabash enables fans to deliver start-up capital to aspiring musicians around the world. Musicians obtain funding for new recordings from their fans without giving up ownership or control.

name: Chilirec
overview: Chilirec is a music site that extracts individual tracks from internet radio stations. It then lets you either play them back in the browser or download them as MP3 files for later usage.

name: Serious Business
overview:
Serious Business is a developer and producer of social games. The company was co-founded by Siqi Chen and Alex Le in early 2008 to develop games that take advantage of the rich social context of social network platforms.

Serious Business launched one of the first ever games on Facebook–Friends For Sale–which continues to top the Top 25 Games List and is one of the three first social games on the Facebook platform.

name: Blubert
overview: Blubert is a news portal for technology,world,health,sports and business. Blogs are included in news sources. The site clusters news/blogs similar to that of Google News. Startup are also reviewed on the website.

name: Anistock
overview: Anistock provides a library of royalty-free stock animation and video backgrounds.

name: twit+
overview: twit+ works on top of Twitter to let users send pictures, video, and other files to their friends on Twitter.
tag_list: twitter, video, picture, file-share, micro-blogging, blogginb, file-exchange, secure-file-share

name: URockHard
overview: URockHard is a user generated social and personal music video network. Users can create profiles, upload, comment and share video clips of themselves and friends jamming. All site users with established profiles can post videos, upload pictures and create email accounts to share their comments and experiences with other users.

name: Kabam
overview: Kabam is the leader in the western world for free-to-play core games with first and third party published titles available on mobile devices via the Apple Store, Google Play, Amazon Appstore, and on the Web via Facebook, Yahoo, Kabam.com and other platforms. In each of the last two years Kabam revenues have grown by 80 percent or more and will total more than $325 million in 2013. The company is profitable and has created four titles that, by the end of the year, will have grossed over $100M each in their life. Kabam’s Kingdoms of Camelot franchise has grossed more than $250 million in less than four years, making it one of the top 10 strategy franchises of all time. In 2012, Kabam Publishing was launched to provide third-party developers access to Kabam’s technology platform, distribution channels, data analytics and best practices that Kabam’s in-house development teams use to bring wildly successful games to players worldwide. Kabam has approximately 650 employees across three continents, with corporate headquarters in San Francisco. The company’s investors include Google, Warner Brothers, MGM, Intel, Canaan Partners, Redpoint Ventures, Pinnacle Ventures and others. More information about Kabam can be found at www.kabam.com.

acquisition.source_description: CraveOnline Acquires MyAnimeList
name: MyAnimeList
overview: MyAnimeList is a social network for anime and manga fans. MyAnimeList provide users a customizable ‘listing’ feature to show other users what anime or manga they have watched or read. Users can read anime and manga reviews and connect to other users who read and watch same things as they do. MyAnimeList also offers a database with anime,manga and person information.

name: Datz
overview:
Datz is a digital music platform with an online music store and a community-oriented site.

Datz allows emerging artists to upload their own music to promote themselves. Users can create their own blogging pages to recommend and discuss the latest Datz music. Fans can communicate directly with artists via the Datz blog. In addition Datz.com provides e-ticketing, a gig calendar, event reminders and recommended downloads of the week.

name: Turbine
overview: Turbine creates and operates online games. It is one of the largest privately-held online gaming studios in North America. Turbine’s online games include The Lord of the Rings Online, Shadows of Angmar, Dungeons & Dragons Online, Stormreach and Asheron’s Call.

name: XSketch
overview:
XSketch is a multiplayer social word sketch online game similar to Pictionary. A player sketches a picture with the goal of having other players guess your word and vice versa. Users can play games to get points to compete in monthly competitions.

Created by Ryan Dewsbury who also created gpokr and kdice.

name: Streamzy
overview: Streamzy is a music search engine that allows users to search for media and stream it. Users can create and save their own playlists. Streamzy is powered by Seeqpod.
tag_list: musicsearch, music, search, seeqpod, streamzy, video

name: Rekatu
overview:
Rekatu is a micro-networking site designed to allow friends to express themselves through pictures and music.

Micro-network is a social network that attempts to map user connections to each other based on activity and defined proximity. Micro-networking allows circles of friends to communicate on different privacy levels. Therefore, a user base can be large, however, each user feels as if they are part of a close-knit group.

name: GPokr
overview: GPokr is a free Texas hold em poker game. It is programmed in Java, AJAX, and GWT.

name: GodTube
overview: GodTube is a video-driven Christian social network site that aims to connect users with friends, family, co-workers, testimonies and ministries. Users can created their own blogs and forums and also upload videos and photos to share with other users.

name: Jinni
overview:
Jinni is a semantic discovery engine for movies and TV shows helping viewers find what fits their personal moods and tastes. The service is powered by the Entertainment Genome™, created by analyzing metadata and reviews to automatically catalog video across thousands of parameters. Jinni offers a website for users and APIs for TV content providers and large content catalog owners.

My TV & Movie Guide iPad app available for free in iTunes appstore.

name: Citizen Sports
overview: Citizen Sports offers a number of web applications that allow for interaction between fans. They also are the creators of Protrade.com, where users can buy, sell, and trade their favorite sports figures as they try to win money.

name: Text America
overview: TextAmerica is a mobile photo sharing and moblog site. Users can send their pictures and videos directly from their mobile phones. TextAmerica provides each user a personal mobile web site where they can view the items they have posted from their mobile phones. With TextAmerica, users can also post their images and videos on other web sites.

name: FantasyBook
overview:
FantasyBook develops fantasy sports games for the Facebook platform.

Launched in December 2007, FantasyBook received seed funding by Bay Partners as part of their AppFactory Program.

After the successful launch of fantasy baseball and fantasy football games on Facebook, FantasyBook was acquired by Citizen Sports in late 2008. FantasyBook’s social fantasy baseball, football, and soccer games went on to gain over 1M users. Citizen Sports was subsequently acquired by Yahoo! Sports.

name: CrowdChess
overview: CrowdChess is a site that takes the “wisdom of the masses” concept and applies it to chess. Members are assigned to teams, where they vote on each move.

milestones:
[{"id":376,"description":"comScore ranks OVGuide.com Third-Fastest Growing Web Property in the US","stoned_year":2008,"stoned_month":8,"stoned_day":5,"source_url":"http://www.reuters.com/article/pressRelease/idUS128912+05-Aug-2008+MW20080805","source_text":"BEVERLY HILLS, CA, Aug 05 (MARKET WIRE) -- 
OVGuide.com, the Internet's most comprehensive guide to online video
sites, including TV shows, movies, user-generated content and games,
today announced that comScore has ranked it the third-fastest growing Web
property in the US, in terms of audience size, from May 2007-2008. Other
impressive 2008 results for the company to-date include visits from more
than 100 million individuals in total from around the globe.
Additionally, the site now receives 12 million unique visitors per
month(1).

    2008 has been a year of explosive growth in online video. A recent report
issued by Integrated Media Measurement revealed that more than 20% of
Americans watched some prime-time TV on a computer during the spring TV
season, which is a 233% increase compared to the fall of 2007(2).
OVGuide.com has experienced a similar surge in popularity. According to
Alexa.com, OVGuide.com has, since the beginning of the year, gone from
being outside the top 1,000 Web properties to a top 150 site in the US; is
one of the UK's top 130 most visited Web sites; and is overall a top 1,000
site in more than 20 countries.

    OVGuide.com also issued its July online video alert today, identifying the
most popular movie and television destinations, video genres and search
terms for the past month. The results include:


Top five searches:
1.  Hancock
2.  The Love Guru
3.  The Dark Knight
4.  WALL-E
5.  Hellboy II

Top five genres:
1.  Movies / TV
2.  Anime
3.  General / Viral
4.  Games
5.  Sports

OVGuide.com new addition 'highlights':
1.  Beijing Olympics 2008
2.  CrashTestKitchen
3.  Cycling.TV
4.  GeekBrief.TV
5.  Magicians.com
6.  Men's Health
7.  Tidio
8.  TravelPod.com
9.  Vlaze.com
10. TheWineryChannel.tv

    
"I founded OVGuide.com in 2006 as I saw the need for a destination to
help individuals find online video, and sites at the time did not provide
a viable solution," said Dale Bock, founder and president of OVGuide.com.
"We have dedicated the past two years to scouring the Web for the best,
high-quality video sites to include in our comprehensive database. Our
dedicated editorial team that categorizes each outlet by genre has also
helped our search engine become the most accurate in the industry. We are
continuing to strive to be the destination for consumers to search and
discover online video content, and are thrilled with the progress we have
made in the industry."

    OVGuide.com processed 11 million searches in July and averaged over eight
page views per user. To find out more about OVGuide.com or discover the
most popular sites in online video, please visit www.ovguide.com.

    About OVGuide.com

    Founded in 2006, OVGuide.com is the Internet's most comprehensive guide to
online video sites, including TV shows, movies, user-generated content and
video games. Headquartered in Los Angeles, the privately-held company
delivers an innovative, user-friendly way to search and browse relevant,
high-quality video content on the Web. OVGuide.com currently indexes more
than 2,000 online destinations, offering both short- and long-form video
integrated into an intuitive and categorized directory. The site offers a
very relevant, powerful search engine, receiving more than 11 million
visitors, 80 million page views and 10 million searches per month.
OVGuide.com's team of experienced editors review all video sites prior to
listing them, ensuring all content listed is valuable and categorized
appropriately.

name: OVGuide
overview:
OVGuide is THE destination site to search and discover free online high quality videos on the Web.

OVGuide.com is the #1 independent online video guidance site and has the most comprehensive and up-to-date guide to online video, including TV shows, movies, user-generated content and video games. Headquartered in Los Angeles, the privately held company was founded by Dale Bock in 2006. The company is backed by Baroda Ventures, whose founder David Bohnett was also the founder of GeoCities that was once ranked as one of the four most trafficked sites on the Web, went public in 1998 and was subsequently acquired by Yahoo! in 1999.

Content discovery features include editor’s pick videos, content browsing tools, movie/TV browse tools and listings of real-time keyword searches. The site receives more than 12 million unique visitors every month and was named by Time Magazine as a Top 10 Best Website of the year when the site first launched in 2006.

name: Layerstream
overview:
Layerstream Technologies offers a content distribution platform that targets streaming live content over shared IP networks, such as the Internet, where throughput and latency are always changing.

Layerstream is able to circumvent the traditional problems caused by network congestions by applying its patented stream-layering technology which makes data streams immune to large bandwidth fluctuations and allows it to always guarantee real-time delivery, regardless of whether the streams contain high-definition video, audio, financial data, or any type of proprietary, custom data.

name: sevenload
overview:
sevenload is a social media network for WebTV, videos and photos. The sevenload channels offer free premium-tv-shows, official music videos, exclusive internet television as well as user generated content. Every channel combines professional videos with independent, intelligent and creative content from users producing their own content as well as professional production companies.

sevenload was founded in 2006. sevenload is a global social media platform for photos, videos and interactive show formats. The community enables users to manage and share their photos and videos online for free. The site offers an array of more than 1.200 different interactive WebTV/internet shows in more than 20 languages and various categories. In addition, some of the available channels are from famous and popular artists and musicians.

As a new media company, sevenload positions itself as a provider for crossmedial marketing and modern video technology. Part of itscore business comes from the conceptualization, development and production of IPTV based internet platforms, software solutions for Web 2.0 applications as well as technology development for third party companies looking for video player, video uploading, video linking and distribution technologies. sevenload has already worked with internationally renound companies such as BMW, Endemol, National Geographic, BBC, Deutsche Welle, Sony Music, Universal Music, and offers companies individual white label solutions.

Company executive are Andreas Heyden (CEO) and Dr. Roland Schlager. Company founders include Ibrahim Evsan (Founder), Thomas Bachem (Co-Founder) and Axel Schmiegelow (Co-Founder and Board Member). Company investors are DLD Ventures (Hubert Burda Media) and dw capital GmbH.

name: RouteNote
overview: RouteNote is a user driven music distribution service. The site connects indie artists with major online retailers and makes their music available for licensing.

name: Fuzz
overview:
Looking to build engagement and retention in your app, website, or game? Thought about adding music? Feed.fm is a music API that allows game publishers, online retailers, and app developers to enhance their products with popular music to drive consumer engagement, retention, and revenues. We provide a turn-key, compliant streaming solution that allows your users to hear relevant, engaging, and curated music. We take care of the billing, licensing, compliance, and reporting hassles ensuring that you meet the legal requirements and allow you to focus on building an awesome product.

Empirical research shows that music increases consumer spending up to 78% in brick-and-mortar settings, such as retail, dining, and gaming establishments (Journal of Retailing and Consumer Services, 2012) and increases session times on websites (Lai et al., 2011). But using music in the online world is a costly technical and legal nightmare and has proved to be impracticable for most businesses.

You can check out our API documentation at http://feed.fm/documentation, our iOS SDK at https://github.com/fuzz-radio/iOS-SDK and our Javascript SDK at https://github.com/fuzz-radio/Javascript-SDK. Check out the Fuzz Radio app at (https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/id577300833) which is an in-depth demo of all of the capabilities of our API. By building on our platform, you can integrate any published music into your web and mobile apps in minutes and see immediate benefits in your session time, retention, user satisfaction, and revenue at a reasonable budget.

Feed.fm was founded by the team that created Blip.fm, and includes Chairman Mika Salmi, former President of MTV along with advisors from executive positions at EA, Billboard, ClearChannel, Rhapsody, RealNetworks, Netflix, SESAC, Ooga Labs, Turner Broadcasting, Twitch.tv/Justin.tv, ngmoco/DeNA, and GameStop Digital Ventures, and GameSalad.

name: Hobnox
overview:
Hobnox is the entertainment network for creatives and their friends.

It is an initiative to provide networking and creation tools for self-determined artistic expression on the Internet. The Hobnox Metabolism brings all of these elements together on the one platform.

Hobnox launched in spring 2008, combining community, production and publishing functions with web TV channels Sly-Fi, CLTR/CTRL and 99stories into one online-organism. Since June 2008, the site is in its beta phase whilst development and enhancement continue.

The Hobnox technology, editorial and management offices are located in Cologne and Berlin.

name: Sometrics
overview:
Founded in 2007 and based in El Segundo, Calif., Sometrics, a wholly-owned subsidiary of American Express, is helping publishers market free-to-play online games and monetize virtual currency with a consumer destination site and the industryâ€™s most advanced in-game payment solutions. Sometricsâ€™ payment processing, optimization and analytics platform is also being used to support Serve, American Expressâ€™ new digital payments and commerce platform, to deploy virtual currencies and loyalty programs on a global scale.

GameCoins.com, an online games discovery and user acquisition platform, connects gamers with publishers through fun activities and relevant content. Game Coins members have the opportunity to discover new games through Missions, Raffles and other branded activities and earn Game Coins currency that can then be redeemed for many top online games, as well as Facebook Credits via their App2User program. The destination offers publishers access to an audience of millions of dedicated gamers around the world. For more information about GameCoins, please visit http://www.gamecoins.com/.

With Sometricsâ€™ in-game payment and optimization platform, game publishers gain a new revenue source that enhances existing payment methods and increases conversions among paying users. The company offers dozens of payment options in over 100 countries including credit cards, mobile, pre-paid cards, bank transfers and more, in addition to hundreds of brand engagement ads. Sometricsâ€™ payment management and optimization platform allows publishers to maximize revenue through existing payment methods while enhancing user conversion via advanced analytics tools. For more information on the in-game payment and optimization platform, please visit http://sometrics.com/.

Sometrics raised $2 million in capital in its first round of funding, led by the Mail Room Fund, an investment consortium that combines big Hollywood (the William Morris Talent Agency) with Silicon Valley (Accel and Venrock) venture capitalists, in addition to co-investors AT&T and Greycroft Partners. Series B financing totaling $4 million was closed in October of 2009, led by Steamboat Ventures and including the Mail Room Fund and Greycroft.

milestones:
[{"id":3819,"description":"Netflix-For-Videogames Gamefly Files For $50 Million IPO","stoned_year":2010,"stoned_month":2,"stoned_day":10,"source_url":"http://www.businessinsider.com/netflix-for-videogames-gamefly-files-for-50-million-ipo-2010-2","source_text":"Gamefly, a mail-in video game rental service -- think Netflix for videogames -- has filed for a $50 million IPO.

Here's the details:

    * Gamefly has 334,000 subscribers.
    * It has sales of $46.4 million for the six months ended September 30, up from $38.4 million the year prior.
    * Net income in the same period was $3 million, down from $5.4 million the year prior.
    * Operating income was $6 million versus $2.5 million the year before.
    * For fiscal year ended March 31, 2009, Gamefly generated $84.7 million in revenue.
    * Gamefly also operates a network of video game sites that draws 4.4 million uniques, most of whom are not subscribers.
    * Gamefly has penetrated a tiny portion of the video game market (~1%), so it sees room for growth.
    * Subscriptions to Gamefly start at $15.95 per month.
    * Money raised from the IPO will go towards towards general corporate purposes.
    * David Hodess, CEO and President of Gamefly, was paid $390,911 in total compensation for 2009.
    * Underwriters are Piper Jaffray, Bank of America-Merrill, Cowen and Company, William Blair & Company.
","source_description":"Netflix-For-Videogames Gamefly Files For $50 Million IPO","stoneable_type":"Company","stoned_value":null,"stoned_value_type":null,"stoned_acquirer":null,"stoneable":{"name":"GameFly","permalink":"gamefly"}}]
name: GameFly
overview:
GameFly rents and delivers video games to customers via post mail, following the Netflix model. For a flat monthly fee, users can rent as many games as they want and keep them for as long as they want.

GameFly does not have due dates or late fees, and includes pre-paid mail both ways.

GameFly offers top games for PS3, PS2, PSP, Xbox 360, Xbox, Wii, GameCube, DS and GBA.

name: Fliqz
overview:
Fliqz is a plug and play video solution for websites that requires no software download and competes directly against Brightcove.

They offer 5 different packages starting with a free basic player which is ad funded which includes 25 uploads, and 500 streams, to a platinum package which costs $999/month with a $7500 development fee, but it includes 5,000 uploads, 250,000 streams, and allows for complete customization of the player.

name: PodComics Studio
overview:
PodComics Studio creates the worlds first daily animated Web series, the “Traveling Gringos” (Monday-Friday).

The “Traveling Gringos” is an animated Web series with a continuing story line following the travel stories of Eric and Pat. Launched on the internet in February of 2008.

Traveling Gringos is produced and animated by the real Traveling Gringos, Eric Levasseur and Patrick Davidson. Their studio, PodComics Studio, is based in Costa Rica. Both co-founders are originally from California.

The goal of their studio is to achieve a following as large as South Park or Family Guy, either on the internet or through traditional television.

name: Kamera
overview: Kamera develops and operates thematic TV channels for mobile and online distribution. Kamera works with the Associated Press, Disney-ABC, SNTV, and other blue-chip content owners to package and distribute an array of time-sensitive, IPTV content. As of May 2008, Kamera’s content is carried by over 70 online corporate customers and over 40 mobile carriers worldwide. Kamera’s headquarters are in Stockholm, with local offices in Singapore and Cairo.

name: sph3re
overview:
sph3re.tv is a video portal dedicated to animation and animators.

The first goal of sph3re.tv is to entertain via animations. The second part of sph3re.tv is it’s resume & schools database growing every day. From a video you can discover who made it, and see what company or school the creator is associated with.

name: itMayBe Media
overview:
ItMayBe Media is a network of web products occupying social media and entertainment spaces.

Their current flagship product, elbo.ws, is a music blog aggregator and search engine.

external_links: [{"external_url":"http://www.webware.com/8301-1_109-9856722-2.htm","title":"Open Television Network: YouTube meets iTunes?"},{"external_url":"http://www.capria.tv/?p=206","title":"Apple TV, Open Television Network, and the independent"},{"external_url":"http://www.afeedisborn.com/rss-powered-online-video-marketplace-is-launched/","title":"RSS powered digital marketplace launched!"}]
name: Open Television Network
overview:
The Open Television Network provides a web service called klickTab that enables audio and video content owners to sell their content within an RSS feed inside standard ‘podcast’ aggregators. The klickTab system is an unmediated marketplace open to any content owner who wants to sell in a non-discriminatory manner. Each merchant creates their own account and hosts their own content. They enter metadata on content items within the klickTab system and can sell individual items in an RSS feed (that sends the media item to their aggregator of choice) or they can create channel feeds analogous to standard podcasts. Merchants get embed codes for the single item sale, or for the channel feeds they create. We provide a template for easily creating a store within the merchant’s site in addition to the embed code for item and feeds.

The OpenTVNetwork.com site is used to showcase content available in the system. Content can be purchased there, and feeds subscribed to. Open Television Network takes 15% of the price the merchant sets for their content. Affiliates (when available) will get 15% from the merchant’s share, unless the merchant opts out of affiliate sales.

name: hearwhere
overview:
HearWhere is local live music search. With a world-wide database of live shows, and the ability to sample music, HearWhere makes it easy to discover a great live music experience anywhere in the world.

HearWhere crawls music related sites looking for show event information, and then manages the results and sorts them into a usable format.

HearWhere connects you to tickets (when available), and with the new Facebook Connect integration, can show you when artists you’ve tagged are playing, or get recommendations from friends.

HearWhere.com - Find Live Music Anywhere

name: iWin
overview:
iWin is a leading developer and publisher of online casual games for the mass market. The company offers free games and premium download games games through its web site iWin.com. As of Spring 2007, the web site offers customers a new game every day. There are also numerous multiplayer games such as Family Feud Online Party with chat, profiles, friends list, and a thriving community.

Additionally, a new Hotel iWin product adds a social networking and virtual world component to casual gameplay. Players earn a virtual currency called Opals based on gameplay and can spend them decorating hotel rooms or avatars.

iWin also distributes its games through several leading web properties including Yahoo, RealNetworks, MSN, Shockwave and AOL.

name: Pangaeaa Enterprises
overview:
Pangaeaa is a community for all types of artists who want to display and sell their work from musicians to painters.

Pangaeaa wants to bring the art community including people looking for talent together hence the name which is similar to Pangaea the super continent. As an artist you have a place to show your work to the world and participating is free. Pangaeaa makes sure that all artists are promoted on the site. New artists are randomly displayed at the bottom of the site 24 artists at a time. The artists must choose to be featured on the home page and they will be queued until their queue reaches the top and then they will be featured on the homepage for 48 hours with another artist. Artists receive 90% of the profit when they sell their work. For users looking for talent you can search through the site by choose from the three categories, literature, art and music. Each category has sub categories for example music has the sub categories: rock, hip hop, R&B, Christian, alternative, and other. You can then read the artist’s profile and purchase their work if you like.
tag_list: social-networking, art, music, literature, talent, painting, photoography, online-community

name: Codemasters
overview: Codemasters is a developer and publisher of interactive entertainment products for a global audience across multiple gaming platforms and channels. Established in 1986, the company’s brands include Colin McRae: DiRT, Overlord, Race Driver: GRID and Operation Flashpoint. Codemasters is headquartered in Warwickshire UK, with North American operations based in Universal City, California. The company also maintains operations in Germany, France, Spain, Benelux and Malaysia. As of May 2008, Codemasters receives over two million visitors to its site.

name: PurePlay
overview: PurePlay is a play-for-cash online poker game. Through a patented business model, PurePlay enables players to compete for cash without putting their own money at risk. Players compete by paying monthly fee. The company was founded in November 2004. As of May 2008, PurePlay has awarded over $3 million and has over 1,000,000 players.

name: Soundflavor
overview: Soundflavor (formerly Siren Systems) is a web-based platform of search, discovery, and recommendation services for music. Initially the company focused exclusively on selling their services to commercial entities, but they’ve since broadened their market to go after consumers as well.

name: IndieFlix
overview: IndieFlix.com was founded in 2005 and is a Seattle-based independent film distribution and discovery site founded on the principles of community, promotion, syndication and transparency. IndieFlix allows independent filmmakers to non-exclusivey sell their films while maintaining their rights. A pro-film and pro-filmmaker company, IndieFlix seeks to bridge the gap between film festival favorites and ever-elusive distribution.

name: ConcertAttack
overview:
ConcertAttack is a live music social network that provides a platform for artists and fans to share their concert experiences through their concert pictures, reviews, videos and tour journals.

At ConcertAttack, users can share their concert pictures, videos and reviews, recommend artists, and use widgets to place their concert content on other web sites. Users can also create video tour journals and share them with friends.

ConcertAttack also organizes concert content by artist, location and date.

In 2005 Monte Cristo set up an office in Kiev, Ukraine, in order to deploy the team sizes required for future production with greater ease. external_links: [{"external_url":"http://www.tokyotronic.com/2007/11/how-to-register-for-nico-nico-douga.html","title":"How to register for Nico Nico Douga in English"},{"external_url":"http://asiajin.com/blog/tag/niconico-douga/","title":"English Nico Nico Douga news"}]
name: Niwango
overview:
Niwango, Inc. is operating Nico Nico Douga, Japan’s second largest online video portal after Youtube. The site is only available in Japanese.

The user-generated site was established in January 2007 and became one of the fastest-growing web services in the Japanese history. As of May 2008, Nico Nico Douga has over 7 million members (regular and mobile version combined) and gets around 2 billions page views a month. Users uploaded a total of 1.1 million videos.

Nico Nico Douga is mostly frequented by young Japanese males. In contrast to Youtube, most of the content is focused on Japanese pop culture (anime, video-game, footage, Japanese pop music videos etc.).

The site offers a unique comment function enabling users to communicate via texts placed directly on top of the videos. Japanese users spend twice as much time on Nico Nico Douga as they do on Youtube. In total, over 1.2 billion comments were added to Nico Nico Douga until May 2008.

name: MeDeploy
overview:
MeDeploy’s media sales syndication technology allows consumers to purchase and consume feature film content directly from any point of discovery on the Internet, such as a movie review website, social network, blog or community.

MeDeploy has developed what it calls the “MeDeploy Engine”. The MeDeploy Engine can be added to any website easily using our Developer API, and turns your website into a place where your user’s can find, purchase and download their favorite Hollywood movies. The MeDeploy Engine allows for the entire shopping experience to happen within your website allowing for direct media sales while retaining users. No longer does monetization mean driving valuable traffic away to affiliate retailers. Plus MeDeploy lets you tailor what movies you would like to make available to match your user’s demographic and interests. The MeDeploy Engine also collects data about your user’s shopping and media viewing habits and makes all this data available to you from MeDeploy’s Dashboard.

overview: OneScreen is a digital video company that empowers publishers, producers, and advertisers with a network to discover opportunities, a platform to manage operations, a marketplace to transact business, and services to enhance strategies. Our technologies and solutions are shaping the new digital video economy, where audiences are watching everywhere. We have been recognized as a fast growing company by Inc 500, a forerunner in industry innovation by The Stevie Awards, and a great place to work by The Orange County Business Journal.

name: snuzu
overview:
snuzu lets you keep track of the music you play and share your listening history with your friends.

Once installed on a computer, snuzu works with iTunes, Winamp or Windows Media Player to instantly update your profile page with the music played on your computer.

snuzu also offers an embeddable HTML widget to display recent tracks on your blog or website, as well as a Facebook application to share favorite music with friends and see what they have listened to.

name: TriFame
overview: TriFame is an interactive website that allows users to submit and vote on content in the areas of music, dance, and modeling. The top rated content will receive periodic prizes. These prizes will range from video games and MP3 players to cold hard cash. Additionally, there will be yearly prizes for the best content that could include record deals, modeling contracts, or thousands of dollars in cash. It is our vision to become the premier source of talent on the internet. TriFame will create value for its users by getting exposure for the artists, entertaining the viewers, connecting artists and their fans, and rewarding top performers. Whether you want to be entertained, win some cash, or want to get discovered, TriFame is the place to go.

name: eJamming
overview:
eJamming allows musicians located anywhere to get together for jam sessions. Your drummer is in New York, lead guitar is in India, your bass player is somewhere else, and you’re on keyboard. No problem. eJamming lets you jam anyway. And you can talk to the other musicians via a VOIP feature.

All you need is digital instrument (midi enabled) and an internet connected computer. Download the client (Mac or PC), and either get the old band back together virtually or find a musician on the service.

name: bendecho
overview:
bendecho is a portal for social videosharing in German-speaking countries and for English-speaking people. Members can post links to their favorite videos and thus save videos from lots of different video portals, making them available to others.

The video directory works like a traditional video portal with integrated social networking. Anyone can participate and rate videos and leave comments.

via: bendecho

name: onTV Europe
overview:
onTV provides metadata for all scripted TV series for which full episodes are available online. The XML-based metadata feeds cover US networks (ABC, CBS, Fox, NBC, SciFi, The CW, The N, USA Network), UK channels (BBC iPlayer, ITV, 4oD and Five) as well as TV shows available online through aggregators, such as iTunes and iTunes GB, AOL video, Amazon Unbox and BitTorrent. Extended data set includes information enabling geo-filtering of content access by users.

Coverage of the onTV feed is being extended to include movies available online through Amazon Unbox and iTunes - to be followed by other major online movie suppliers. It is its objective to be the main source for metadata on professionally produced quality content online, as it becomes available. Coverage of other geographical markets and formats is planned for the months ahead.

Besides metadata services, onTV’s own TV metadata publishing framework can be used in other analytical and publishing projects.

milestones:
[{"id":1406,"description":"Dizzywood Surpasses One Million Registered Users ","stoned_year":2009,"stoned_month":2,"stoned_day":5,"source_url":"","source_text":"Online game and virtual world for kids launches paid subscriptions for enhanced features and new content.
 San Francisco, Calif. â€” February 5, 2009 â€” Dizzywood (www.dizzywood.com), an online game and virtual world for children ages 8-12, announced today that it has surpassed the milestone of one million registered players. Dizzywood launched a beta version of the site in November 2007 and since then, has experienced rapid growth with thousands of new users joining daily. The company also announced that it launched its paid membership model this month. Dizzywood remains free to try, while paid memberships unlock premium content and features. The memberships are available in two tiers; Gold Explorer memberships are priced at $9.95 per month and Silver Explorer memberships cost $6.95 per month. â€œDizzywood provides a place where kids can play in a fun, safe, and imaginative environment. We are thrilled that over one million players have already begun exploring everything that Dizzywood has to offer,â€ said Scott Arpajian, co-founder and CEO of Dizzywood, â€œThrough the rapid adoption of the game, our players are telling us that they are excited about the collaborative and cooperative game-play that sets Dizzywood apart.â€
About Dizzywood
Dizzywood's mission is to inspire young people to use their imagination and have fun, while learning real-life values and skills. Dizzywood's creative, story-driven world offers children a safe virtual environment where they can explore worlds unlike any other, engage in challenging activities and cooperate with others, while developing important cognitive skills. Kids are appropriately challenged with games and activities that earn unique super powers and other creative rewards. New content such as clothing, missions and areas are always underway, keeping players motivated to return and experience the new features. For more information, visit www.dizzywood.com.
