name: Dizzywood
overview:
Dizzywood is a virtual world for kids between ages 8-12. In Dizzywood, kids can play games, explore imaginative areas in a virtual world, and meet new friends in a safe place

Launched in November, 2007 Dizzywood aims to inspire kids to use their imagination and have fun, while learning real-life values and skills. Dizzywood closed down in January 31, 2011 and all members and players on Dizzywood were transfered to another virtual world (Secretbuilders.com)

name: LyricFind
overview:
LyricFind aggregates licensing and content for the use of song lyrics in digital applications, including web sites, music services, hardware devices, and more.

LyricFind has licensed from over 2,700 music publishers, including EMI, Universal, Sony/ATV, and Warner-Chappell, enabling the company to offer a massive catalog of licensed lyrics for use online.

LyricFind powers lyric services on over 1,000 different web sites, mobile applications, and digital music services, including Bing, Shazam, Slacker, SongMeanings.net, Lyrics.com, Universal Music, LyricsBay.com, Virgin Media, and many more.

LyricFind also offers popular iPhone, iPad and Android applications, Lyrics Lite and Lyrics Pro.

name: Knowledge Adventure
overview: Knowledge Adventure® is the leader in adventure-based 3D virtual worlds for 3-to-10 year old kids. With its JumpStart® and Math Blaster® products, kids learn through endless gaming adventures in 3D virtual worlds. By blending learning and entertainment, Knowledge Adventure’s adventure-based learning inspires kids’ minds through immersed play. For more than 15 years, Knowledge Adventure has set the standard in kids’ software by creating the finest educational products for use in the home and the classroom. The company is internationally renowned for its award-winning products. A subsidiary of Knowledge Holdings, Inc., the company is privately-held and based in Torrance, California.

name: Vroengard Academy
overview: Vroengard Academy is a virtual game developed by Random House Publishers and based on the Inheritance cycle novels by bestselling author Christopher Paolini. Players can learn to become Dragon Riders through a series of fun and challenging trials (mental, magic, and physical), as they are tested with puzzles and clues. It will work as an online and offline scavenger hunt, where players look for exclusive clues in both the real world and online. These clues will include messages delivered from the author, as well as participating Random House retail partners.

Its an information based service with audio guides explaining as much as possible the whole story about that building.

The goal is to develop like Wikipedia with information being central to the video and eventually letting users download videos on to mobile devices so they can be used as guides, points of reference or even for research.

name: Sivoo
overview:
Sivoo provides IT infrastructure for IP video, and has created a digital-media asset management solution to intake, encode, distribute, and monetize video across distribution channels including Internet, mobile, IPTV, and cable using Internet protocol (IP).

This solution is called CEDR, which is an acronym describing the life-cycle of IP-managed video (Capture, Encode, Distribute, and Report). CEDR leverages what we call “cluster-in-cloud computing” in order to radically transform this life-cycle from a cost-intensive, geographically specific, and hardware-dependent process to a cost efficient, decentralized, and software based process that resides in the “cloud.” CEDR has been developed by SIVOO and is proprietary to the Company.

CEDR creates digital video assets from any format or source including Satellite, Internet stream, hard media, or digital file; encodes captured video into any and/or multiple specifications like CableLabs, Flash, Windows Media, Quicktime, H.264, MPEG2, etc.; distributes these assets to any IP video or broadcast distribution outlet; and tracks the views and monetization of assets in a single report.

With CEDR, video assets are easily and automatically managed and distributed by and between MSOs, content aggregators, and distribution outlets. CEDR allows customers to pull video assets between locations as either a file or as a stream-link on the Internet Edge. CEDR can also push video assets to Internet sites like YouTube and MetaCafe, mobile platforms like Verizon V-Cast, IPTV providers like Verizon FIOS TV and Verismo, and cable companies like Comcast.

CEDR distribution outlets include AOL, Brightcove, Charter Communications, eyespot, Grouper, Guba, HotWire, iFilm, iTunes Podcasts, Joost, jumpcut, JumpTV, MediaMelon, MetaCafe, MobiTV, MySpace, SES Americom, Terra, Verismo, Verizon FIOS TV, Verizon V-Cast, Videoegg, Vimeo, VOY, VSocial, and YouTube. SIVOO is actively growing its distribution reach.

SIVOO earns fees from processing video through CEDR and shares in the advertising revenue generated by views across CEDR distribution outlets.

name: MetaCritic
overview:
Metacritic.com provides thousands of reviews in a number of entertainment genres including film, video, music, books and games, to help consumers make decisions about spending money on entertainment.

Each metacritic.com entertainment record is assigned a METASCORE®, which is a weighted average of all of the scores assigned by individual critics.

Metacritic.com has evolved since it began in 1999, constantly adding to its database of reviews, launching a wireless version of the site, and undergoing redesigns in 2003 and 2004. In 2005, Metacritic joined the CNET family of websites after an acquisition by CNET Networks, Inc.

name: Vostu
overview:
Vostu is a social gaming company which was launched in May 2007.

Initially a social network for Latin America with a strong presence in Brazil, the company developed and launched its first succesful social game in June 2009 under the title “Joga Craque”, a soccer-focused RPG for Brazilian players. It then launched a version of the same game on the popular Brazilian social network Orkut in October 2009. More recently, Vostu launched a farming game on Orkut called “Mini Fazenda” which as of January 31, 2010 had 8 million monthly active users and was rated the #1 social game on the Orkut platform.

Vostu was started by Daniel Kafie, Mario Schlosser and Josh Kushner while they were students at Harvard University. As of February 2010, Vostu is a private company with offices in Sao Paulo, Buenos Aires, and New York. The company is venture-backed by Intel Capital who led a $1.3M seed round in early 2008 and a follow-on investment in November 2009 for an undisclosed amount.

name: Faneebo
overview:
Faneebo.com is an exclusive music fan club community that is geared towards helping out independent bands that do not have record label support.

When a band is signed to a record label, the label provides the band with money called an advance which will help the band pay for recording, merch, CDs and more. The band will then have to pay back the advance thru CD, merch sales, etc. before the band will see any profits for themselves.

With Faneebo, bands can set up and run their own Fan Club which will act as their own personal record label run by the band and in turn will allow fans to gain access to premium content while at the same time providing bands with the needed funds to help record, tour, buy merch, and more in which the bands won’t have to worry about paying back.

So instead of needing a record label to provide an advance, advances can now be provided to bands from the fans themselves made possible via Faneebo.com.

offices: [{"description":"Marvel Entertainment Inc","address1":"417 5th. Avenue","address2":"","zip_code":"10016","city":"New York","state_code":"NY","country_code":"USA","latitude":40.750576,"longitude":-73.982713},{"description":"Marvel Studios","address1":"1600 Rosecrans Avenue","address2":"Building 7 - Suite 110","zip_code":"90266","city":"Manhattan Beach","state_code":"CA","country_code":"USA","latitude":33.898828,"longitude":-118.383715}]
overview:
Marvel Entertainment, Inc. engages in the licensing, publishing, toy making, and film production businesses with a proprietary library of approximately 5,000 characters.

Its library of characters include Spider-Man, Iron Man, The Incredible Hulk, Captain America, Thor, Ghost Rider, The Fantastic Four, X-Men, Blade, Daredevil, The Punisher, Namor, Nick Fury, The Avengers, Silver Surfer, and Ant-Man.

The company operates in four segments: Licensing, Publishing, Toys, and Film Production. The Licensing segment licenses its characters for use in various consumer products, including toys, apparel, and video games; feature films; television programs; DVD animated feature films; theme parks, shopping malls, and special events; promotions; and publications. The Publishing segment publishes and sells comic books and custom comics to the direct market and the mass market, as well as to teenagers and young adults through comic book specialty stores and retail outlets, including bookstores and newsstands. This segment also sells advertising and subscriptions. The Toys segment designs, develops, creates, markets, and distributes character-based toys, such as Most Marvel and Spider-Man, as well as based on licensed-in characters, such as Curious George and characters from Code Lyoko and TNA wrestling. This segment markets its products through specialty toy retailers, mass merchandisers, mail-order companies, and variety stores, as well as independent distributors worldwide. The Film Production segment develops, produces, and distributes films. Marvel Entertainment, Inc., formerly known as Marvel Enterprises, Inc., was founded in 1988 and is based in New York, New York.

name: Stardoll
overview: Stardoll is a virtual entertainment and social gaming destination for teenagers. It’s a virtual world where teens come together to create a “MeDoll” in their likeness, and express themselves through design, dress up and interacting with one another. Stardoll offers a fun-filled approach to fashion, celebrity and making friends. Drawing on a worldwide audience of girls, aged 9-17, the site offers an extensive collection of garments, home designs, and accessories and make up from a variety of real world and virtual brands.

name: RootZoo
overview:
An interactive sports community that covers the spectrum of all sports.

Fans discuss the sports world with one another through threads, articles, polls, and groups, all of which are created by the users themselves. Additionally, various games offered through the site include a trivia section, in addition to a pick ‘em game covering many different sports and the RootZoo Daily Challenge, both of which award many prizes to winners including a trip to the Super Bowl, NBA Finals, MLB All-Star game, and more. RootZoo also maintains a fantasy news section, keeping its users up to date with the latest player news in the fantasy sports world.

A competitive point system overrides this all, and rewards members with privileges for achieving various milestones on the site.

Rootzoo ownership abandoned the site in the spring of 2010. The domain was purchased anonymously in December 2010.
tag_list: sports-community, sports-fans, fantasy-news, fantasy-advice, nfl, mlb, nba, nhl, nascar, soccer, tennis, golf

name: WhatYah!
overview:
A simple service which allows you to catalog your movies & then share with friends.

WhatYah! allows you to catalog your movies, games & TV shows online and share these lists for trading purposes between friends. You can create reviews, vote & more.

Mark movies as wanted and when friends add these movies you’ll be notified by email.

WhatYah! is a growing service and is currently working with its current users to create & change features to make it more useful.

name: HBO
overview:
Home Box Office, a division of Time Warner Entertainment Company, L.P. (TWE), provides two 24-hour premium TV services, HBO and Cinemax, to subscribers across the United States via cable, C-band satellite, direct broadcast satellite (DBS) and microwave (MMDS). HBO is also available to guests in hotels and motels across the country.

Each month, HBO offers more than 90 theatrical motion pictures–ranging from top box office hits to a broad spectrum of popular films–as well as exclusive programming, including original movies, series, comedy, documentaries, family shows, and world-class sporting events.

HBO was launched in November of 1972.

name: Soundwalk
overview: Soundwalk makes “audio tours for people who don’t normally take audio tours”. The tours feature interviews, sound effects, and backstory to help bring each city to life.

name: Vigster
overview:
Vigster introduces gamers to its global community of video game lovers and provides them with the opportunity to share their gaming passions and experiences by providing a core social matching functionality and also provides them to access its massive collections of video games and other games related information, the ability to connect with peers, friends and meet new users that share the same gaming passion as themselves.

Apart from being a social network, Vigster is also a community and resource portal for video games fans of all categories and platforms. Its got a massive database of video games and resources (e.g. screens, videos, artworks, demos etc).

acquisition.source_description: Avail Acquires ViewNow
name: ViewNow
overview:
ViewNow, Inc. offers video on demand programming, management, and marketing services. The company offers a solution for delivering VOD programming inclusive of programming acquisition, encoding, programming management, and transport through satellite to its affiliates. It provides ViewTrak to track programming activations on a real time basis, by using its proprietary software suite. In addition, the company offers program encryption, metadata preparation, and automated studio reporting services. The company offers a range of marketing services that include TV commercials, barker reels, direct mail postcards, newsprint ads, cross channel spots, radio spots, bill inserts, Web banners, and media recommendations. ViewNow serves the cable and telco providers.

The company was founded in 2000 and is based in Encino, California. As of September 12, 2007, ViewNow, Inc. is a subsidiary of Avail Media, Inc.

name: Jogli
overview:
Jogli is the search engine for music. It scans other websites such as YouTube for any free existing music and music video clips, and then indexes the music in order to enable an easy and efficient search. As a result, users have access to the largest free inventory of music on the Web, consisting of approximately 12 million albums and half a billion songs. The music is listened to through Jogli’s website, although it is stored and broadcasted from the original sources.

Users can search and listen to any desired music video clips, individual tracks, entire albums and other users’ playlists, without the need to download any software.

Jogli is a music community. Any user can be a VJ, creating and sharing play lists with friends. Users can review, chat and respond to each other’s “MTV channels”.

name: MyTrainer
overview:
MyTrainer.com is a video and social network website that creates relationships and community between trainers and fitness, health and sports enthusiasts.

Consumers of all ages and demographics will participate in online communities built via trainers and their training videos focused on workouts, lifestyle and nutrition information.

With more than 80% of America overweight and 85% of America NOT engaged with the $2..1 billion per year fitness industry, MyTrainer is bridging the gap between consumers and trainers. MyTrainer has active communities, quality diverse content, local service connections, product sales and great advertising and sponsorship opportunities.
tag_list: fitness, health-fitness, weight-loss, workouts, video-sharing, social-network

overview: Creates fantasy sports games for sports like soccer and football on social networks like Facebook and Bebo.

name: Bragosphere
overview:
Bragosphere, Inc. was founded by two .NET consultants who thought of a better way to share pictures and videos on the web.

The Bragosphere is a collection of virtual photo albums (called Brag Books) that can be shared with friends, family, or the general public. You can create stunning page layouts containing your favorite pictures, even videos, that other people can interact with.

Inspired by the Microsoft Surface demos, Bragosphere utilizes Microsoft Silverlight to provide a very compelling user experience that goes beyond what is currently available on the web.

name: VBS TV
overview:
VBS. TV is an online network streaming original content, 24 hours a day. VBS covers a mixture of domestic and international news, pop and underground culture coverage, music, skate-snow-surf, and technology. Academy Award-nominated director Spike Jonze (Adaptation, Being John Malkovich) is listed as their creative director.

Since it’s IPTV start in 2007, VBS content can be seen on a wide range of platforms from Myspace and social networks to their own shows on both MTV and IFC.

name: eBaum's World
overview: eBaum’s World is a entertainment website dubbed “Media for the Masses”. It showcases videos, pictures, as well as prank calls.

name: Overstream
overview:
Founded in October 2006, Overstream is a consumer media company that provides services for users to customize and enhance their online video experience. Overstream technology rises up to the challenge by enabling additional partially transparent dynamic content layers to be displayed over any live streaming content.

Their service is designed for users who want to easily customize and enhance their videos, express their thoughts and ideas about existing videos, or simply engage in novel ways of sharing videos online.

acquisition.source_description: IPC MEDIA ACQUIRES MARKET LEADING ONLINE GAMES SITE, MOUSEBREAKER
name: Mousebreaker
overview:
Mousebreaker is an online gaming website, featuring hundreds of different types of games. Affiliated websites such as Blastbilliards.com, Playforyourclub.com and Flashcricket.com were developed for niche audiences. Similarly the Playapal.com website was developed to explore the emerging multiplayer market, providing players with the opportunity to chat and interact while playing.

Mousebreaker was acquired by UK consumer magazine publisher IPC Media in June of 2008.

Fandango bought Movies.com from Disney in June of 2008.

name: Yaika
overview:
Yaika.com is the first localized all-in-one social lifecasting platform in Europe. Their aim is to increase the number of people willing to share their real life moments and experiences with their local community or the entire world.

Yaika! has integrated video and radio broadcasting, blogging, social community and a new way communicate into one easy platform. Their users and authors can now stream live video or radio to anyone in the world and interact with their watchers or listeners in a new manner.

Yaika! also creates a new way to blog. Every channel created on Yaika! works like a blog. This gives an opportunity to anyone with a laptop or a PC and a camera to instantly stream a breaking story or just anything happening around you live on the Internet without having to go through the process of writing it up first. However, authors still have the options to do so if they wish.

The company reaches more than 85 million unique visitors per month across its digital properties including the #1 video comedy site, Break.com, top men’s lifestyle property MadeMan.com and maintains a growing presence on emerging platforms such as YouTube, mobile and OTT. For more information, visit www.breakmedia.com.

acquisition.source_description: Google Acquires Slingbox-Style Tech Company Sage TV
name: SageTV
overview: SageTV, LLC develops digital entertainment and placeshifting solutions. It allows users to create and operate media centers from an existing PC. The company provides SageTV Media Center, a PVR/media center solution designed for PCs and TVs. Its products include media and wireless media extenders, PCI cards, cards and remotes, A/V cables, and dual-tuner bundles. The company offers media server software with optional TV tuner that provides DVR, online video, music, and photo experience for Windows-based, MAC, or Linux screen at home or away from home. It operates an online store. SageTV, LLC was formerly known as Frey Technologies, LLC. The company was founded in 2002 and is based in Inglewood, California with development labs and offices in Los Angeles and San Francisco bay area of California.

name: Cyloop
offices: [{"description":"World Headquarters","address1":"555 Washington Ave, suite 340","address2":"","zip_code":"33137","city":"Miami","state_code":"FL","country_code":"USA","latitude":25.787252,"longitude":-80.13183},{"description":"Madrid Office","address1":"Avda. de Bruselas 38-B 4","address2":"Alcobendas","zip_code":"28108","city":"Madrid","state_code":null,"country_code":"ESP","latitude":40.5288449,"longitude":-3.6429907},{"description":"CA Office","address1":"1960 East Grand Ave., suite 240","address2":"","zip_code":"90245","city":"El Segundo","state_code":"CA","country_code":"USA","latitude":33.918589,"longitude":-118.393719}]
overview:
Cyloop is the first online social network community with unlimited access to on-demand music and video streams for fans and top artists, establishing a direct connection between them.

Cyloop features the biggest and most complete catalog from leading music labels and distributors to offer on-demand, interactive streaming of their audio and video catalogs in Spain, USA and Latin America, making it the main online destination of its kind.

The Cyloop experience features also exclusive content such as intimate interviews with the artists, in-studio live performances, behind the scenes footage, original shows, etc.

For Music Fans:

  • By registering free, Cyloop users can easily create their own “loops,” which are collections of songs, or playlists, available across all the registered profiles in the site.
  • Cyloop’s on-demand experience goes beyond regular “music streaming,” allowing users to select specific songs, go back, skip, or repeat as desired.
  • When a profile is created, users can start collecting their favorite songs in it, organize them using loops, and even share those loops with their friends in the community, or bring their friends’ loops into their profile. All endless ways to share an unlimited source of music using easy drag-&-drop quick steps.
  • Users’ profiles can be easily customized to their own preferences. They also can incorporate pictures, graphics, video, blogs, personal labels or any other parameters that define a user’s identity, so they can share it all with their friends in the community.
  • Cyloop profiles and Loops are also accessible via mobile at m.cyloop.com (WAP).

For Artists:

  • Musicians, performers, and bands can also easily create a profile uploading an unlimited number of their songs to share their music with all members of the community; and establish a direct connection with their audience.
  • Using Cyloop’s screening process, artists can safely register and upload their own content, ensuring its legitimacy within the community.
  • Cyloop’s Team assists in profile development, including rich graphic design customizations, and all artist-generated communications and updates.
  • Content distribution: Artists only need to manage their content in one place. The network of sites powered by Cyloop does the work of taking it to fans over multiple platforms, reaching audiences through leading internet portals across different countries and markets.
  • Additionally, artists can use powerful communication tools with their fans, keeping them up to date through easy-to-edit newsletters and calendar features for upcoming events, concerts, releases, announcements, bios, blogs, news, etc.
  • Cyloop’s own production facilities based in Miami, Buenos Aires and Spain generate premium quality music-centric content.

Cyloop is an advertiser sponsored site and being a member of Cyloop is free. Becoming a member as a music fan or artist is a free simple process, and requires no memberships, fees, hidden costs or charges of any kind. All available music streams and content can be shared endlessly and completely free among registered members of the community.

Cyloop.com is a division of Hoodiny Entertainment Group.
tag_list: music, video, radio, streaming, playiist, loop, entertainment, social-network, mobile, recommendaion-engine, hispanics, latin, latinamerica, spain, music-recommendation, on-demand, free, artists, fans

name: Trilulilu
overview:
Trilulilu is the largest online community in Romania where visitors can watch and help with video, music and images. Trilulilu promotes gang spirit and friendship. Trilulilu is the first Romanian site sharing (sharing files) video, images and audio. The site was officially launched on January 22, 2007, after a period of testing “beta” for several weeks, during which only relatives had access to the site team. Trilulilu promotes gang spirit, friendliness and flexibility, as opposed to specific corporate attitude of other specialized sites.

Use Trilulilu FREE, anyone can register quickly.

name: Planet Green
overview: Planet Green is a 24-hour eco-lifestyle television network with a robust online presence and community. By representing a broad range of ideas and perspectives, Planet Green is taking an active role in generating conversation and motivating individuals to take action when it comes to improving the environmental status of our planet.

name: Fourth Story Media
overview: Fourth Story Media is an innovative studio that brings a fresh perspective to the development of children’s properties, primarily through the sharing of individual stories through social networks and interactive games.

name: Liberty Sports Group
overview: Liberty Sports Group is comprised of three regional sports networks, including FSN Northwest, FSN Pittsburgh and FSN Rocky Mountain. The three networks combined reach more than 8.5 million viewers across 17 states and own exclusive programming and distribution partnerships with more than 24 professional and collegiate teams. Liberty Sports Group is a division of Liberty Media Corporation, which owns interests in a broad range of electronic retailing, media, communications and entertainment businesses.

name: CareerTours
overview: CareerTours is the largest aggregator of career videos. We enable companies to showcase what it is like to work there or in a specific career and candidates are able to learn about their next career through video as well as share themselves through video. We are changing the way online recruiting happens adding value to both recruiters and candidates.

ATUNN is an Internet System that organizes and selects the best online applications and resources and allows the user to reach his target in very few clicks.

name: Funtactix
overview:
Funtactix is an award winning online game development studio specializing in social games and mobile games based on major motion pictures. Funtactix currently maintains a studio network with offices in New York City, Los Angeles and Tel Aviv.

Funtactix creates social and mobile games based on major box office films – including Mission Impossible, The Hunger Games, and Rango. Founded in 2006, the studio has changed the way film creators connect with their audiences and how fans experience their favorite films. Working closely with filmmakers and Hollywood studios, Funtactix is leading the triumphant return of movie-based games: The company’s games have rallied tens of millions of players on social platforms like iOS and Facebook.

name: Interscope Records
overview:
Interscope Records, Inc. discovers, develops, markets, and distributes recorded music in the United States and Internationally.

The company was founded in 1989 and is based in Santa Monica, California. Interscope Records, Inc. operates as a subsidiary of Universal Music Group, Inc. It is the largest label currently functioning under Universal Music Group.

name: LuckySurf
overview: LuckySurf Lotto is a web-based entertainment game. The object of the game is to choose seven numbers from the game card, and match them against the seven winning numbers drawn for that day. The winner then receives a payout.

name: Mediastay
offices: [{"description":"MEDIASTAY SAS","address1":"45 rue Jean Jaures","address2":"","zip_code":"92300","city":"Levallois Perret","state_code":null,"country_code":"FRA","latitude":48.891494,"longitude":2.292728},{"description":"MEDIASTAY NORTH AMERICA","address1":"350 Sansome Street","address2":"","zip_code":"94104","city":"San Francisco","state_code":"CA","country_code":"USA","latitude":null,"longitude":null}]
overview:
Founded in 2000 by three young French entrepreneurs, Mediastay is one of the main European and US experts in lead generation and monetization in the gaming sector. Mediastay has developed its in-house advertisement tools, of which the offer-based payment solution OfferMatch, to monetize its proprietary online games as well as third party websites and Facebook applications. Mediastay also runs Games Passport, a distribution and game monetization platform and a major partner for some of the top international game developers (Alawar, Playrix…) and medias (Endemol, M6…), gathering more than 25 millions players in 14 countries, with 7 million unique visitors per month (source Nielsen). In January 2011 the company became the first French company to be licensed by Facebook and since then has developed the application Credits Booster for wining free Facebook credits.

Sales in 2011 reached more than 25 million dollars (19 million euros). The company has over 90 employees based in Paris, Lyon, Brussels, San Francisco and Sao Paolo. In April 2011, Mediastay secured a 20 million dollars funding (15 million euros).

Advertising, and Soundflavor, a leader in On-line Music Search, announced today the

advanced on-line music search.
Every month, millions of people watch music videos on-line. Many of these videos have
had over 25 millions views. However, until today there has been no easy way for a
person viewing a music video to simply click on the video and purchase the song or a
ringtone from the video. Soundflavor and Veeple have created a simple way for
musicians to place interactive actions into their music videos and directly link to a
purchase. Further, the in-stream interactions, what Veeple calls VeeSpots, also allow
viewers to click to a musicianâ€™s web site, iTunes, eBay, MySpace or Facebook.
â€œThe people at Soundflavor are excited to have this cool, new functionality for our
community, said Steve Skrzyniarz, Soundflavorâ€™s CEO and Founder. Steve continued,
â€œThis will let people click directly from a video to our site where they can purchase the
song or a ringtone, or find music playlists that match user preferences.â€
â€œWe hope this new capability will help bring together the community of musicians and
their listeners in such a way that many more people will purchase the music they listen to
on-line. To be able to go from a music video to music purchase is really cool,â€ said Scott
Broomfield, Veepleâ€™s CEO and Co-Founder.
About Soundflavor

Francisco. For more information, visit www.soundflavor.com

name: Veeple
overview:
Veeple is an interactive media company that provides a platform that enables web publishers, advertisers, and individuals to easily add interactive and multi-dimensional content to their videos, creating the opportunity to promote, distribute and monetize their online content through viewer and customer interactions.

Veeple strives to improve interactive video content in the following categories:

Simple and Intuitive Interactivity - Ability to make any object inside a video interactive and place any interactive image into a video, all through a standard web browser, in real-time, by anyone, anywhere, anytime.

Innovative Ad Placement - Dynamic placement of interactive advertisement spots into any video across the internet anywhere.

Relevancy - Ability to make interactive spots extremely relevant for both advertisers and p ublishers through not only contextual analysis of the video but image analysis through our patented image identification technology, ensuring excellent brand protection.

Measurement/Metrics - A deep analytics engine that measures all user-interactions with any video across the interne

As of April 2008, Veeple is partnered with JellyCloud and Soundflavor.

name: JiggyMe
overview: JiggyMe is a website focused on technology videos.

name: Woldme
overview: Woldme is a social network that provides games, videos, books, and online tutoring for children between ages 6 and 12.

external_links: [{"external_url":"http://blog.wired.com/music/2007/11/interview-peter.html","title":"Wired - Interview With Peter Rojas, Nov 2007"},{"external_url":"http://www.pollstar.com/blogs/news/archive/2007/11/19/489265.aspx","title":"Pollstar - RCRD LBL KCKS BTT"},{"external_url":"http://online.wsj.com/article/SB119508767828793513.html","title":"Wall Street Journal - Music Test: Can a Firm Profit From Free Tunes?"},{"external_url":"http://www.wired.com/listening_post/2007/11/rcrd-lbl-launch/","title":"Wired - RCRD LBL Solves the Free Music Riddle"}]
name: RCRD LBL
overview:
RCRD LBL is an online destination for free, curated, legal, MP3 downloads. RCRD LBL delivers free daily curated MP3’s, on its website, via its content partners, and directly to the user, on the “RCRD of the Day” daily email newsletter.

RCRD LBL launched in 2007, as a joint venture between Downtown Music LLC (Gnarls Barkley, Cold War Kids, Santigold), and online media pioneer Peter Rojas (Engadget, Gizmodo, Weblogs, Inc.), and was instantly regarded as a revolutionary force in the distribution of music online.

RCRD LBL features over 10,000 free singles, remixes, exclusive tracks and rarities from a diverse, handpicked roster of artists including Santigold, Steve Aoki, Moby, Massive Attack, MGMT and thousands more. Additionally RCRD LBL’s network of affiliated content partners includes such well respected labels as Warp Records, Ghostly International, Dim Mak, Fool’s Gold and Modular.

name: Spill
overview: Spill.com is a film review site where members can watch videos of animated characters discussing new movie releases, blog about upcoming movies, and interact and connect with other movie buffs. Online movie review and film review plus new movie trailers.

name: Muso Net
overview:
MusoFinder.com connect musicians for bands and music projects.

Musicians can register, create proflies and post wanted ads. Anyone can search for musicians by zip/postcode to find musicians near them.

There is a popular community where musicians can get advice, support and generally have a chat.

name: NoiseTrade
overview:
NoiseTrade connects artist and fans through the exchange of free music for contact info. Artists upload a single, EP, full-length album, or live show. Immediately fans can download the music by just giving their email address and zip code.

Fans also have a chance to spread the word about the free music to Facebook and Twitter, as well as give the artist a tip — anywhere between $1 and $100. Artists keep 80% of these tips which are delivered to their PayPal account on a monthly basis.

At any time, artists can download the contact info of the fans who downloaded their music in .CSV format, which can be uploaded to any mailing list program such as Emma, MailChimp, FanBridge, or Topspin.

NoiseTrade features the best music on the site with a weekly email newsletter, blog content, and artist banners throughout the site.

name: Gig Lovers
overview:
Gig Lovers is a concert listing site with a large database of upcoming and past gigs.

Users have the option to import favourite artists from last.fm and iTunes. They can then recieve alerts when their favourite bands plan a tour and provide links to concert tickets, where available.

name: Xtreme Desi Network
overview:
Xtreme Desi Network is an online radio station initially for the British South Asian Community, we first launched in early April of 2007 as BETA. Rapidly gaining positive responses from listeners, we established ourselves as The Number 1 Online Asian Radio.

Xtreme Desi Network also provides a vastly large online community offering a wide range of entertainment, we are now internationally growing in size, specifically in North America. Xtreme Desi Network is a unique online environment with a strictly dedicated Management and a large British South Asian Community boasting over thousand members.

The Xtreme Desi Radio is played LIVE 24 hours a day and 7 days a week. Bringing listeners non-stop music from all genres. One of our main and deeply held aspirations is to deliver free music to the Online Asian community.

If you are an artist or producer who wishes to promote yourself on the Xtreme Desi Radio, then do send your music to radio@xtremedesi.net we will get in touch with you as soon as possible.

name: Celebrity Seats
overview:
Celebrity Seats is a national ticket broker specializing in hard-to-get tickets for all concerts, sporting events, and theatre shows.

Celebrity Seats has taken advantage of expanding technology to sell tickets nationwide, becoming one of the fastest-growing ticket sales companies in the country. They deliver a superior online shopping experience for consumers of sports and entertainment events, while providing them with access to the world’s largest aggregate ticket-distribution channel.

Celebrity Seats sells tickets to brokers and individual consumers alike, as well as for corporate and group events.

milestones: [{"id":3167,"description":"Pixar Merges with Disney","stoned_year":2006,"stoned_month":1,"stoned_day":24,"source_url":"http://www.pixar.com/companyinfo/about_us/overview.htm","source_text":null,"source_description":"Pixar About Page","stoneable_type":"Company","stoned_value":null,"stoned_value_type":null,"stoned_acquirer":null,"stoneable":{"name":"Pixar","permalink":"pixar"}}]
name: Pixar
overview:
A CGI Animation Company. Pixar began as the computer graphics project of the Computer Division at Lucasfilm Ltd, created in 1979. The Computer Division was led by Ed Catmull and the graphics project (soon called Pixar) was run by Alvy Ray Smith. Pixar was a hardware company developing highend image processing tools - in particular the Pixar 2D Frame Buffer. In 1984 they hired John Lasseter to help them produce their first animated film, primarily to demonstrate the power of their hardware. Over the years Lasseter created more animated shorts to demonstrate the Pixar, in 1986 creating Luxo Jr. Pixar was spun out of Lucasfilm and was purchased by Steve Jobs in 1986, at which point it became an independent company, although still a hardware company, and run by Ed Catmull and Alvy Ray Smith. Failing to grow the hardware business, they became increasingly dependent on revenue from their animated projects, first doing commercials. Eventually they made a deal with Disney to produce the first full-length feature film entirely in CG. Jobs was not very focused on Pixar, and was trying to sell it in the early 90s. But on the strength of early viewings of Toy Story, he instead took Pixar public. The rest is history.

Pixar was acquired by The Walt Disney Company in 2006, making Jobs the largest shareowner in Disney.

name: Hictu
overview:
Hictu is a service for video microbloggers, who can create their own microblog with small posts (containing text, audio, and video), personalize their public profiles, manage a presence-enabled friend list, and meet new friends.

Hictu also provides a Wordpress plugin to leave video comments or YouTube/Google videos on any wordpress blog. Any comment appears into the standard Hictu stream too.

name: GEN247
overview:
GEN247 is a media production company that specializes in integrating web TV content with alternate reality games, also known as cross platform entertainment or immersive gaming.

In 2008, the company produced DELETED: THE GAME, an original web series conspiracy thriller that was integrated with an ARG (Alternate Reality Game). The formula was a hit with audiences and won two nominations at the 13th Webby Awards for Best Experimental Online Video and Best Use of Interactive Video. DELETED: THE GAME won the former and was honored for the latter beating the likes of MTV, Sundance Channel and Channel 4.

GEN247 continues to develop its slate of interactive web originals as branded platforms. Its website shows a range of titles, with descriptions and trailers, that target niche audiences.

name: LingusTV
overview:
Lingus.TV is a television channel for the new generation devoted to teaching and disseminating languages, while taking advantage of all the social characteristics of the Internet.

In the new era of communication, LingusTV is unique, as a result of its very specific and focused way of teaching language. We are a web TV channel devoted to education and believe that the entertainment and active participation of students are the keys to communication in a new language.

Lingus.TV was founded in beta in June 2008 using this method of learning Spanish as a first step to building a network of thematic channels. The situation comedy (sitcom), “5 y acción,” is our first production, and guiding principle for our system of teaching Spanish.

name: 9You
overview: Nineyou is an interactive entertainment portal sites in China, that integrates online game services (MMORPG, massive and medium size casual games, mobile game, etc.), fashional digital entertainment contents, a variety of chatting and community services equipped with Avatar System, wireless value-added services, and other premiere services to the Chinese language internet users all over the world.

name: Chapatiz
overview:
Chapatiz is a French company that specializes in creating virtual worlds for teens.

Chapatiz is a free online community where you’ll be able to chat, meet people and you make lots of friends. If you want your own avatar tuner …

name: SetVid
overview: SetVid is a high definition video sharing site. It currently uses the Divx web player to play hd videos, up to 1080p.

name: Fluid Entertainment
overview: Fluid Entertainment is an independent children’s interactive entertainment developer.

name: IGG
overview: IGG is an MMORPG developer and operator. They are working hard to build and develop a platform for the next generation in online entertainment for a global audience.

name: Numedeon
overview: Numedeon seeks to create a new type of online for the consumer. The idea: A member logs onto a company’s website and is immediately immersed with in an intuitive graphical environment that reflects the organization’s structure and mission.

name: YOOWALK
overview: Yoowalk offers a breaking edge innovation that allows advertisers to interact with their targeted audience. Its users are immersed into a 3D representation of the web as a virtual world, where they enjoy playful surfing for making new friends, chatting, thematic window shopping and sharing interests in easily customizable spaces. Yoowalk is the first virtual world accessible with a single click. It requires no download, nor registration to walk around, recommend and share content. It is completely free for visitors and members.

name: Universal Studios
overview: Universal Studios Orlando, an entertainment company, operates movie theme parks and a City Walk area in Orlando, Florida. The company’s theme park has attractions based on movies and television shows, as well as some behind the scenes looks at movie and television making techniques. It offers family entertainment through movie-themed attractions, such as thrill rides, live-action shows, and interactive exhibits. The company’s a City Walk area, an entertainment complex, includes themed restaurants, nightclubs, shops, a screen, a movie megaplex, and hotels. It also offers motion pictures, television, music, home, and location based entertainment. The company was formerly known as Universal Studios Escape and Universal Studios Florida. Universal Studios Orlando is based in Orlando, Florida.

acquisition.source_description: Undertone Buys Online Video Ad Startup Jambo Media
milestones:
[{"id":171,"description":"Online Marketing Pioneer Jason Wolfe Invests in Jambo Media","stoned_year":2008,"stoned_month":7,"stoned_day":8,"source_url":"","source_text":"New York, NY â€“ July 8, 2008 â€“ Jambo Media, LLC, a leading developer of online video solutions, today announced that recognized Internet media executive Jason Wolfe has acquired an equity position in the company and has joined the companyâ€™s Board of Directors. In this capacity, Wolfe will become a key advisor and help facilitate larger relationships for Jambo Media. Wolfe, founder and former chief executive of Direct Response Technologies, Inc., joins Jambo Mediaâ€™s Board with vast experience and an extensive track record in the fields of interactive media, Internet and M&A.

"I have known the founders of Jambo Media since the days when they were clients of Direct Response Technologies," Wolfe said. "I have always admired their skill and ability in online media. I have had plenty of opportunities to invest into various new media companies and concepts over the years, however very few have excited me. The opportunity to be an investor and advisor in Jambo Media is truly exciting."

"Driven by market-savvy individuals with keen business skills, Jambo Media will continue to lead the online video ad serving and tracking industry, which I believe is at its infancy stage," Wolfe continued. "The timing of this investment reminds me of the launch of DirectTrack in 2001, which proved to be ahead of its time and eventually a huge success. I look for the same market leadership, innovation, and success from Jambo Media in the video ad space."

Wolfe, a graduate of Bloomsburg University (Pennsylvania), founded Direct Response Technologies, a Pittsburgh-based direct-marketing company, in 1994 with one employee and an initial investment of $100. He transformed the company into a multimillion-dollar entity. Wolfe also created MyCoupons.com (online coupon site), DirectLeads.com (online lead generation network), GiftCards.com (a leading online gift card service), KeywordMax (a leading keyword bid management service), and DirectTrack, which eventually became the worldâ€™s top affiliate tracking and ad serving system.

"We have worked with Jason for many years," said Jambo Media CEO Robert Manoff, "(Jambo Media COO) Todd Houck and I have a tremendous amount of respect and admiration for his achievements. Having Jason as a partner and advisor will help Jambo Media reach our potential. Between Jason, Todd and I, we have more than 30 years of combined advertising network and affiliate marketing experience. This is a major step forward for Jambo Media and we are very excited for the future."

 ","source_description":"Online Marketing Pioneer Jason Wolfe Invests in Jambo Media","stoneable_type":"Company","stoned_value":null,"stoned_value_type":null,"stoned_acquirer":null,"stoneable":{"name":"Jambo Media","permalink":"jambo-media"}}]
name: Jambo Media
offices: [{"description":"New Jersey Office","address1":"24 Lees Avenue","address2":"","zip_code":"08108","city":"Collingswood","state_code":"NJ","country_code":"USA","latitude":39.914449,"longitude":-75.066061},{"description":"New York Office","address1":"110 West 40th Street","address2":"Suite 604","zip_code":"10018","city":"New York","state_code":"NY","country_code":"USA","latitude":40.753652,"longitude":-73.98594},{"description":"Pittsburgh Office","address1":"681 Andersen Drive","address2":"Foster Plaza Building 6","zip_code":"15220","city":"2nd Floor","state_code":"PA","country_code":"USA","latitude":null,"longitude":null}]
overview:
Jambo Media is a leading developer of online video solutions — including JamboCast, JamboTV.com and the Jambo Video Network.

JamboCast is a simple video solution for web publishers, content owners, and advertisers, providing flash video players for sites to display video content either from Jambo Media or content they have created internally. Currently JamboCast powers JamboTV.com and the Jambo Video Network.

The Jambo Video Network (JVN) is a group of highly targeted websites that display professionally-produced, engaging video content. JVN licenses video from sources such AP, iVillage, and Ivanhoe Broadcast News, and then packages them into channels for distribution to affiliate sites. JVN is partnered with Fortune 500 advertisers — all backed by the cutting-edge Jambocast Video Management System. This creates a seamless union between publishers, advertisers and content providers.

Currently, Jambo Media is delivering more than 2 million daily video plays and supports video on more than 120 web sites and growing on a weekly basis.

name: Saffron Digital
overview:
About Saffron Digital

Founded in 2006, Saffron Digital is the leading global, multi-DRM, online video platform for the digital entertainment industry; powering end-to-end DRM Video Solutions for major International Carriers, MSO’s, OEMs and retailers. With offices on three continents; Saffron Digital deploys both DSP and Client Implementer platform solutions that play to its core experience in delivering domain based DRM solutions on a global scale for clients including: KDDI, SKY and HTC.

Saffron Digital’s has been running cloud based locker and DRM domain services since 2009 and the latest platform is UV ready out of the box. The company has received international recognition for its work and has won multiple awards including: The Mobile Entertainment Award for Best Video and TV Service Provider (2009, 2010, and 2011); Guardian Top 100 Tech Media Invest Companies in the UK; MEFFYS 2011 Best TV & Video Service and the Media Momentum Award 2010, 2011.

name: Playlistor
overview:
Playlistor.com is a music website which allows users to create and listen to their own personal playlists online.

Users can also listen to one another’s playlists, and upload their playlists to their myspace, orkut, friendster, and other social network profiles.

Playlistor.com also has a social networking environment where users are able to mingle with one another by inviting friends and sending messages

name: Kickplay
overview:
Kickplay creates free, web-based casual games that people can play, personalize and share on the web.

Players upload their own images and sounds into a game, like Solitaire, to make it their own. These free web games can be found on our site and anywhere they are shared on the web, including blogs, social networking and bookmarking destinations, including Myspace, Facebook, del.icio.us, etc.

name: Riot Games
overview:
Riot Games is a direct-to-consumer video game developer and publisher of premium, competitive online games. The company was established in 2006 and has quickly become a leading global developer and publisher of premium free-to-play online video games for hardcore gamers, launching their debut title, League of Legends, in October 2009. To date, more than one million gamers play League of Legends and log more than half a billion minutes of playtime each month. For more information, please visit www.riotgames.com.

League of Legends, Riot Games’ debut title, celebrated its first anniversary on Oct. 27, 2010. Since its launch in North America and Europe, millions of players have downloaded the game to engage in session-based, multiplayer battles against rival teams. Built by a veteran development team, including original creators of the popular, player-made mod Defense of the Ancients, League of Legends combines elements of both strategy and competitive action genres.

name: Bars For Us
overview:
Take the guesswork out of finding your city’s best bars.

Bars For Us, at barsforus.com, has created an easy way for people to find bars using the criteria most important to them. Bar listings are displayed on a map and change dynamically as people refine their search. At the same time bars can pay Bars For Us to display advertisements and extra information about their special nights, offers and drink specials.

In later evolutions Bars For Us will allow people to register to follow and share their favorite bars, and bars will be able to register to deliver highly targeted and relevant promotions to their followers.

In summary, Bars For Us solves the problem of how people find the best bars for them and how bars can promote and advertise themselves, using a simple to use user-interface and a detailed database of information about local bars.

Starting in Raleigh, NC, Bars For Us will soon be available for interested partners to launch in further cities.
tag_list: raleigh, entertainment, rtpstartup, bars, nightlife, startupweekend

name: Scavenja
overview:
Scavenja is an online, photo based scavenger hunt. Time limited games challenge players to complete thematically connected goals. Players post pictures to document completed goals and goals are awarded points based on difficulty level. Game play combines social interaction with competition and prizes are awarded to top players. Games can be designed to appeal to various interests.

A player creates an account to participate in games and track their progress in them. They can also track each games’ overall progress and will eventually be able to post comments on other players’ pictures.

Scavanja is a real world scavenger hunt that is delivered online.
tag_list: scavenger-hunt, gaming, game, photo, picture, scavenja-com

name: Stratics
overview:
Stratics operates a network of sites catering towards players of specific massive multiplayer online games (MMOs). Stratics also hosts and manages the official forums for many MMOs including EA’s Ultima Online and The Sims Online.

Stratics is also developing GoStratics - a social network geared towards MMO players that is targeted for a Summer 2008 release.
tag_list: mmorpg, massive-multiplayer-games, games, video-games, gaming, online-games, social-network

name: Mobilenobo
overview:
MobileNOBO is a mobile content affiliate program that allows web site owners to source revenue from mobile content and from their unique website content.

MobileNOBO allows every website owner implement scripts and features to make unique website content profitable by allowing users to purchase and download the content: pictures, sounds and video.

Mobilenobo’s ‘send to mobile’ feature converts and compresses content in real time to its best possible screening experience.

name: Future US
overview:
Future US is a company built for and by part of Future plc, an international special-interest media group that is listed on the London Stock Exchange (symbol FUTR).

Founded in 1985 with one magazine, today its has operations in the UK and US, creating over 180 publications, Web sites and events for people who are passionate about their interests. Its biggest-selling magazines include T3, Total Film, Digital Camera, Fast Car, Classic Rock, Guitar World, Official Xbox Magazine, Official PlayStation Magazine, Nintendo Power and Mac|Life. Online, its Web sites include gamesradar.com, bikeradar.com, techradar.com, and musicradar.com.

Future sells over 4 million magazines each month; attracts more than 27 million unique visitors to our Web sites; and hosts 16 annual live events that attract hundreds of thousands of enthusiasts.

name: Kazzong
overview:
Kazzong is a decentralised, direct-to-fan music distribution system in the Web 2.0 age.

Music fans can discover, listen and comfortably purchase music via Kazzong widgets. Users are able to create their own Kazzong Players with their favourite music. These players can be placed on community profiles and websites. Artists and labels are provided with a fast and simple promotion and distribution tool for their music. Kazzong widgets allow artists to present themselves online wherever there is attention by music buyers and potential fans.

name: FilmGator
overview:
FilmGator is a personal movie service focusing on providing useful online tools for everyone who enjoys movies. The aim of the service is to help users discover new movies worth watching and to provide users with valuable information regarding their personal movie watching habits and preferences.

A central feature of the service is to give users the possibility to maintain their personal movie timeline and share it with friends.

Additional features include the ability to keep a “watch list” of movies planned to be seen and the possibility to view and compare personal statistics and trends relating to movie ratings.
tag_list: movies, films, film-rating, reviews, friends, social, cinema, facebook-application

name: FABINET
overview:
FABINET is a B2B International platform that helps ideas for Film, Video and Theater over the INTERNET.

FABINET is built for two main groups of professionals. The first group is formed by authors/creators who offer ideas (not only scriptwriters, all who involved in business). The second group is producers and broadcast stations’ representatives.

FABINET is not a public, but strictly professional domain. In other words, people from the street would not be able to get into our database. We work with experienced lawyers who will legally confirm the authors’ rights and monitor the projects. There is an experienced lawyer working with us in Berlin to issue copyright licenses for our members and one firm here in Leipzig, declaring our rights and confirming other legal issues. What we offer at FABINET is a unique opportunity to expose all kinds of ideas strictly within the professional community, with the assurance that they are safe from theft and plagiarism.

FABINET is a virtual meeting ground, where film and video production specialists can come together to share concerns and ideas and look for like-minded people. Fabinet offers an opportunity to meet potential partners with whom to mount productions.

We strongly encourage people to post the most innovative projects — the ones you’ve never dared to promote. The space authors use for projects will serve as your permanent presentation sites: post vita, professional credits and future plans, and allow them to reveal their creativity.

FABNET’s mission is to connect people who are desperately looking for fresh ideas with a uniquely creative community. We also multiply the chances for everyone to expose some creativity to international community. FABINET helps with legal advisors on board who constantly monitor project submission and secure authors’ rights as creators. We plan to organize consulting and script reviewing of newcomers by well-known professional, online chat rooms for immediate help and seminars. It’s all about helping people. It is a very noble thing what we trying to accomplish.
tag_list: promoting, innovative, idea, film, video, theater, internet, author, script, treatment, synopsis

name: GenArts
overview:
GenArts is a provider of specialized visual effects software for the film, broadcast and video industries. Founded in 1996 in Cambridge, Mass. by digital artist and computer scientist Karl Sims, GenArts develops and markets tools for high-end visual effects creation at studio, broadcast and post-production facilities of all sizes around the world.

GenArts’ solutions have been used extensively to create an array of effects for projects such as: Iron Man, The Curious Case of Benjamin Button, Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull, The Hulk, Spider-Man 1, 2 and 3, The Chronicles of Narnia, The Lord of the Rings trilogy, Star Wars - Episode I, II and III, Sin City, The Matrix trilogy, X-Men 1, 2 and 3, Titanic, Lost and CSI.

milestones:
[{"id":234,"description":"Lexy Signs Unique Deal With The Onion to be Its Mobile Distribution Partner for All Audio Content","stoned_year":2008,"stoned_month":7,"stoned_day":17,"source_url":"http://biz.yahoo.com/prnews/080716/law038.html?.v=101","source_text":"SAN FRANCISCO, July 16 /PRNewswire/ -- Lexy, a groundbreaking audio content distribution platform, has signed a deal with the satirical news publication and website The Onion to be its mobile distribution partner for all audio programming. The partnership launches with the integration of a Lexy subscription button into the Onion Radio News (ORN) webpage. This button provides easy access to Lexy, giving fans of ORN a new and effortless way to listen to the ORN daily broadcast and share it with their friends, while also providing The Onion with an excellent opportunity to grow its mobile listenership.

ADVERTISEMENT
Similar to other distribution buttons (e.g., RSS, iTunes) and like an RSS feed, Lexy immediately updates each subscriber's playlist with the latest ORN broadcast. However, unlike traditional RSS readers, Lexy subscribers can access this audio programming on their mobile phones, not just on their PCs, and share individual broadcasts with friends -- instantly from phone to phone.

With a name that combines the words Lexicon and Sexy, Lexy is both pragmatic and fun. Founded by Egreetings Network creators, Fred Campbell and Tony Levitan, Lexy is an innovative audio content distribution solution that fosters consumer interactions, is device- and carrier-independent, and reaches 100% of the mobile phone market. Lexy offers subscribers a wealth of audio programming, some culled from the very best short-form podcasts available online and some created in-house. Lexy also provides the capability to share and discuss audio content with others, all with a remarkably simple audio interface.

"We are thrilled to launch Lexy formally with a premier media outlet like The Onion," said Lexy co-founder Tony Levitan. "Their distinctive brand of humor and irreverence, as well as their commitment to multi-platform distribution, makes them an ideal partner for an innovative company like Lexy."

"Lexy expands the distribution of Doyle Redland's award-winning radio journalism onto mobile phones around the globe," said Steve Hannah, CEO, The Onion, "First, the Onion Radio News conquered the AM Dial. FM, satellite radio and podcasting followed. Now, we are proud to be involved with Lexy to exploit mobile phones for profit."","source_description":"Lexy Signs Unique Deal With The Onion to be Its Mobile Distribution Partner for All Audio Content","stoneable_type":"Company","stoned_value":null,"stoned_value_type":null,"stoned_acquirer":null,"stoneable":{"name":"Lexy","permalink":"lexy"}}]
name: Lexy
overview: Lexy is an audio content creation and distribution platform. When you subscribe to an audio feed, Lexy checks for updates on the publisher’s site. Each time a new episode is released, Lexy downloads it and sends you a message - text or email, depending on what your preference is. You then can listen to the newest episodes here on our site, or on your mobile.

name: IBTgames
overview:
IBTgames is a social media gaming company on the web.

IBT develops and publishes innovative casual games on social networks including Facebook, Myspace, Bebo , Friendster, Orkut, and Hi5. In the future, IBT will launch on mobile platforms such as the iPhone and Android.

IBTgames is all about redefining the user experience in the social application world by harnessing the power of social networks. All of the applications are developed by experts in game theory and game design with the overall user experience in mind. By adding ease and simplicity to casual gaming applications, IBT allows its users to be happy and engaged while interacting with their friends.

name: GamerVixens
overview: GamerVixens is a social networking site built from scratch, focusing on the female gamer. We empower and unite female gamers and female gaming groups globally. We strive to become their central networking hub in the rapidly growing video game industry. Open to all, however, we offer a place for any gamer to meet, compete, communicate, show-off, shop and network. GamerVixens is currently in a private, invitation-only Beta. Please visit the site to request an invitation.

overview: Developing and distribution of Flash online games. The customers buy from LorenzGames.com games to place their sponsors on or to use as monetizing system on social networks as Facebook. The company is also a community of gamers with interesting articles and games about online flash games.

acquisition.source_description: paidContent
name: Ku6
overview:
Ku6 Media Co., Ltd is one of the leading online video portal companies in China.

By continually providing users with the latest and most interesting video content, Ku6 has always been at the forefront of China’s online video market. Operating since 2006, Ku6 has been developing rapidly, building a major media platform to provide differentiated marketing services to our advertising partners. Its increasing innovations in online video marketing will not only please its users, but also enhance its brand.

Ku6 was formally established in 2006. In 2009, Ku6 was acquired by Shanda and became the world’s first video site listed on Nasdaq. Backed up by Shanda’s resources, Ku6 is aimed to create a platform for short-form, user-generated video content. In April, 2011, Shanda injected 100 million dollars into Ku6. In April, 2012, Ku6 announced that number of videos uploaded daily reached 200,000, and monthly Unique Visitors (UV) reached 220 million.

Major rivals are Youku and Tudou.

name: iStreamPlanet
overview:
iStreamPlanet, the Leader in Live: iStreamPlanet is a premier, multiplatform video-workflow solutions provider committed to bringing high-quality streaming video experiences to connected audiences around the world. With more than a decade of live streaming video experience, iStreamPlanet has built a comprehensive offering of cloud-based video-workflow products and services for live event and live linear streaming channels.

iStreamPlanet’s innovative approach has been chosen by the world’s leading sports, entertainment, and technology brands including NBC, Turner Broadcasting, Notre Dame Athletics, Pac-12 Networks, AT&T, and Microsoft.

Founded in 2000, the privately held company is headquartered in Las Vegas with offices in Redmond, Wash., and London. More information can be found at www.istreamplanet.com.

milestones:
[{"id":710,"description":"MySpace Music Streams Its Billionth Song ","stoned_year":2008,"stoned_month":9,"stoned_day":28,"source_url":"http://www.techcrunch.com/2008/10/05/myspace-music-streamed-its-billionth-song-a-few-days-after-launch/","source_text":"It took iTunes nearly three years to get to 1 billion song downloads. MySpace Music streamed a billion songs in just a few days after it launched on September 25. And while this isnâ€™t a fair comparison (songs on MySpace are free to stream; on iTunes users were paying $0.99 each), itâ€™s an incredible milestone.

What MySpace wonâ€™t say for some reason is what the billionth song was, or when exactly it was streamed (which would be nice for trivia purposes). But they are confirming that the billionth stream was initiated sometime last week, just a few days after launch. They are also issuing a rather convoluted statement:

    Weâ€™re extremely pleased with the launch of MySpace Musicâ€”clearly our users around the world are engaged and excited about the new music experience on MySpace. Weâ€™ve hit some incredible milestones in only a few daysâ€”some of the numbers youâ€™re reading about are already out of date.

    We can confirm that we hit a milestone of one billion music streams in only a few days after launching the new product however because this number may be inflated by the high profile launch and accompanying promotional push, we will be looking to our metrics on engagement and unique users which will tell a much richer story on how positively the community is responding to the new music experience. We will continue to keep you posted on the response to MySpace Music.

MySpace Musicâ€™s impact on the music industry wonâ€™t be fully understood for months or years (hereâ€™s our prediction). But one thing is certain - they are streaming a ton of music to users. The labels, which own part of the joint venture and are also paid per stream, must be very happy.","source_description":"MySpace Music Streamed Its Billionth Song â€œA Few Daysâ€ After Launch","stoneable_type":"Company","stoned_value":null,"stoned_value_type":null,"stoned_acquirer":null,"stoneable":{"name":"MySpace Music","permalink":"myspace-music"}}]
name: MySpace Music
overview:
MySpace Music is a joint music venture, with equity stakes from major labels, that allows users to stream music on demand, create playlists, and add widget music players to their profiles. The streaming will be advertising supported - at first via display ads (like Imeem), and later via in-stream audio ads. DRM-free downloads will also be available, either advertising supported or on a pay basis like Amazon’s Music Store.

The new company will own the MySpace music property, get a cash infusion of $120 million or so from parent company News Corp, and distribute that $120 million to Sony BMG, Universal Music Group and Warner Music Group.

Advertising revenue will be split among the joint venture partners according to their equity stakes, not based on play counts.

The new MySpace Music venture was first announced in February 2008. In July 2008 MySpace CEO Chris DeWolfe announced that it would launch in September 2008.

name: Anvato
overview:
Anvato, Inc. is a technology platform for media companies to manage and monetize live and on demand video assets.

Anvato serves both publishers and advertisers providing the only end-to-end media content platform with live and on-demand video management, syndication, monetization, and analytics. Anvato’s unique technology enables broadcasters to capture live broadcasts, edit live and syndicate to web and mobile devices near real time. Publishers can monetize live streams with dynamic and user-targeted ad insertion.

Anvato allows advertisers to track campaign effectiveness and optimize ad revenue. US Media clients include Univision Communications, and Kantar Video, a division of WPP. Anvato is the recipient of the 2010 Frost and Sullivan Global Innovation Award in Online Video. The company is headquartered in Mountain View, CA.

Kleiner is an investor through its iFund.

name: Network Foundation Technologies
overview:
Network Foundation Technologies (NFT) is developing a new kind of distributed networking technology for the real-time broadcast of audio and video media over the Internet at a cost point far below that offered by traditional online streaming media solutions.

Their goal is to provide the network foundation that will enable established content providers (such as television and cable networks) to simulcast their programming over the Internet at a cost point low enough to be supported by the broadcast advertising model.

name: Illumina Digital
overview:
Illumina Digital is a full service multiplatform media production company with a ten year track record projects across multiple media platforms, web, broadcast, mobile, social networks and print. Illlumina specializes in broadcast, entertainment, drama, culture and heritage, learning and public sector.

Major clients include Channel 4, BBC, Sky, Fremantle, Teachers TV, DCSF, DCMS, QIA, Nord Anglia, The National Theatre, Royal Shakespeare Company, Welsh Assembly, Kew Gardens, English National Opera, Victoria and Albert Museum, the BFI, and Queen Mary’s College University of London.

Illumina offers design, software development, and content creation in all media with an emphasis on broadcast quality video. The focus is on user centered design and development process, and project management methodology to deliver successful innovation including products and services from ePortfolios to a browser based video editor, and video console. Also provide services in consultancy, research, teaching and training.

name: Tribe of Noise
overview:
Headquartered in Amsterdam, Netherlands, Tribe of Noise is an online music community connecting musicians with business professionals in need for great music.

The Tribe community, legal framework, pro search engine, crowd sourcing tools and instore music services are launched for one principal purpose: facilitate artists to share music for in return for exposure, new revenue streams and business opportunities.

name: NuZoo Media
overview: NuZoo Media is a Chicago based multimedia and communications agency. NuZoo offers web and graphic design, video production, database development, interactive media, corporate identity, website hosting, and more.
tag_list: web-design, graphic-design, multimedia, video-production, animation, web-hosting, logo-design, corporate-identity

name: GSN
overview: GSN is a multimedia entertainment company that offers original and classic game programming via its 73-million subscriber television network and online games sites. GSN’s cross-platform content puts winning within reach for viewers and participants, whether through GSN’s popular TV game shows, gsn.com’s free casual games or its WorldWinner competitive cash tournaments. GSN is distributed throughout the U.S., Caribbean and Canada by all major cable operators, satellite providers and telcos. GSN and its subsidiary, WorldWinner.com, Inc., are owned by DIRECTV and Sony Pictures Entertainment.

name: Tunestory
overview:
Tunestory is a social network built around music podcasts that allows you to easily get new music on you iPod.

With Tunestory you can

  • Find new music on the Web, play it, rate it
  • Broadcast your music tastes with your personal music activity stream consisting of songs you play or rate — tune stream
  • Discover new music by subscribing to tune streams of people with similar tastes
  • Synchronize your tune stream and streams you’re subscribed to into your iPod via a podcast.

name: youCharades
overview:
youCharades.com - It’s all about playing Charades online and guessing the act.

Users can play charades and challenge their friends to guess a list of acts. The site offers not just movies but also interesting categories such as TV shows, music, books and famous personalities to choose from. The unique feature of the site is the ability for consumers to directly record their charade using their webcam that automatically connects with the site and allows a charade to be recorded and uploaded. Users can also video record acting a charade themselves and then submit the same to the site.

Charades can be embedded on to your blog or website too!

name: Pwned
overview:
Pwned is composed of real gamers who just wanted to build a place for everyone to enjoy and play games with others who play the same games. While the gaming industry constantly grows larger everyday, we offer a place for any type of gamer to connect and learn about the latest and greatest as well as the classic and epic. With our various features of interaction with other members, we are pioneers in connecting the gaming community in one place.

For developers, Pwned has a plethora of APIs that can be used to aggregate member statistics such as friends, games, comments and more to help engage our community with the rest of the world outside of Pwned.

name: CycleBiker
overview:
CycleBiker is an online biker dating and motorcycle social network for bikers. They offer customizable profiles, biker events and biker rides calendars along with thousands of biker babe and biker chicks videos and pictures. Play online motorcycle games or post in our forum or in your very own biker blog. They also provide an online motorcycle store with a free classifieds and motorcycles for sale section.

CycleBiker’s motto is ” For All Your Motorcycle And Biker Needs.”

name: imthemusic
overview:
Yelp for Music - with voting and fun interaction built in.

Currently a Facebook app, destination site coming Fall/Winter 2008.

name: InChairTV
overview:
InChairTV is a patient entertainment and marketing system for use in the dental chair. While patients are being treated, InChairTV allows you to watch TV shows and movies on a simulated 40 or 60 inch screen.

ICTV combines personal video eyewear with a “Netflix for Dentists” service that sends licensed, popular TV shows and movies to the headset. The shows are the same ones you watch on regular TV, but instead of commercials for Coke and Ford, that space is filled by short, fun matient education modules about dental services.

name: Popcuts
overview: Popcuts is a unique online music store. DRM-free songs are sold for 99cents, but every time a song you bought sells, you get a cut of the proceeds (earlier buyers get a bigger cut).

name: Canwest
overview:
Canwest is Canada’s leading international media company. Representing a portfolio of world-class brands, the Company creates and distributes some of the most compelling and dynamic content across multiple media platforms.

In Canada, the company’s diversified holdings include conventional television networks Global Television and E!, which reach almost 100% of English-speaking Canadians. The broadcast brands are complemented by 26 specialty networks capturing a 30.1% share of commercial specialty network viewers in Canada.

acquisition.source_description: Digital Chocolate Acquires Highly-Respected Sandlot Games
name: Sandlot Games
overview: Sandlot Games Corporation, headquartered in Bothell, Washington, is one of the world’s premier developer and publisher of casual and family-friendly games. Sandlot Games boasts a captivating portfolio of popular game titles and franchises including Cake Mania®, Super Granny®, Tradewinds® and Westward®. Sandlot Games reaches millions of game players worldwide through a variety of distribution channels including online, PC, mobile phones, handheld devices and videogame consoles. Since 2002, its games have been downloaded over 300 million times by its loyal fan base.

name: Veveo
offices: [{"description":"Corporate Headquarters","address1":"40 Shattuck Road","address2":"Suite #303","zip_code":"01810","city":"Andover","state_code":"MA","country_code":"USA","latitude":42.687142,"longitude":-71.212156},{"description":"Veveo India","address1":"8th Floor, Tower B","address2":"#150 Airport Road","zip_code":"560008","city":"Bangalore","state_code":null,"country_code":"IND","latitude":null,"longitude":null}]
overview:
Veveo is pioneering technologies that enable natural interfaces that support true conversational capabilities for connected devices and applications. Its SmartRelevance™ Conversational Platform is used by service providers & major smartphone manufacturers for intelligent search, personalization, and recommendation solutions. Veveo’s technologies have been deployed for more than 100 million devices.

Veveo’s conversational interfaces are designed to deliver rich, hyper-personalized user experiences that anticipate user intent toward driving higher engagement, content consumption, and monetization of products and services for device vendors, service providers and enterprises, across platforms of smartphones, tablets, TVs, and set-top boxes. Veveo has a growing intellectual property portfolio of more than 60 patent applications, with 32 issued patents. The venture-backed company is founded by serial technology entrepreneurs and based in Boston, MA. For more information visit www.veveo.net
