name: GoYoDeo
overview:
GoYoDeo provides a free online tool allowing anyone to publish video, photos and documents to their website, blog, MySpace or FaceBook.

Channels of video, photos and documents may be viewed at GoYoDeo.com/MyChannel Name, and also published just about anywhere.

Very unique to media player, is the ability to launch ON TOP of existing pages from a simple button script. When closed, the player simply vanishes, keeping the visitor on the current page without any interruption or redirect.

Build your channel today at www.GoYoDeo.com

name: AccuConference
overview:
AccuConference offers audio and web conferencing with collaborative tools and desktop sharing.

AccuConference began in 2002 with the philosophy of offering the lowest rates up front. Starting from the ground up, the entire AccuConference platform was built to ensure the highest quality and most features while maintaining competitive pricing. Whether you are part of a large company or a small-business owner, AccuConference always offers the lowest rate with the best quality and features.

Choose from pay-per-minute packages or flat-rate packages. AccuConference provides the tools you need to keep your participants engaged.

Included with all plans: -Web conferencing -Customer and Technical Support -Dynamic Live Call Screen -No contracts, set up fees, or minimum requirements

name: IndieMundo
overview:
Indiemundo allows independent artists to distribute their original music to fans. Artists can upload music to the website and allow family, friends and fans to download their music. Artists are paid by IndieMundo every time one of their songs is downloaded.

Currently, IndieMundo is non-profit and artist and fan account are free of charge. IndieMundo has also partnered with other music agencies and non-profits: Plant Studios in California, a non-profit recording studio, and also with The Real Big Deal in Gainesville, Florida, a music festival. IndieMundo’s main objective is to help new independent artists with their career and help them achieve their goals of success.

overview:
Ultizen Games Ltd. operates as a game development and offshore game outsourcing company in China. It involves in game design, level design, programming, art design, modeling, animation production, and testing services. The company offers online casual game PC, Xbox360 live arcade game, and U-PAL online casual game platform. Ultizen Games’ outsourcing services include art design, 2D art production, 3D modeling, and animation production on various platforms; porting and networking; testing and localization; game development; and IPTV game development. The company serves North American, European, and Japanese companies.

Ultizen Games Ltd. was founded in 2005 and is based in Shanghai, China.

name: LivePlace
overview: Very little is known about LivePlace. Their technology may have to do with 3d gaming rendered in the cloud, which allows for superior graphics on older computers and handheld devices.

name: Snipd
overview:
Grab pieces of enjoyable content from any page, save them online, and share without having to copy/paste using a simple bookmarklet. For bloggers and media sites, Snipd’s widget enables readership to Snip images, videos, or text enjoyed most within articles.

Snipd content becomes a destination for users, rather than a list of bookmarks because users are able to enjoy what they saved from within pages on the net.

With more and more content to sift through these days, Snipd makes it easier to identify hot-zones in articles. Hot-zones are dumbed-down heat maps for content. Readers can forget skimming and focus on what people are Snipping most on any page. Because a snip is an implicit vote on a piece of content, we aggregate and figure out what area of an article is attracting the most attention.

name: ModernMethod
overview:
ModernMethod develops topical community-oriented websites lead by staffed editors.

To date, they have built sites about video games, anime, and collectible toys that are “Elephant Powered,” which refers to their proprietary publishing system “ElephantBlog”. The software is built on PHP/MySQL from the ground-up and claims to be similar to AOL/WebLogs Inc. BlogSmith product

ModernMethod was founded in 1999 as a web development company by Yanier Gonzalez and Thomas Lackner, who met in a high school programming class. After a short-term partnership with advertising agency Worldmedia, the company was reinvented as a self-publishing start-up in March 2006.
tag_list: elephantblog, modernmethod, destructoid, blogging, community, web2-0, video-games, anime, toys

name: 1Cast
overview:
1Cast is an online and mobile broadcast news and information delivery platform that distributes professionally produced news content and delivers it in a personally relevant, micro-cast format. Cable and broadcast news networks worldwide use 1Cast to monetize their daily news programming, reach new audiences and add additional revenue streams.

DeNA’s current flagship business is its mobile social games platform Mobage (pronounced “moh-bah-geh”), which offers first-, second- and third-party games on multiple localized player networks worldwide.

name: Vollee
overview:
Vollee provides mobile gaming by streaming PC and console titles to 3G mobile handsets. Their hosted software platform is designed to enable intelligent adaptation and real-time delivery of commercial games, thereby aiming to lower costs and porting time.

The company was founded in 2005 and is headquartered in Herzelia, Israel.

name: Groopi
overview:
Groopi is a completely free service for musicians. It was designed to take all the cool-but-complicated services available to musicians on the web and combine them all in one place.

Created by musicians, the purpose of the project is not to make money, but to make the lives of musicians simpler by making the web that little bit easier to use for them.

With Groopi you get a free website for you band and each member in the badn. Each website includes a video and image gallery, lyric and score writers, a music gallery for previewing tracks, video conferencing, and network aspects that allow you to connect with other bands and other social networks.

They use the latest technologies and standards (such as the CSS3 drafts) available to push your browser to the MAX!
tag_list: free, music, musicians, band, myspace-alternative, css3, web-2-0, video, audio

name: MyElephantBites
overview:
MyElephantBites is a Web-based application that creates an interactive slide show with a cinema-like feel (photo-movies).

Static images are turned into exciting unrestricted photo-movies. User ultimately owns the end product and is free to download, email, or embed widget as he or she pleases.

Movie style effects allow users to simply pick a movie genre (Horror, Scifi, Action, etc) and have the appropriate effects automatically added.

The patented IDsfx technology acts as auto-director for the slideshow (or photomovie). After prompts to enter pictures and captions, users indicate the important parts of the photo and the technology does the rest…essentially replicating the thought process of an actual director.
tag_list: slideshows, slide-shows, photo-sharing, image-hosting, widgets, myspace-codes, web-publishing, music, self-expression, photo-movie, photomovie, community, download

name: twit+
overview: twit+ works on top of Twitter to let users send pictures, video, and other files to their friends on Twitter.
tag_list: twitter, video, picture, file-share, micro-blogging, blogginb, file-exchange, secure-file-share

name: Nonstop Riot
overview:
NonStop Riot, LLC, a music branding agency and new media company, brings brands, bands, and consumers together through the strategic use of music. It creates custom campaigns that are designed to build brand equity and sales volume.

The company was founded in 2006 and is based in Hollywood, California with additional offices in Los Angeles and Oakland.

name: Gossip Craze
overview:
Gossip Craze is a FREE Web 2.0 Portal designed for entertainment and fun.

A free place to add and browse your latest gossip, news, celebrity rumors, paparazzi photos, videos, community secrets, scandals, funny pictures, and much more.

We wanted to create a place for fun, local and celebrity news, so we created Gossip Craze.

Why?

Gossip Craze design is quick, easy, effective and affordable (because it’s free)!

Our design allows for maximum optimization and it’s you who controls the Gossip page and Gossip relevance! This helps your gossip get noticed more often, helps your site or blog ranking and, of course, we hope makes you money and fame !!!

Why not!

Gossip Craze — Upload anything you want, news, local gossip, funny photos, and more you control it!

Post it in a few seconds to the world.
tag_list: web-2-0, gossip, news, entertainment, celebrity-rumors, paparazzi-photos, videos, social-networking

name: OnAir Streaming Networks
overview:
OnAir Streaming Networks, Inc. went out of business. OnAir Streaming Networks, Inc. is a streaming media delivery network that develops multimedia streaming software and applications for digital and audio applications. The company’s software provides catalogs of songs to Websites, which want to start an Internet radio station. OnAir has a client base of 70,000 Websites.

The company was formerly known as WWW.COM Inc. OnAir was founded in 1998 and is headquartered in Irvine, California.

offices: [{"description":"HQ","address1":"Shanghai Zhangjiang Hi-Tech Park","address2":"690 Bibo Road, Building 5","zip_code":"20000","city":"Shanghai","state_code":null,"country_code":"CHN","latitude":null,"longitude":null}]
overview:
PPTV, jointly invested by several internationally well-known venture capital firms is an online video network technology platform provider serving China as well as Chinese communities around the world, and a pioneer in fifth-generation new media.

PPTV is the largest leading online TV service in China offering featured television shows, sports, entertainment, news and other popular video contents. It is characterised by its live-streaming service and professional video production. Based on the online video cloud platform PPCLOUDTM, PPTV is accessible from a variety of systems including a PC website (www.pptv.com), mobile phones and devices, and Internet TV or set-up boxes provided by certified carriers. PPTV offers clients timely, high-quality and interactive online media experiences.

PPTV was founded in May, 2005. Recently, it secured $420 million investment from Lenovo and Retailer Suning. An iResearch report shows that PPLive holds more than 60% of the online video live broadcasting market, making it the most popular online video entertainment platform among global Chinese communities.

Its close rivals are Youku.com, Tudou.com and Tecent Video.

name: Shattered Reality Interactive
overview:
Shattered Reality was founded in 2006 with the mission of creating online social immersive worlds, that are engaging, epic, and easy to understand whether the game is serious or casual. The big original vision was to create a theme based Massive Multiplayer Online Game that could be played in 5-10 minute time increments anytime, from anywhere.

Today popular online games, like World of Warcraft and Everquest, allow players to explore large and vast fantasy worlds, however they require huge time commitments and are considered “isolated” in their walled gardens. The games created by Shattered Reality provide “theme-based” and “hit-based” accomplishment for both the hardcore and casual gamers. What’s great about us is that we leverage the hardcore gaming production values and bridge the gap for online social games.

The first title to be released is, Legends of Kaos (LoK), a free 2 play multiplayer ancient sci-fi fantasy that combines the head-to-head play, collectability and trading associated with virtual powers and collectible action items. We also leverage level advancement and character development of massively multi-player games (MMORPGs) with the ease of access and community aspects of Web “two-point-oh” applications. LoK will also be available on Facebook and Myspace. LoK and other games developed by Shattered Reality are free 2 play. Players have the option to trade or sell items to other players and they can even sign up for VIP memberships for a small subscription fee.
tag_list: techcrunch50, tc50, games, mmo, social, online, casual-games

name: THE Movie Streamer
overview: This company shows free movies online on their website which, in fact, is not illegal since they are not the ones hosting the videos.

name: Whooligan
overview:
Whooligan is a new global soccer lifestyle brand created by social media.

Whooligan uses the slogan “Who’s your side” in an attempt to exploit global soccer rivalries and cultural identity. The Whooligan.com site is an interconnected network of forums, videos, photos, and special brand content. The company uses the site as a marketing vehicle for the brand to sell merchandise offline. They call their online/offline approach the Web 2.0. The site was launched in public beta in December 2008.

Whooligan was started by two brothers dedicated to providing soccer fans from every walk of life a chance to support their side against rivals. Whooligan users will be able to build their own brand, effectively turning the traditional roles of the producer and consumer in the marketplace upside down.
tag_list: videos, video, photo, photos, apparel, soccer, football, forums, web-2-0

name: Wevod
overview:
Wevod is a french company, based in Paris, that provides B2B online video plateform to simplify WebTV management.

In november 2006, Wevod launch a public video-mail portal : www.mailemotion.tv

Mailemotion is a free service made for everyone to send videos via email. Mailemotion is accessible form anywhere on the internet at the address : www.mailemotion.tv. It does not require any software installation and is compatible on all existing platforms. Simple and intuitive, the video could be either taken from from a webcam (or any kind of video device such as a mobile phone), or from a file already stored on the user’s computer (any kind of video type as it will be converted).

Mailemotion is also provided in white-branded platform.
tag_list: video, webtv, video-mail, communication, publishing, broadcasting, podcast

name: GazoPa
overview: GazoPa is an image search engine by Hitachi that uses features from an image to search for and identify similar images. There are abundant quantities of images on the web, however many of these simply cannot be described by keywords, keywords are not sufficient as conditions for image searches. Since GazoPa uses image features such as a color or a shape to search other similar images, a vast range of images can be retrieved from the web. In addition to images found using keyword searches, GazoPa enables the use of users’ own photos and drawings, and images found on the web, as search keys to locate similar images. GazoPa can support not only photo but also the search of video thumbnail. GazoPa lets users find favorite video from similarity of video thumbnail.
tag_list: techcrunch50, tc50, search, image-search, video-search, visual-search, search-engine

name: PlayPhone
overview:
PlayPhone provides social gaming solutions to the world’s leading wireless carriers, aggregating a global gaming community and offering game developers quick access to millions of gamers, seamless monetization and powerful marketing opportunities.

Game developers can use the FREE SDK to give games access to worldwide distribution through traditional, indie and carrier app stores, instant player matching, social gaming hooks and social network integration, virtual economy management tools, real-time analytics and the most advanced payment solutions available including one-click carrier billing. Integration takes just a few hours.

Headquartered in San Francisco, PlayPhone has a presence in more than 25 countries throughout North America, Europe, Asia, and Latin America. The FREE SDK is available at developer.playphone.com

name: plaYce
overview:
plaYce is “Making the World a Playground” by providing a 3D virtual world for games and social interaction, based on the real world.

plaYce’s proprietary technology automatically and accurately reconstructs the entire world in 3D and streams it with high frame rate from within the browser. Consequently, this unique, immersive, “Mirror World” gaming experience does not rely on a heavy client download. plaYce is designed such that every pixel has a world co-ordinate, enabling integration with user generated content and other forms of geo-tagged data.

plaYce connects gamers with their social graph through quick engagement, synchronous, social games. At the same time, plaYce provides Game-Infrastructure-as-a-Service, enabling independent developers to design games situated anywhere in the world: car races in Hong Kong, first-person shooters in the Amazon, treasure hunts in Manhattan, etc. Aside from the technological benefits, plaYce saves game designers 50-75% of development costs and significant time to market.

name: Bojam
overview: Bojam is an online music collaboration service connecting musicians by giving them a platform to mix, record, and collaborate to produce original or popular music. Musicians of all levels create or discover mixes to contribute to and connect with compatible musicians worldwide. They can use the Bojam Mixer to experience a song in its multi-track format, controlling individual instruments (eg muting or panning a track) and learning how to play a given part. Users record what they play and mix it with the song, then use advanced editing and sound effect tools to clean it up. Mass collaboration has been utilized in text (Wikipedia) and software (Firefox). Bojam does so with music, open-sourcing all aspects of the music creation process, including a wiki-style platform for adding song info, lyrics and instrument tabs. Bojam is open-source music and our goal is to revolutionize the music creation process by harnessing the skill, enthusiasm, and creativity of the music community.
tag_list: techcrunch50, tc50, music, online-music-collaboration, open-source, wiki, contribute, media, audio-recording, mixing

name: 360 Sports Software
overview:
OnePlaybook is a Internet-based application that helps sports coaches manage their team.

OnePlaybook is built around the idea of allowing a coach to communicate and teach his players without needing to physically be in front of them or physically give them anything as easily and quickly as possible. Instead, it is all done online. Using the most recent and up-to-date resources, this online sports software can give you exactly what you need and are looking for.

So, instead of printing out hundreds of sheets of paper, buying hundreds of binders, burning hundreds of DVDs, recording hundreds of tapes, or even trying to keep up with emailing everyone updates, just do it once on OnePlaybook and you’re done. All without fighting technology.

name: Tweegee
overview:
Tweegee L.P is holds the #1 social network and activities for kids in Russia, Turkey and Israel and Recently launch in Brazil and Argentina, now moving ahead to the rest of Latin America and Europe.

Tweegee is a pioneering destination site designed exclusively for kids (Tweens). The site empowers children and pre-teens ages 6 to 13 to express themselves creatively and safely through an innovative and customized online environment. Tweegee integrates social networking, digital content and interactive tools offering kids a complete web platform with high culture sensitive abilities

Tweegee reviewed and qualified for meeting the standards of the Children’s Advertising Review Unit’s kid’s privacy safe harbor program in the USA.

Key Facts

  • More then 3M unique kids visit Tweegee In Russia and Turkey every month alone.

  • Nestla, IKEA, Universal, Disney, CN, Toyota and many other global brands advertise regularly in Tweegee websites.

  • Tweegee won a several awards as the best kids community network in Russia, Turkey and Israel and in the US and was a nomine in “Techcrunch50” and was part of Bizspark1 program by Microsoft.

  • Tweegee expending Rapidly into South America & Europe and was recently launch in Brazil and Argentina.

name: Utagoe
overview:
Utagoe is a web company specializing in video and communication technologies. It is headquartered in Tokyo with a branch office in San Jose. The company name means “singing voice” in Japanese.

Utagoe was established in 2001 by Tom Sonoda, at that time still a PhD candidate at Tokyo’s Waseda University. The company’s first product, a search engine for music has been available for cell phones in Japan since 2004. Utagoe owns a number of proprietary video technologies.

Utagoe’s newest service is called Utagoe Live 100, a hub for video communication, streaming and broadcasting.

name: 2pad
overview:
2pad automatically retrieves photos and videos buried in Webmails folders and stores them in a private online gallery.

2pad’s automatic process works with most Webmail services (currently Hotmail, AOL, Gmail, MobileMe and all IMAP services) and will start by scanning all past emails to create the initial user’s gallery. It will then scan new emails once a week to update the gallery.

2pad’s gallery is a full-featured AJAX gallery allowing users to easily find, enjoy, share and print pictures. 2pad’s gallery is also iPhone enabled.

2pad’s ability to process both photos and videos allows users to send one single link to a mixed slide show. Recipients viewing this slide show can rate and comment it.

offices: [{"description":"Mailing Address","address1":"355 E. 72nd St., Suite 4E","address2":"","zip_code":"10021","city":"New York","state_code":"NY","country_code":"USA","latitude":40.768058,"longitude":-73.956599},{"description":"Corporate Headquarters","address1":"153 Roebling St.","address2":"","zip_code":"11211","city":"Brooklyn","state_code":"NY","country_code":"USA","latitude":40.714056,"longitude":-73.957854}]
overview:
Kidos is a new global learning and entertainment platform for families with children ages 3-7.

The free download allows a child to use her parent’s computer as if it were her own. Kidos aims to ease parents’ concerns about files being accidentally deleted, settings being changed or kids closing a browser by mistake. Because everything is stored locally a slow connection will not ruin the child’s (and therefor the parent’s) experience.

The secure, child-friendly and lightly animated interface lets children easily use all sorts of media: games, books, learning modules, music, video, and art. In addition to being free the download is also cross-platform (i.e., works on Mac, PC, or Linux). Parents can also add their own music, video, art, photos, and video.

Kidos then allows parents to purchase additional content via the interface directly from Kidos online store.

name: Gamelet
overview:
Gamelet is a multi-player gaming platform and social network where game developers can easily make and upload multi-player games and share with game players.

The Gamelet platform provides multi-player game hosting and a set of easy-to-use APIs to help game developers eliminate the need for server programming so that they can turn any innovative game design into a multi-player game instantly.

name: Hangout Industries
overview:
Hangout is building the next generation in social gaming by combining the powerful community of social networks with the rich immersion and engaging casual game-play of a 3D virtual world.

Play Games, Go Shopping, Throw Parties for Causes in Hangout Teen girls (and later guys) create their own personalized avatars, play casual mini-games, go shopping, throw parties for their friends, or just hangout. Playing games earns money for fashionable looks, new moves on the dance floor, or money to give to charity. At launch, players will be able to begin building their fashion empire as they level up to become a top fashion designer. Soon they can also aspire to become a dance master or the ultimate chef in order to throw the party of a lifetime, all in the name of a real charity of their choice. Hangout is about having fun with friends, meeting new people, and making a difference!

Hangout Uniquely Integrates Social Games with a Virtual World Each game we publish seamlessly plugs into the same virtual world, so players keep their avatars, possessions, and status from game to game. The integrated publishing approach results in improved cross-promotion and better player retention and monetization.

name: Apptism
overview:
Apptism is an iPhone app activity aggregator.

Apptism indexes all iPhone apps from the iTunes App Store and aggregates all of the latest news, reviews, and media related to the iPhone apps.

Apptism’s focus is to also provide extensive searching, sorting, and filtering capabilities to help the iPhone community find and track apps within the constantly growing App Store:

  • Sort by Recent Activity, Most Active, Popular Apps, Newest Apps, and Updated Apps.
  • Filter by Free/Paid, Category, Price, and Activity Type.

Some additional unique features include: Comparisons, Related Apps, e-mail and SMS alerts, Watch List, Version History, and more.

Apptism is currently in beta.

name: AccuConference
overview:
AccuConference offers audio and web conferencing with collaborative tools and desktop sharing.

AccuConference began in 2002 with the philosophy of offering the lowest rates up front. Starting from the ground up, the entire AccuConference platform was built to ensure the highest quality and most features while maintaining competitive pricing. Whether you are part of a large company or a small-business owner, AccuConference always offers the lowest rate with the best quality and features.

Choose from pay-per-minute packages or flat-rate packages. AccuConference provides the tools you need to keep your participants engaged.

Included with all plans: -Web conferencing -Customer and Technical Support -Dynamic Live Call Screen -No contracts, set up fees, or minimum requirements

name: IndieMundo
overview:
Indiemundo allows independent artists to distribute their original music to fans. Artists can upload music to the website and allow family, friends and fans to download their music. Artists are paid by IndieMundo every time one of their songs is downloaded.

Currently, IndieMundo is non-profit and artist and fan account are free of charge. IndieMundo has also partnered with other music agencies and non-profits: Plant Studios in California, a non-profit recording studio, and also with The Real Big Deal in Gainesville, Florida, a music festival. IndieMundo’s main objective is to help new independent artists with their career and help them achieve their goals of success.

overview:
Ultizen Games Ltd. operates as a game development and offshore game outsourcing company in China. It involves in game design, level design, programming, art design, modeling, animation production, and testing services. The company offers online casual game PC, Xbox360 live arcade game, and U-PAL online casual game platform. Ultizen Games’ outsourcing services include art design, 2D art production, 3D modeling, and animation production on various platforms; porting and networking; testing and localization; game development; and IPTV game development. The company serves North American, European, and Japanese companies.

Ultizen Games Ltd. was founded in 2005 and is based in Shanghai, China.

name: LivePlace
overview: Very little is known about LivePlace. Their technology may have to do with 3d gaming rendered in the cloud, which allows for superior graphics on older computers and handheld devices.

name: Snipd
overview:
Grab pieces of enjoyable content from any page, save them online, and share without having to copy/paste using a simple bookmarklet. For bloggers and media sites, Snipd’s widget enables readership to Snip images, videos, or text enjoyed most within articles.

Snipd content becomes a destination for users, rather than a list of bookmarks because users are able to enjoy what they saved from within pages on the net.

With more and more content to sift through these days, Snipd makes it easier to identify hot-zones in articles. Hot-zones are dumbed-down heat maps for content. Readers can forget skimming and focus on what people are Snipping most on any page. Because a snip is an implicit vote on a piece of content, we aggregate and figure out what area of an article is attracting the most attention.

name: ModernMethod
overview:
ModernMethod develops topical community-oriented websites lead by staffed editors.

To date, they have built sites about video games, anime, and collectible toys that are “Elephant Powered,” which refers to their proprietary publishing system “ElephantBlog”. The software is built on PHP/MySQL from the ground-up and claims to be similar to AOL/WebLogs Inc. BlogSmith product

ModernMethod was founded in 1999 as a web development company by Yanier Gonzalez and Thomas Lackner, who met in a high school programming class. After a short-term partnership with advertising agency Worldmedia, the company was reinvented as a self-publishing start-up in March 2006.
tag_list: elephantblog, modernmethod, destructoid, blogging, community, web2-0, video-games, anime, toys

name: 1Cast
overview:
1Cast is an online and mobile broadcast news and information delivery platform that distributes professionally produced news content and delivers it in a personally relevant, micro-cast format. Cable and broadcast news networks worldwide use 1Cast to monetize their daily news programming, reach new audiences and add additional revenue streams.

DeNA’s current flagship business is its mobile social games platform Mobage (pronounced “moh-bah-geh”), which offers first-, second- and third-party games on multiple localized player networks worldwide.

name: Vollee
overview:
Vollee provides mobile gaming by streaming PC and console titles to 3G mobile handsets. Their hosted software platform is designed to enable intelligent adaptation and real-time delivery of commercial games, thereby aiming to lower costs and porting time.

The company was founded in 2005 and is headquartered in Herzelia, Israel.

name: Groopi
overview:
Groopi is a completely free service for musicians. It was designed to take all the cool-but-complicated services available to musicians on the web and combine them all in one place.

Created by musicians, the purpose of the project is not to make money, but to make the lives of musicians simpler by making the web that little bit easier to use for them.

With Groopi you get a free website for you band and each member in the badn. Each website includes a video and image gallery, lyric and score writers, a music gallery for previewing tracks, video conferencing, and network aspects that allow you to connect with other bands and other social networks.

They use the latest technologies and standards (such as the CSS3 drafts) available to push your browser to the MAX!
tag_list: free, music, musicians, band, myspace-alternative, css3, web-2-0, video, audio

name: MyElephantBites
overview:
MyElephantBites is a Web-based application that creates an interactive slide show with a cinema-like feel (photo-movies).

Static images are turned into exciting unrestricted photo-movies. User ultimately owns the end product and is free to download, email, or embed widget as he or she pleases.

Movie style effects allow users to simply pick a movie genre (Horror, Scifi, Action, etc) and have the appropriate effects automatically added.

The patented IDsfx technology acts as auto-director for the slideshow (or photomovie). After prompts to enter pictures and captions, users indicate the important parts of the photo and the technology does the rest…essentially replicating the thought process of an actual director.
tag_list: slideshows, slide-shows, photo-sharing, image-hosting, widgets, myspace-codes, web-publishing, music, self-expression, photo-movie, photomovie, community, download

name: twit+
overview: twit+ works on top of Twitter to let users send pictures, video, and other files to their friends on Twitter.

name: Nonstop Riot
overview:
NonStop Riot, LLC, a music branding agency and new media company, brings brands, bands, and consumers together through the strategic use of music. It creates custom campaigns that are designed to build brand equity and sales volume.

The company was founded in 2006 and is based in Hollywood, California with additional offices in Los Angeles and Oakland.

name: Gossip Craze
overview:
Gossip Craze is a FREE Web 2.0 Portal designed for entertainment and fun.

A free place to add and browse your latest gossip, news, celebrity rumors, paparazzi photos, videos, community secrets, scandals, funny pictures, and much more.

We wanted to create a place for fun, local and celebrity news, so we created Gossip Craze.

Why?

Gossip Craze design is quick, easy, effective and affordable (because it’s free)!

Our design allows for maximum optimization and it’s you who controls the Gossip page and Gossip relevance! This helps your gossip get noticed more often, helps your site or blog ranking and, of course, we hope makes you money and fame !!!

Why not!

Gossip Craze — Upload anything you want, news, local gossip, funny photos, and more you control it!

Post it in a few seconds to the world.
tag_list: web-2-0, gossip, news, entertainment, celebrity-rumors, paparazzi-photos, videos, social-networking

name: OnAir Streaming Networks
overview:
OnAir Streaming Networks, Inc. went out of business. OnAir Streaming Networks, Inc. is a streaming media delivery network that develops multimedia streaming software and applications for digital and audio applications. The company’s software provides catalogs of songs to Websites, which want to start an Internet radio station. OnAir has a client base of 70,000 Websites.

The company was formerly known as WWW.COM Inc. OnAir was founded in 1998 and is headquartered in Irvine, California.

offices: [{"description":"HQ","address1":"Shanghai Zhangjiang Hi-Tech Park","address2":"690 Bibo Road, Building 5","zip_code":"20000","city":"Shanghai","state_code":null,"country_code":"CHN","latitude":null,"longitude":null}]
overview:
PPTV, jointly invested by several internationally well-known venture capital firms is an online video network technology platform provider serving China as well as Chinese communities around the world, and a pioneer in fifth-generation new media.

PPTV is the largest leading online TV service in China offering featured television shows, sports, entertainment, news and other popular video contents. It is characterised by its live-streaming service and professional video production. Based on the online video cloud platform PPCLOUDTM, PPTV is accessible from a variety of systems including a PC website (www.pptv.com), mobile phones and devices, and Internet TV or set-up boxes provided by certified carriers. PPTV offers clients timely, high-quality and interactive online media experiences.

PPTV was founded in May, 2005. Recently, it secured $420 million investment from Lenovo and Retailer Suning. An iResearch report shows that PPLive holds more than 60% of the online video live broadcasting market, making it the most popular online video entertainment platform among global Chinese communities.

Its close rivals are Youku.com, Tudou.com and Tecent Video.

name: Shattered Reality Interactive
overview:
Shattered Reality was founded in 2006 with the mission of creating online social immersive worlds, that are engaging, epic, and easy to understand whether the game is serious or casual. The big original vision was to create a theme based Massive Multiplayer Online Game that could be played in 5-10 minute time increments anytime, from anywhere.

Today popular online games, like World of Warcraft and Everquest, allow players to explore large and vast fantasy worlds, however they require huge time commitments and are considered “isolated” in their walled gardens. The games created by Shattered Reality provide “theme-based” and “hit-based” accomplishment for both the hardcore and casual gamers. What’s great about us is that we leverage the hardcore gaming production values and bridge the gap for online social games.

The first title to be released is, Legends of Kaos (LoK), a free 2 play multiplayer ancient sci-fi fantasy that combines the head-to-head play, collectability and trading associated with virtual powers and collectible action items. We also leverage level advancement and character development of massively multi-player games (MMORPGs) with the ease of access and community aspects of Web “two-point-oh” applications. LoK will also be available on Facebook and Myspace. LoK and other games developed by Shattered Reality are free 2 play. Players have the option to trade or sell items to other players and they can even sign up for VIP memberships for a small subscription fee.
tag_list: techcrunch50, tc50, games, mmo, social, online, casual-games

name: Whooligan
overview:
Whooligan is a new global soccer lifestyle brand created by social media.

Whooligan uses the slogan “Who’s your side” in an attempt to exploit global soccer rivalries and cultural identity. The Whooligan.com site is an interconnected network of forums, videos, photos, and special brand content. The company uses the site as a marketing vehicle for the brand to sell merchandise offline. They call their online/offline approach the Web 2.0. The site was launched in public beta in December 2008.

Whooligan was started by two brothers dedicated to providing soccer fans from every walk of life a chance to support their side against rivals. Whooligan users will be able to build their own brand, effectively turning the traditional roles of the producer and consumer in the marketplace upside down.
tag_list: videos, video, photo, photos, apparel, soccer, football, forums, web-2-0

name: Wevod
overview:
Wevod is a french company, based in Paris, that provides B2B online video plateform to simplify WebTV management.

In november 2006, Wevod launch a public video-mail portal : www.mailemotion.tv

Mailemotion is a free service made for everyone to send videos via email. Mailemotion is accessible form anywhere on the internet at the address : www.mailemotion.tv. It does not require any software installation and is compatible on all existing platforms. Simple and intuitive, the video could be either taken from from a webcam (or any kind of video device such as a mobile phone), or from a file already stored on the user’s computer (any kind of video type as it will be converted).

Mailemotion is also provided in white-branded platform.
tag_list: video, webtv, video-mail, communication, publishing, broadcasting, podcast

name: GazoPa
overview: GazoPa is an image search engine by Hitachi that uses features from an image to search for and identify similar images. There are abundant quantities of images on the web, however many of these simply cannot be described by keywords, keywords are not sufficient as conditions for image searches. Since GazoPa uses image features such as a color or a shape to search other similar images, a vast range of images can be retrieved from the web. In addition to images found using keyword searches, GazoPa enables the use of users’ own photos and drawings, and images found on the web, as search keys to locate similar images. GazoPa can support not only photo but also the search of video thumbnail. GazoPa lets users find favorite video from similarity of video thumbnail.
tag_list: techcrunch50, tc50, search, image-search, video-search, visual-search, search-engine

name: PlayPhone
overview:
PlayPhone provides social gaming solutions to the world’s leading wireless carriers, aggregating a global gaming community and offering game developers quick access to millions of gamers, seamless monetization and powerful marketing opportunities.

Game developers can use the FREE SDK to give games access to worldwide distribution through traditional, indie and carrier app stores, instant player matching, social gaming hooks and social network integration, virtual economy management tools, real-time analytics and the most advanced payment solutions available including one-click carrier billing. Integration takes just a few hours.

Headquartered in San Francisco, PlayPhone has a presence in more than 25 countries throughout North America, Europe, Asia, and Latin America. The FREE SDK is available at developer.playphone.com

name: plaYce
overview:
plaYce is “Making the World a Playground” by providing a 3D virtual world for games and social interaction, based on the real world.

plaYce’s proprietary technology automatically and accurately reconstructs the entire world in 3D and streams it with high frame rate from within the browser. Consequently, this unique, immersive, “Mirror World” gaming experience does not rely on a heavy client download. plaYce is designed such that every pixel has a world co-ordinate, enabling integration with user generated content and other forms of geo-tagged data.

plaYce connects gamers with their social graph through quick engagement, synchronous, social games. At the same time, plaYce provides Game-Infrastructure-as-a-Service, enabling independent developers to design games situated anywhere in the world: car races in Hong Kong, first-person shooters in the Amazon, treasure hunts in Manhattan, etc. Aside from the technological benefits, plaYce saves game designers 50-75% of development costs and significant time to market.
tag_list: techcrunch50, tc50, gaming, virtual-world, mirror-world, 3d, geo

name: Bojam
overview: Bojam is an online music collaboration service connecting musicians by giving them a platform to mix, record, and collaborate to produce original or popular music. Musicians of all levels create or discover mixes to contribute to and connect with compatible musicians worldwide. They can use the Bojam Mixer to experience a song in its multi-track format, controlling individual instruments (eg muting or panning a track) and learning how to play a given part. Users record what they play and mix it with the song, then use advanced editing and sound effect tools to clean it up. Mass collaboration has been utilized in text (Wikipedia) and software (Firefox). Bojam does so with music, open-sourcing all aspects of the music creation process, including a wiki-style platform for adding song info, lyrics and instrument tabs. Bojam is open-source music and our goal is to revolutionize the music creation process by harnessing the skill, enthusiasm, and creativity of the music community.
tag_list: techcrunch50, tc50, music, online-music-collaboration, open-source, wiki, contribute, media, audio-recording, mixing

name: 360 Sports Software
overview:
OnePlaybook is a Internet-based application that helps sports coaches manage their team.

OnePlaybook is built around the idea of allowing a coach to communicate and teach his players without needing to physically be in front of them or physically give them anything as easily and quickly as possible. Instead, it is all done online. Using the most recent and up-to-date resources, this online sports software can give you exactly what you need and are looking for.

So, instead of printing out hundreds of sheets of paper, buying hundreds of binders, burning hundreds of DVDs, recording hundreds of tapes, or even trying to keep up with emailing everyone updates, just do it once on OnePlaybook and you’re done. All without fighting technology.

name: Tweegee
overview:
Tweegee L.P is holds the #1 social network and activities for kids in Russia, Turkey and Israel and Recently launch in Brazil and Argentina, now moving ahead to the rest of Latin America and Europe.

Tweegee is a pioneering destination site designed exclusively for kids (Tweens). The site empowers children and pre-teens ages 6 to 13 to express themselves creatively and safely through an innovative and customized online environment. Tweegee integrates social networking, digital content and interactive tools offering kids a complete web platform with high culture sensitive abilities

Tweegee reviewed and qualified for meeting the standards of the Children’s Advertising Review Unit’s kid’s privacy safe harbor program in the USA.

Key Facts

  • More then 3M unique kids visit Tweegee In Russia and Turkey every month alone.

  • Nestla, IKEA, Universal, Disney, CN, Toyota and many other global brands advertise regularly in Tweegee websites.

  • Tweegee won a several awards as the best kids community network in Russia, Turkey and Israel and in the US and was a nomine in “Techcrunch50” and was part of Bizspark1 program by Microsoft.

  • Tweegee expending Rapidly into South America & Europe and was recently launch in Brazil and Argentina.

name: Utagoe
overview:
Utagoe is a web company specializing in video and communication technologies. It is headquartered in Tokyo with a branch office in San Jose. The company name means “singing voice” in Japanese.

Utagoe was established in 2001 by Tom Sonoda, at that time still a PhD candidate at Tokyo’s Waseda University. The company’s first product, a search engine for music has been available for cell phones in Japan since 2004. Utagoe owns a number of proprietary video technologies.

Utagoe’s newest service is called Utagoe Live 100, a hub for video communication, streaming and broadcasting.

name: 2pad
overview:
2pad automatically retrieves photos and videos buried in Webmails folders and stores them in a private online gallery.

2pad’s automatic process works with most Webmail services (currently Hotmail, AOL, Gmail, MobileMe and all IMAP services) and will start by scanning all past emails to create the initial user’s gallery. It will then scan new emails once a week to update the gallery.

2pad’s gallery is a full-featured AJAX gallery allowing users to easily find, enjoy, share and print pictures. 2pad’s gallery is also iPhone enabled.

2pad’s ability to process both photos and videos allows users to send one single link to a mixed slide show. Recipients viewing this slide show can rate and comment it.

offices: [{"description":"Mailing Address","address1":"355 E. 72nd St., Suite 4E","address2":"","zip_code":"10021","city":"New York","state_code":"NY","country_code":"USA","latitude":40.768058,"longitude":-73.956599},{"description":"Corporate Headquarters","address1":"153 Roebling St.","address2":"","zip_code":"11211","city":"Brooklyn","state_code":"NY","country_code":"USA","latitude":40.714056,"longitude":-73.957854}]
overview:
Kidos is a new global learning and entertainment platform for families with children ages 3-7.

The free download allows a child to use her parent’s computer as if it were her own. Kidos aims to ease parents’ concerns about files being accidentally deleted, settings being changed or kids closing a browser by mistake. Because everything is stored locally a slow connection will not ruin the child’s (and therefor the parent’s) experience.

The secure, child-friendly and lightly animated interface lets children easily use all sorts of media: games, books, learning modules, music, video, and art. In addition to being free the download is also cross-platform (i.e., works on Mac, PC, or Linux). Parents can also add their own music, video, art, photos, and video.

Kidos then allows parents to purchase additional content via the interface directly from Kidos online store.

name: Gamelet
overview:
Gamelet is a multi-player gaming platform and social network where game developers can easily make and upload multi-player games and share with game players.

The Gamelet platform provides multi-player game hosting and a set of easy-to-use APIs to help game developers eliminate the need for server programming so that they can turn any innovative game design into a multi-player game instantly.

name: Hangout Industries
overview:
Hangout is building the next generation in social gaming by combining the powerful community of social networks with the rich immersion and engaging casual game-play of a 3D virtual world.

Play Games, Go Shopping, Throw Parties for Causes in Hangout Teen girls (and later guys) create their own personalized avatars, play casual mini-games, go shopping, throw parties for their friends, or just hangout. Playing games earns money for fashionable looks, new moves on the dance floor, or money to give to charity. At launch, players will be able to begin building their fashion empire as they level up to become a top fashion designer. Soon they can also aspire to become a dance master or the ultimate chef in order to throw the party of a lifetime, all in the name of a real charity of their choice. Hangout is about having fun with friends, meeting new people, and making a difference!

Hangout Uniquely Integrates Social Games with a Virtual World Each game we publish seamlessly plugs into the same virtual world, so players keep their avatars, possessions, and status from game to game. The integrated publishing approach results in improved cross-promotion and better player retention and monetization.

name: Apptism
overview:
Apptism is an iPhone app activity aggregator.

Apptism indexes all iPhone apps from the iTunes App Store and aggregates all of the latest news, reviews, and media related to the iPhone apps.

Apptism’s focus is to also provide extensive searching, sorting, and filtering capabilities to help the iPhone community find and track apps within the constantly growing App Store:

  • Sort by Recent Activity, Most Active, Popular Apps, Newest Apps, and Updated Apps.
  • Filter by Free/Paid, Category, Price, and Activity Type.

Some additional unique features include: Comparisons, Related Apps, e-mail and SMS alerts, Watch List, Version History, and more.

Apptism is currently in beta.

name: Muzui
overview:
Muzui is an online casual gaming network where players can challenge each other and play against eachother either online or on the mobile phone. Users can sign in using their FaceBook or MSN ID, or just register at MuZui. MuZui has had over 7 mio downloads during their beta, and have secured funding from top web 2.0 innovator Morten Lund (seed investor in Skype and co-founder of Zyb).

The company was founded by three brothes from Denmark, who worked for three years without funding working full-time out of their apartment.

name: Endavo Media and Communications
overview: Endavo Media is an OTT Video Services Platform, enabling the delivery of high-quality commercial video services for OTT Service Providers and planet-wide syndication for digital media and entertainment. Endavo’s Solution-as-a-Service provides acquisition, management, monetization and multi-screen distribution of digital media, including live and on-demand video, radio, audio and images, all in one delivery system. We now also offer “out of the box” and custom user-facing website and application services for seamless user experience delivery. For more information visit us at www.endavomedia.com.

name: Vidiac
overview:
Vidiac is a hosted white label UGC Video community engine first launched in 2004.

Founded in Atlanta, Georgia in 2004, the original founding team included Adam Bruce, Jeremy Farber and Chris Jones.

In 2007 Vidiac was merged with StreetFire.net. Today the company operates as brand under StreetFire INC and provides video sharing service to a thousand active video sharing domains.

name: Brightstorm
overview: A video tutorial Website where great teachers can reach more students and make some money on the side doing so. The site targets high school students who need extra help with their classes or preparing for standardized tests like the SAT.

name: Visionary Networks
overview: Media Community, LLC provides online entertainment and self-help content. It focuses on Astrology and its alternatives, such as Tarot, Numerology, and I-Ching. Media Community, LLC was formerly known as Visionary Networks, Inc. and changed its name to Media Community, LLC in 2007. The company was founded in 1989 and is based in Portland, Oregon. As of January 26, 2007, Media Community, LLC is a subsidiary of NameMedia, Inc.

name: GeogTV
overview:
GeogTV is a global TV channel search engine that provides web users with information and details on a worldwide database of TV channels in a social environment. The database is searchable by keyword, city, state, region, country or continent. Other browsing methods include interactive map exploration and a more visual logo directory.

GeogTV also allows users to create, manage and broadcast their own revenue generating channel with a live webcam and pre-recorded videos. Some features include show scheduling, video uploads, audio uploads, image uploads and a pay channel mode to charge viewers subscriptions

name: OUTSHOUTS
overview:
OUTSHOUTS is a free social media site that allows you to find a video or mp3 from the web, then turn it into your own personal e-card by mashing in your own video, audio, text and photos. You can send OUTSHOUTS to any email address or mobile phone, post to blogs, or embed OUTSHOUTS on web profile pages like Facebook, Twitter and Myspace.

In three easy steps OUTSHOUTS allows users to search and select from a wide universe of web content, then create a rich media message without the need for downloads, mixing software or special players. Applications include song dedications, birthday e-cards, invites, introducing your band, advancing a cause, romancing a sweetheart, product and service marketing, and customizing your social network pages with rich video messages.

name: Club Scene Network
overview:
Club Scene Media Group is a niche social network for nightlife, entertainment & fashion.

Our mission is “To promote nightlife, entertainment & Fashion through niche social networks and special events.”

“Club Scene Media Group, Inc. (Club Scene) is developing a global brand for nightlife, entertainment and fashion through a network of niche social networks. Club Scene has developed a unique business model where our social networks are fully integrated with events bringing virtual communities to reality. Club Scene will utilize the social networks as a marketing tool to drive traffic to our events and vice versa.

Club Scene is based in Las Vegas, NV and is producing events with celebrities and well known brands (companies). Our events range from product launches to star studded events to weekly events at popular nightclubs.

Club Scene is developing ClubSceneMedia.Com, a niche social network for people interested in nightlife and entertainment featuring the most comprehensive directory of nightclubs, bars, restaurants, lounges and up-to-date event calendars connecting members with their local nightlife.

ClubSceneMedia.Com is an online resource to access different types of content such as videos, pictures, news, gossip and blogs.”
tag_list: las-vegas, nightlife, entertainment, fashion, clubscene, social-network, clubs, bars, lounges, events, sms, mobile, community

name: TWIOA
overview:
TWIOA provides video and audio sharing and social networking in a unique mix of media sharing and networking that is becoming popular in today’s market.

TWIOA was founded on June 10, 2008. It started off with video and audio sharing, but later added games and groups. TWIOA has announced that it has plans to unveil article sharing and a forum within the next year. Growing steadily, TWIOA hopes it can capitalize on the media sharing and social networking market that Facebook and Youtube already are thriving in.

name: Fat Dalmation
overview: Fat Dalmation is an interdisciplinary multimedia studio based in Israel. Our studio oversee every aspect of multimedia production, from conception through realization. Our studio focus on Flash / 3D animation / AfterFX websites. Also we are in full power on AIR application development.

name: Wikeez
offices: [{"description":"Head Office","address1":"3rd Floor, Feghali Building","address2":"Al Salam School Street","zip_code":"","city":"Beirut","state_code":null,"country_code":"LBN","latitude":null,"longitude":null}]
overview:
Wikeez is an entertainment platform. It allows members to discuss with each other, to create their own group of fans, post photos and videos, vote, and comment about the hottest topics.

Wikeez helps people stay up to date. It is the first social entertainment website gathering fans from the Middle East and Africa.

Wikeez offers users information about Arab culture and show business. Wikeez links to users’ passions, centered around movies, celebrities, TV shows, music, and sports. Users can publish and exchange on the spot information about their favorite subjects.

name: Heatwave Interactive
overview: Located in Austin, Texas, Heatwave Interactive is an entertainment software company whose mission is to create original, character-based games that unite the power of online gaming with the excitement of traditional video games.

overview: YoYo Games is the home of GameMaker: Studio, the fastest and easiest to use cross-platform game development platform. GameMaker: Studio has been developed with usability and efficiency at its core, allowing developers to create games in a single code base and then publish them to run natively across an unprecedented number platforms including Android, iOS, OS X, HTML5, Tizen, Ubuntu, Windows 8, Windows Phone 8 and Windows RT. Together the entire GameMaker family of products has been downloaded more than five million times. YoYo Games is based in Dundee, Scotland with an office in Mountain View. Follow @YoYoGames on Twitter and YoYo Games, Ltd on Facebook. www.yoyogames.com

name: Equedia
overview:
Equedia is a dedicated social media release platform for finance and business. We allow users to share business news, videos & information through a social web experience.

Practically every press release issued by public corporations, analysts, and business media is published without video or audio, and most do not include images, graphs, or links to additional information or supporting content.

Using video & user generated content, we go deep into a story behind a company, giving investors the context they need to understand their investments while providing a system for public companies to effectively present their news and operations.

With the help of analysts, business media, corporations, and other investors Equedia provides a website that allows the business community to follow and keep up with third party opinions, news, and relevant information on the stocks they own.

The new world of finance through Equedia’s web portal is no longer a one way street. It’s about connecting information across social networks, the people looking for it, as well as the conversations that connect them. Equedia will help the investment community by giving them a single resource that provides them with everything they need — an informative social media experience dedicated to the world of finance.

All information posted by each group is easily found and searchable through Equedia’s search function: Tag and Deliver.
tag_list: social-network, investment, stock-trading, tag-and-deliver, video-presentation, video-upload, analysts, business-media, connect

name: schmedley
overview: Schmedley is an online start page that provides useful widgets for browsing around the Web. The site is currently in private beta, but will launch in public beta soon.

name: PlisTube
overview: PlisTube is a site that allows users to make personalized playlists of music videos, of a particular musician or band.

name: MP3Tunes
overview: MP3Tunes serves as an online database for music and MP3s. Music files are uploaded from a personal music collection and stored in an online music “locker,” which makes the tunes available from any web browser, as well as most mobile devices and many home entertainment systems.

name: Radio One Llama
overview: Radio One Llama is a hub and search engine for online radio stations.

name: Whereismyboss
overview:
Whereismyboss (aka WIMB) is an innovative job board which tackles all the recruitment problems faced by the Employers and Jobseekers in the present day world by inculcating the most advanced technologies like Artificial Intelligence and Online Video Interviews.

Efficient “Search” process is achieved through Artificial Intelligence which provides accurate search results. “Selection” process is executed through our patent-pending feature LiveConnect™ - Online video Interviewing platform.

WIMB’s value added services include - Virtual Job fair, Institutional hire, Presence Server and much more.
tag_list: online-interviews, live-video-interviews, jobs-in-india, online-recruitment, career-gateway, job-portal, job-board, effective-hiring

name: Videofropper
overview:
Videofropper is a video broadcasting platform that allows users to upload, enhance and share their video from their browser. The site also allows users to upload in bulk, add deep tags at specific times.

The company is looking for funding and aims to launch WebTV channel by end of this year.

name: SnackFeed
overview: SnackFeed is an online service that continually indexes video content to intelligently offer viewing options that are of interest to the user. The current online video market is extremely fragmented with more and more content being uploaded in more and more places every day. Trying to reach out, manage and organize this content has become frustrating. By combining a number of factors, SnackFeed creates a viewing profile for each user incorporating what you watch, who your friends are and what they are watching. Eventually users will be able to follow the video activities of friends—if they upload, blog or share videos, SnackFeed users will receive updates through their “feed,” leveraging the power of social networks and video viewing habits to deliver interesting video content to you.

name: BuzzPal
overview:
BuzzPal is P2P Travel 2.0, helping people find, connect with, and stay with each other in the real world.

The brand is trademarked in the US and Europe. Currently, BuzzPal is pre-launch, in development, funded by founder’s capital.

The goal is to bootstrap through prototype, then raise an angel round for development, recruiting, launch, and growth.
tag_list: social, travel, communty, p2p, marketplace, entertainment, friends, dating

name: FanPrice
overview:
The premise of the FanPrice website is far from complicated: it enables fans and followers of music bands and sports team to keep track of upcoming gigs and events and buy seats for them by making an offer that is brought to the consideration of online sellers.

When making the online offer, it is possible to specify the intended seating location via the provided venue map. Also, if you have no idea how much should you pay there is a “Get User Suggested Price” tool that can point you in the right direction.

The site also features an artist search that will let you look up not only artists and teams but also specific events, whereas a “Browse Tickets” category is included. This is broken into different categories such as “NFL,” “MLB” and “NCAA” along with “Theatre” and “Concerts.”

name: ReplayGamez
overview: ReplayGamez is a new online video game trading site. ReplayGamez uniquely offers their users a easy to use prepaid mailer and game validation process to insure the customer receives quality games.

name: Absolute Punk
overview:
Founded in 2000, Absolute Punk is an online source for alternative music, industry news, reviews, interviews and community.

In May 2008, Buzznet, (www.buzznet.com), a social media community for music, acquired Absolute Punk.

name: Ilse media
overview:
Ilse media b.v. engages in online publishing. The company also operates a search engine. It offers sites on the ilse media network to search for information, news, and entertainment on the Internet. It also provides online advertising through its Internet portals.

Ilse media b.v. was formerly known as Ilse and changed its name to Ilse media b.v. in 2000. Ilse media b.v. was founded in 1996 and is based in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. As per the transaction announced on July 5, 2000, Ilse media b.v. is a subsidiary of Sanoma Uitgevers B.V.

name: Musicreview
overview: Musicreview magazine reviews unsigned music from all over the world.

name: Denook
overview: Denook is simple. We want to bring everyday projects to life. Whether it’s a logo, website, a piece of apparel, or illustration. Our community of designers will create it for a prize. We save the headache of looking for designers and clients to work with. It’s easy to start a project here, or participate in one. Hours after a project is up, you’ll see it’s already exposed to our community where great ideas are put in front of you. At the end, you choose the best design!

name: SportsGenie
overview:
SportsGenie.net caters to a large and growing population of sports enthusiasts via a broad array of real-time team and player statistics, calculations, formulas and algorithms. Members gain exclusive access to run unlimited scenarios based on countless on-field player interactions and team variables, with simulated results reporting offered in seconds.

Features include:

o Expansive, updated statistical database on more than 700,000 college and 50,000 NFL games o Real-time adaptation based on current environments o Customizable user platform o User-driven simulator with adjustable offensive depth charts, ATS stats, over/under stats o Comprehensive NFL and CFB seasonal predictions o Unbiased power and confidence rankings o Weekly updates based on in-depth charts, rosters and strength-of-schedule-adjusted stats o Anytime, anywhere online access

name: One Season
overview: OneSeason.com is a virtual sports trading platform with social features and content for sports fans. The system provides sports enthusiasts with a way to compete, interact and have a vested interest in their passion. The Company is located a chip shot from AT&T Park in downtown San Francisco, California.

name: VooVeo
overview:
VooVeo is an online TV network, bored of conventionally media VooVeo produces its content for what it believes to be the future of Television, the Internet.

Instead of producing the standard definition of what an Internet Podcast has come to be. VooVeo produces its own scripted television shows similar to the likes of Lost, The Sopranos and Heroes.

An emphasis is put on how the content is produced and is part the companies mission statement “to keep the audience coming back”. Instead of tuning into ABC to catch the latest episode of Lost each week, VooVeo hopes viewers will do the same for its shows, but online.

Adapting the content to the web allows VooVeo to cut production times and costs dramatically. Still retaining the quality needed to produce a high quality broadcast. The content is diverse and all privately produced through VooVeo.

Due to launch sometime in 2009.

name: MXP4
overview:
MXP4 develops interactive music solutions that create revenue opportunities for the music, media and marketing industries. Creating a video game-like environment where consumers can play with the music, MXP4-powered applications are proven to drive engagement, viral distribution and music purchases. The MXP4 Everywhere roadmap ensures the interactive music technology is readily available in third party services, apps and music formats for implementation by brands, advertisers, media portals, mobile applications, music distribution platforms and third-party music formats. When a fan sees the MXP4 logo on a music app, it means they can play with the music.

MXP4 is led by a team of music industry and digital media experts, including former senior executives of Musiwave, Vivendi Mobile Entertainment, EMI Music and DivX. The company is backed by Orkos Capital, Sofinnova Partners and Ventech.
tag_list: interactive-music, interactive-music-games, social-music-games, social-music-gaming, play-with-it, interactive-music-solution

name: TutCast
overview:
TutCast, a sub company of Iceflow Studios, is an online design video training service dedicated to providing free training to all who need it.

Launched on the IceflowStudios’ YouTube channel*, TutCast has a combined 150+ Photoshop tutorials and will soon expand into Dreamweaver, Flash, Illustrator and much more. The end objective is to become the leading free video training service on the web.

Currently, the majority of TutCast’s training videos are hosted on the YouTube channel and are slowly being uploaded to TutCast.com in higher quality.

*TutCast’s YouTube channel: http://www.youtube.com/IceflowStudios

name: Fusion Creative Studios
overview: Fusion Creative Studios is a leading authorized Apple, Blackberry, Android and Palm developer of social, gaming and business apps for mobile platforms and social networks. FCS is committed to developing innovative mobile programs that play, work, and engage wherever you go. For more information about Fusion Creative Studios go to http://www.fusioncreativestudios.com

name: Noteflight
overview: Noteflight, LLC is located in Cambridge, Massachusetts, and is dedicated to reinventing the way that people create, share and use written music. The product doesn’t merely improve on other music notation software: it lets written music take advantage of the full power of the web as we know it today. Noteflight is a powerful full-featured application to edit, display and play back music notation in a standard web browser, integrated in an online library of musical scores that anyone can publish, link to, or embed.

name: K'NEX Industries
overview:
K’NEX Industries, Inc., a construction toy company, manufactures and markets construction sets for children and parents in the United States. It offers bricks, rods, connectors, panels, wheels and gears, grab bags, motors, accessories, logs, trains and toys, and instructions for building thrill rides, multi-model buildings, and vehicles, as well as for other fun and educational activities. The company also provides educators with manipulatives, ideas, and lesson plans that promote student engagement in math, science, and technology. Its manipulatives, ideas, and lesson plans include models of machines and bridges for elementary and secondary school physical science standards; DNA, replication, and transcription sets for life sciences standards; and shapes, lines, segments, and angles for math and geometry standards. The company offers its products online.

K’NEX Industries, Inc. was founded in 1992 and is headquartered in Hatfield, Pennsylvania.

name: Meteor Games
overview:
Meteor Games is an online games studio founded in 2007 by Adam and Donna Powell, creators of the original Web phenomenon Neopets. At Neopets, Adam and Donna grew the company from a bedroom operation into a worldwide sensation.

With Meteor Games, their ambition is to bring the same charm, wit and sense of fun that made Neopets such a hit to an even wider audience across the Web and social networks.

name: Apaja
overview:
Apaja builds online gaming community services.

Apaja’s main product is Playray, an online gaming community service combining avatars, community features such as forums, blogging and chatting, and - most of all - browser based single/multiplayer casual games.

Apaja states that Playray aims to be leading experience of its kind in Europe, with special focus in growing user base all across Eastern Europe.

The company was founded in 2001 by Asmo Halinen, Pasi Laaksonen and Janne Matilainen and currently it employs 44 people.

name: BrushVideo
overview:
BrushVideo offers a free service where people can upload their videos and edit them online.

Our online video editor, which is running inside the browser, allows people to mix videos, change the audio, add webcam videos, effects and animations.

The changes they make to their videos can be previewed live. After generating the movie, users can upload it automatically to YouTube or use it on their pages.

overview: Sceneclips is an online platform that connects filmmakers with film investors. Sceneclips film investors network makes it easier for filmmakers to find financing and distribution by connecting them with studios, production companies, and high-net-worth individuals.

name: DigitalDeejay
overview: DigialDeejay is the parent company of MIX.dj, the world’s largest web and mobile based DJ community. The MIX.dj web and mobile music community consists of content producers, content consumers and advertisers. MIX.dj has 1.5 million mobile users (iOS and Droid) and over 120,000 registered users on the web. The content is primarily user-generated DJ party mixes and podcasts from DJs around the world. MIX.dj boasts the world’s largest library of DJ party mixes which consists of over 55,000 DJ mixes from 120,000 DJs in 150 countries. New mixes are added 24/7/365. MIX.dj offers a free streaming radio service (with banner and audio ads) and a premium monthly subscription service (ad-free, on-demand access). MIX.dj also develops customized mobile applications for artists (Louie Vega - Todd Terry - Laurent Wolf…), record labels and brands ( Om Records - Definitive Records..). MIX.dj has over 100 different mobile Apps in the Apple Appstore and Droid Market. The MIX.dj advertising platform continues to expand. The MIX.dj global network also includes a powerful web and mobile in-app “House Ad” platform that offers an unique advertising network consisting of over 1.5 million mobile users and 120,000 web users around the world.

overview:
This team is creating a frequent flyer miles system for brands, starting with the entertainment industry.

MyBandStock is a platform that tracks, groups, and rewards fans for online purchasing and promoting behaviors. The company enables entertainment companies to turn passive fans into loyal purchasers by incentivizing users at time-sensitive opportunities of engagement. See an early product iteration at www.mybandstock.com/picturemebroken

name: Large Animal Games
overview:
Large Animal was founded in January of 2001 by partners Josh Welber and Wade Tinney, both graduates of the MFA program in interactive design at Parsons School of Design in New York City. Since then, Josh and Wade have been lucky enough to build a team of incredibly talented and hard-working artists, programmers, game designers, musicians and producers. This team has made games of all types; puzzle games, celebrity name games, role-playing games, action games and word games.

Their original, downloadable games for the PC can be found at most major internet portals and demo versions are free to download at largeanimal.com.

name: Booyah
overview:
Booyah, headquartered in San Francisco, is the market leader in real-world & location–based gaming. The company is founded on the premise that “where you play matters” and creates compelling, innovative mass-market games and entertainment products that have been enjoyed by tens of millions of worldwide. By integrating real-world signals into its portfolio of products, Booyah is more than a games company…literally changing how people play and delivering more personal, more social & more meaningful ways for gamers of all ages to play & interact with their friends & the world around them.

Booyah has partnered with leading consumer brands including H&M, Pantene, Olay, Paul Frank, Disney, Subway, Adidas, MTV and others to connect engaged gamers with the products they love. To learn more about advertising & sponsorship opportunities, click here.

The company draws its creativity and inspiration from the mobile, consumer web, social and traditional gaming space with a leadership team drawn from the world’s top interactive companies including Electronic Arts, Blizzard Entertainment, Glu Mobile, Crowdstar, LucasArts, Kabam and Insomniac Games. Booyah is financed by Accel Partners and Kleiner Perkins Caufield and Byers’ iFund.

name: TVT Records
overview:
TVT Records was one of the largest and most successful independent record companies in US history. The company was distinguished by its eclectic roster and enjoyed success in almost every genre of music from pop, jazz, rock, broadway, rap, reggae, and techno music. Beginning in 1985 with its release of an album paying homage to the American TV Theme, Television’s Greatest Hits, the company went on to release acclaimed albums by such artists as Nine Inch Nails, Sevendust, Snoop Dogg and Tha Eastsidaz, Default, Lil Jon and The Eastside Boyz, XTC , Guided by voices, Brian Jonestown Massacre, Just Jack, Underworld, Bounty Killer, Pitbull, Ying Yang Twins, Gil Scott Heron Jurasic Five, Ja Rule, KMFDM and Jimmy Page and the Black Crowes among others. Over the course of its 25 year history the fiercely independent label put out over 20 Gold, Platinum and multi platinum releases, more than any other label with no affiliation with one of the majors.

TVT was a pioneer in digital music exploitation. In 2000 it became the first label to put its entire catalog on line available for download. it was the first label to settle copyright licensing with Napster and label President Steve Gottlieb joined Napster’s advisory board actively lobbying other labels to license the company and help it transition to legitimacy.

The label was sold in 2008 to The Orchard.

Its founder and CEO Steve Gottlieb now runs Shindig a web start up.

name: Klection
overview:
What’s in your collection? Klection lets you organize and review your movies, TV shows, and video games.

Klection provides a clean and user-friendly interface for keeping track of what you watch and play. Using open data provided by Freebase, Klection contains a wealth of information about your favorite movies, TV shows, and video games. Add them easily to your collection and specify whether or not you own them, and in what format. Post comments about them and their respective artists and creators. Then subscribe to an RSS feed that conveniently aggregates everyone’s comments. Klection makes it easy for anyone to track and update his or her personal collection.

name: PokerDIY
overview:
PokerDIY connects poker players with free and easy poker league management.

Poker League hosts can manage their live or online poker league on PokerDIY. Games can be scheduled and results recorded on the league leaderboard. The poker league software integrates with all the top desktop league software (like The Tournament Director) so that results can be published to PokerDIY. Poker Widgets are available to put your league results on your blog, website or Facebook profile.

Members can find other live or online poker games, start or join poker groups in their area or look for local poker leagues to play in.
