name: deltatre
overview:
deltatre is a leading Sports Media Service company with over 25 years experience at the highest level of the international sport industry. At deltatre we provide Production, Operational, Technology and Consulting Services for Video, Web, Results, Graphics and Sport Business processes.

deltatre has a portfolio of products and services that can be integrated to provide a solution that allow clients to monetize every aspects of their sporting events. deltatre is able to provide robust and cost effective solutions for the gathering and managing of data, images and video generated by a sporting event, creating compelling consumer propositions.

All of our products and services are organised into the following product lines:

Digital Media p.l.: deltatreâ€™s digital media solutions drive among the most prominent, high profile websites in the sports world. Powered by our content management system, the d3CMS, our web technologies enable sports content owners to bring the live sports experience to fans around the world, promoting enhanced enjoyment, participation and monetisation.

Video p.l.: deltatreâ€™s video platform uses advanced, web based tools, to manage sport media assets. The platform manages everything from ingestion to logging, editing, searching and streaming as well as production tools for broadcast, broadband and mobile. Our video platform uses an open architecture that allows us to easily integrate our platform with third party products. The workflow allows sports right holders to fully exploit the commercial potential of the content they own.

Result system p.l.: deltatre provides Results Services for some of the worldâ€™s most prestigious multi-sport, multi-venue sporting events. Our Results Services include on-screen graphics, results systems, commentator information systems, live tracking systems and data gathering services for live events.

Graphics p.l.: deltatreâ€™s TV graphics suite of products enables the delivery of complex event data as sophisticated and captivating graphics. Graphics are rendered in real time and delivered in either SD, HD or 3D. We have built and support our own graphics platform and also integrate into third parties platforms. We also build sport specific interfaces to drive our graphics platform enabling the fastest possible delivery of graphics.

Furthermore, deltatre develops and manages key web-based B2B Applications, providing event organisers with powerful applications to manage the logistical complexities and challenges of major events. Our applications are designed to provide for multi-event, multi-user, multi-lingual environments with integrated data reusability and scalability.

name: SureSpeak
overview:
SureSpeak is a web based coaching platform aimed at solving the current inefficiencies and costs associated with corporate training.

The Problem

Companies spend billions of dollars each year on training and coaching-in 2006 over $129 billion. However, this training is often ineffective or very expensive or both.

Ineffective-Studies show that after 4 weeks, 85% of what was learned in a classroom setting is forgotten. Additionally, teaching interpersonal and communication skills in a classroom environment is rarely effective. Lastly, scheduling conflicts often cause inefficiency and delay in connecting a person in need of coaching and a coach.

Expensive - Companies spend money on travel, lodging, meals and other related costs in order to get people to training sessions. Companies also deploy e-learning solutions which offer little or no interaction or practice and suffer from miserable completion rates.

Additionally, current market conditions have caused the majority of enterprises to cut training and travel budgets significantly and look for cost effective means to deliver training enterprise-wide.

The Solution

SureSpeak is a Software as a Service (SaaS) provider of web-based video coaching platform and tools. Executive coaches & enterprises use SureSpeak to improve sales, presentation and communication skills leading to enhanced revenues, higher customer retention and improved operating efficiencies. SureSpeak users watch modeling videos that demonstrate desired performance â€“ for example â€œHow to close the saleâ€. Then with just an internet connection and a webcam, the user records their version and self-reviews. Typically the user will re-record multiple times until satisfied (current record to save ratio is 6:1). Practicing or role-playing in a private setting has proven to be very desirable for SureSpeak users as opposed to group role-playing which is embarrassing and counter-productive. When the user is satisfied with his â€œSureSpeakâ€ he saves, and his coach receives an automatic email alert notifying him that a SureSpeak is waiting for review. The coach then logs in from wherever he may be and whenever he has time. This is a key to the efficiency of SureSpeak. The coach provides feedback in written form, in score format â€“ based on customizable categories such as â€œbody languageâ€, â€œtoneâ€, â€œenthusiasmâ€, â€œmessage contentâ€, â€œsincerityâ€, etc. The coach also can record a video back to the user. When the coach saves his feedback the system notifies the user that his score SureSpeak has been reviewed, and likewise the user logs in when convenient to review. Additionally, each user can receive feedback from unlimited coaches, peers, managers, etc.

SureSpeakâ€™s patented platform is unique in that it is asynchronous â€“ meaning the practice and coaching is split up into 3 distinct parts â€“ practice, coaching/feedback, and review of feedback. These can be done independent of each other without delay and at any time. Most training fails in that no video record is provided and if it is not efficient or readily accessible online and cannot be shared. Synchronous training solutions such as video-conference fail as they still require both parties to be available at the same time.

name: Sonichall
overview:
Sonichall is a music website that provides free music downloads to its listeners through Creative Commons licensing, and ad revenue sharing with the artists who contribute their music.

Sonichall.com is song driven which means they showcase the most popular music and was built to support the independent music industry. Artists and listeners can sign up for free accounts and contribute to the website by submitting and reviewing songs, voting their favorites and becoming a fan. Sonichall provides feeds of the top content which is constantly changing and where you can find out the latest releases as they are submitted.

Sonichall encourages the listeners of the music to support the artists by visiting the sponsors. 50% of the ad revenue generated is shared with the artists.

[{"id":816,"description":"World Of Warcraft Hits 11 Million Subscribers Mark, Shows Signs Of Slowing","stoned_year":2008,"stoned_month":10,"stoned_day":28,"source_url":"http://www.techcrunch.com/2008/10/29/world-of-warcraft-hits-11-million-subscribers-mark-shows-signs-of-slowing/","source_text":"Gaming powerhouse Blizzard Entertainment has issued a press release announcing that the number of subscribers for World Of Warcraft has surpassed the 11 million mark.

For the record: subscribers include individuals who have paid a subscription fee or have an active prepaid card to play World of Warcraft, as well as those who have purchased the game and are within their free month of access.

The milestone for the popular MMORPG (massively multiplayer online role-playing game) represents a 10% growth in 10 months and shows signs of slowing. If you consider the fact that the online game debuted in November 2004 and took only six months to go from 9 million to 10 million subscribers, you can conclude that it took Blizzard much longer to add this last million subscribers to its user base than in the past (the company announced it reached the 10 million mark in January 2008, up from 9 million in July, 2007).

On the other hand, WoW was estimated to hold an impressive 62% of the massively multiplayer online game market back in April.

On 13 November, the second expansion of WoW, dubbed â€œWrath of the Lich Kingâ€, will launch in several regions around the world. name: WebCeleb
overview:
Webceleb is music marketplace and community where musicians and fans engage and profit from discovering, purchasing and downloading the latest independent music. Fans discover, buy and download the newest music while investing in an artist’s future. Webceleb gives indie artists a place to market and profit from their latest music while interacting, building vested marketing teams, with fans.

With Webceleb, every song purchase equals an investment into that artist’s future earnings. With each $1 song purchase, 50% goes to the musician and 40% goes back to the pot of fans who purchased music by that artist. This is a win/win for musicians and fans, deterring piracy.

name: Vividas
overview:
Vividas is a developer and provider of video technologies which enable full screen, high quality live or pre-recorded video to be delivered via the internet or over corporate networks from standard web servers. There is generally no requirement for a first time user to install player software.

Vividas proprietary technology overcomes the disadvantages of competing solutions that typically offer only partial screen or poor quality full screen viewing and generally require the user either to have or to install specialist player software.

For corporations, Vividas delivers a high quality live stream to desktops across the Wide Area Network using existing web server infrastructure without any adverse effect on network performance.

overview:
Nullsoft is an online music media company, providing software for mp3 playback and media streaming. It created Winamp currently used by AOL as a community supported media play and was a pioneer in the digital media space. Nullsoft also created SHOUTcast, Gnutella, and NSIS.

Nullsoft was purchased by AOL in 1999.

In January 2014, Radionomy acquired Winamp and Shoutcast from AOL.

name: Indomite Music
overview:
Indomite Music and Indomite.com are a combination of a fully functional desktop recording studio software and an online Web 2.0 community application.

Indomite.com intends of breaking the limitation facing artists in their quest to create and distribute their music. Indomite.com will allow every artist to connect with other artists all over the world with similar musical preferences regardless of geographical relation.

Indomite.com supplies the artist with an easy interface to interact with the other artists, an interface that is easy and simple to use and is packed with tools and features in order to facilitate the processes of collaboration, recording and finding partners as much as possible. Indomite Music and Indomite.com are a combination of a fully functional desktop recording studio software and an online Web 2.0 community application.

Our Client software features include multi-track recording, specific track volume and balance modifications, metronome, video conference jam, VST support, MIDI support and many more features that makes it a simple, easy and fun application to use. Indomite’s powerfull Web2.0 community will unleash the power of globalization, sharing and collaburation in favor of our artists. musical taste driven search, loop sharing, online stores and many more features will come handy for our talents to break out and jam with anyone they would like to, whenever they would like to.

overview:
Rocudo is an online/mobile music remixing platform in which Artists and Labels submit music for remixing by Fans, in order to create “direct-to-fan” relationships which may be leveraged via social networks to build online presence and generate incremental sales.

Using Rocudo’s free, easy-to-use online tools, Fans create and share unique music via Rocudo’s Remix “widget”, promoting the Artists and Labels on all the social networks as a result.

Rocudo has completed development of the core platform technology, including an iPhone App prototype and is now building its user base.

name: Citizenside
overview:
Citizenside is a Paris based news, video and photo agency that sells news-related amateur-produced content and provides participative platforms to media houses around the world. It was founded in partnership Agence France Presse (AFP).

Citizenside is a citizen journalism platform serving 100,000 amateur and professional photographers, freelance journalists, and citizen reporters in more than 150 countries.

The Images contributed to Newzulu are licensed to the worldwide media via the Agence France-Presse’s Image Forum (more than 7000 clients globally).

The aim is to provide members with a community online where they can both share and sell their news-related images.

In July, 2013 Newzulu acquired Citizenside

overview:
Spil Gamesâ€™ mission is to unite the world in play through a localized global network of online social-gaming platforms tailored to girls (GirlsgoGames.com), teens (Agame.com), and families (Gamesgames.com).

These platforms, offered in up to 19 languages, entertain 130 million unique visitors from around the world each month. In its current portfolio, Spil Games has a collection of more than 4,000 online games, which have been developed both in house and through partnerships with top-tier game developers. overview: Compete-At provides a secure online registration, event planning and membership management platform for the sports and non-profit markets. The flagship product, Event Manager, is tailored to meet the unique planning needs of individual event types. Unlike “league based” or one-size-fits-all solutions, Event Manager is specifically designed and tailored for competitive sports and event types at local, regional and international levels. Compete-At is a technology provider and strategic partner to multiple Olympic national governing bodies and associations globally. Compete-At is based in Bethesda Maryland with sales and supports offices in Colorado Springs, Colorado. Visit www.Compete-At.com for more information

name: Global Media Exchange
overview:
Global Media Exchange (GMX) is an online community for content owners and buyers to connect, buy and sell professionally produced content online. The site will serve as a platform to identify, license and transfer entertainment content across traditional and new media platforms and will include a comprehensive rights management solution. GMX will serve as an international platform for sellers and buyers including film studios, independent film companies and producers, video production houses, sales agents, distributors and ad agencies.

GMX is a subsidiary of Ascent Media.

The site will be launched in phases beginning in 2009.

name: HourVille
overview:
HourVille is a marketplace where people buy and sell virtually anything that can be priced by the hour — services, rentals, places, classes.

The company provides interactive online tools for both buyers and sellers.

Local Search — tag-based local search within a zip code radius for buyers to find local providers of services, rentals, places, and classes in target categories such as lessons, tutoring, babysitting, photography, party entertainment and equipment, massage therapy, dance halls and other venues, and art, computer, and other classes.

Multimedia Profiles — Sellers post descriptions, pictures, video, documents, references and testimonials.

Online Schedule Management — Sellers create a schedule for their services and post their availability to their profiles via an interactive calendar. Sellers can sync their schedules with other calendar applications via an iCalendar export. Buyers book and buy time directly through the sellers’ interactive calendars at HourVille.com.

Ratings and Reviews — Buyers leave feedback for sellers after services have been delivered. Sellers build a community reputation and buyers make informed purchasing decisions based on seller reputation.

Marketing and Promotional Tools — Third-party web site support and integration is available through tools such as a widgets (including Facebook), and links and buttons that sellers embed in Craigslist and other online classifieds postings and personal and company web sites. The links, buttons, and widgets pull buyers back to sellers’ HourVille profiles and interactive calendars.

Pricing, Payment and Auctions — Sellers set prices for hourly service time slots via fixed price or auctions. Buyers buy and pay for services through PayPal and Google Checkout integration.

name: TeacherTube
overview: TeacherTube was the idea of Jason Smith, a 14-year veteran educator. Jason has been a teacher, coach, campus administrator and district administrator in public schools. He asked the question, “Why can’t teachers, students, and schools utilize the power of the read/write web for learning?” To overcome barriers, he decided to just create a site and get started trying to help. He turned to his brother, Adam, who is a younger, digital native, with technical skills. Adam used his skills to develop the site and found a web host. Soon, Jason’s wife, Jodie, joined the team to start populating the site with videos and help improve the communication. She too has 14 years of experience in education as a classroom teacher, campus technology integrator, and district curriculum coordinator.

name: Verismo Networks
overview:
Verismo Networks is privately held Internet TV platform company headquartered in Mountain View, CA and with a research and design center located in Bangalore, India.

The founders of Verismo Networks envisioned the use of the internet to cost effectively deliver high quality video to users and this increase in viewing videos on the PC would lead to increased demand for viewing internet videos on big screen TVs. Verismo developed a customizable end to end solution for delivering internet videos directly to the TV without the need for a PC. OEM customers are able to take a proven system, add their own content if needed, and participate in a fast growing market.

name: Summit Entertainment
overview:
Summit Entertainment, LLC operates as a theatrical motion picture development, financing, production, and distribution studio in the United States. The company handles various aspects of marketing and distribution for its internally developed motion pictures, as well as for acquired pictures in the United States and internationally. It also offers a mobile game for wireless customers.

The company was founded in 1993 and is based in Santa Monica, California.

name: World On-Demand
overview: World On-Demand is a 24-hours pay-TV service, introduced by The New Media Group in Japan, Australia and Taiwan. It is transmitted through broadband networks via an IPTV service and uses its own end to end software platform.[1] It is a service that will allow multimedia content - including broadcast channels and on-demand programming - to be viewed on any television set, PC and Mac. The IPTV service utilizes IP set-top boxes (STBs), connected over any broadband telephone line.

name: TubeSpree
overview:
TubeSpree allows users to shop while watching online videos by layering products from various affiliate programs.

Whenever there is a click or sale generated, the SpreeVideo creator, which is the person who layered the products over the online video, earns a commission. Similarly, whoever distributed the SpreeVideo, either by displaying it on their site, or by forwarding it to friends, also participates in the commission.

TubeSpree offers a solution extremely easy to use, both from the user and the creatorâ€™s perspective.

The SpreeVideo creation process is also simplified, occurring in 2 steps: First uploading the video, then layering products. As soon as the user is done layering and publishes the SpreeVideo, she is prompted to choose where to distribute, whether to friends on social networks like Facebook and MySpace, or straight to their Blogger account.

name: PlayerAuctions
overview:
PlayerAuctions is a digital asset exchange for the buying and selling of game currency, accounts, items, powerleveling and guides from more than 40 Massively Multiplayer Online Games (MMOGs), including World of Warcraft, Habbo Hotel, EverQuest II, Warhammer Online and EVE Online.

PlayerAuctions provides a safe, secure and trusted environment for gamers to buy and sell games assets with no risk of fraud or identity theft. At the heart of the PlayerAuctions platform is PlayerGuardian, a powerful proprietary technology that provides protection for all players, payments and trades. Buyers are guaranteed delivery of their purchase or their money back. Sellers have complete protection against payment fraud and chargebacks. PlayerAuctions is also the first marketplace to offer secure player-to-player game account trade.

The company is based in Los Angeles, CA and is fully invested in by Itemmania, the leading player-to-player marketplace in Korea.

name: ZOOZ Mobile
overview:
ZOOZ Mobile brings novel, interactive, and social music-making experiences to everyone. The company combines breakthrough scientific research with innovative design to create leading, critically-acclaimed apps in the fast-growing mobile music market.

ZOOZ Mobile offers everyone a fun way to express themselves musically right from their phone. ZOOZbeat is the first Mobile Music Studio, an integrated mobile and web-based studio for music creation, interaction and sharing for individuals and groups, musicians and non-musicians. ZOOZbeat has been available on the iTunes AppStore since November, 2008 and has had over 1,000,000 downloads, and 500,000 users. The company has already demonstrated its ability to develop cool, highly acclaimed and very popular music applications and content, and has a strong vision to build a highly scalable, branded platform for music creation and content distribution.

Company Background: Founded by professor Gil Weinberg of Georgia Tech, ZOOZ Mobile has exclusive worldwide licenses to 2 utility and 6 pending Georgia Tech patents, with more on the drawing board. The patents cover music intelligence, gesture recognition, latency reduction, and software-hardware integration, thus, allowing smartphones to responsively and accurately generate and control music. Charles Spencer joined the company as a consultant in January 2010, and then CEO in March 2012. Charles received his MBA degree from Georgia Tech, is well connected to the Atlanta music industry, and has previously worked as a professional musician touring with top tier recording artists. Scott Geller, the current board chairman, has built three successful technology companies since 1991, including 2order.com which he sold to public company, Primus Knowledge Solutions, in 2000.

name: FamilyCam Limited
overview:
FamilyCam gives customers their own personal Internet video channel within which they and those they trust can browse, search and watch all their home movies, any time and from anywhere in the world.

FamilyCam provides an video uploader spplication called Movie Maker, which converts any digital video file into H264 video (MP4) and then uploads the movie onto FamilyCam’s streaming severs.

FamilyCam also provide a conversion service that takes Cine film and Video Tapes and converts home videos into digital files, for upload onto streaming severs.

The customers video material is held securely, and only chared with people that they choose to allow to view their home movies.

Movies watched using the FamilyCam web site are displayed in high quality, and may be watched full screen on a PC or Internet enabled TV.

FamilyCam has licensed Doovle technology, enabling particular scenes within a movie to be tagged using a simple text string, so that scenes can later be searched for and instantly replayed, really bringing the content to life.

name: MovieFlix
overview: MovieFlix.com is the leading broadband movie provider and personal movie downloading service on the web. Founded in 1998, MovieFlix.com is a privately held company based in Hollywood, CA. MovieFlix maintains a library of over 4,000 full-length movies, short films, independent films and television shows in over thirty popular categories – many of which are offered to members for unlimited free viewing. MovieFlix’s viewing and downloading services are available on the internet at (http://www.movieflix.com/). MovieFlix also offers a MovieFlix Plus subscription package, which is available for a monthly fee and includes premium movies and unlimited downloads in addition to MovieFlix’s existing free movies. MovieFlix Plus members enjoy special benefits and services available exclusively to subscribers, including unlimited movie downloads from MovieFlix’s entire library of 4,000 films, access to premium content, personalized movie recommendations, online movie premieres, celebrity and filmmaker interviews, the option to use either Windows Media Player or Real Player, and 24/7 customer service available by phone or e-mail. MovieFlix has successfully partnered with industry leading companies including AOL, ALWAYSi, Covad, iFilm, Microsoft, NBCi, RealNetworks, RoadRunner, Rogers Communications, Screaming Media, TV Guide, Yack.com and Yahoo among others.

name: Xendex Holding
overview:
XENDEX Holding GmbH develops mobile, casino, and online games for the videogames-, telecom-, media-, casino-, and gaming-industry. It also provides professional services for game portal operators, including market and trend observations, seasonal event scouting, contract management, x-play standardized game delivery platform, promotional activities, and financial reporting. The company offers its products and services through a network of distribution, sales, marketing, and publishing partners. XENDEX Holding GmbH serves mobile- and online-casino operators, sports betting companies, and video games publishers.

The company was founded in 2001 and is based in Vienna, Austria with offices in Poland; and sales offices in Europe and North America.

name: InnovSoft Consulting Limited
overview:
InstantWebVideos.Com is a new web-based service that allows web users to create broadcast quality video presentations in minutes.

Videos are assembled through a web interface that allows users to choose from a collection of motion backgrounds, stock footage collections, stock photography, surfaces and gradients, themed backgrounds, musical selections, text effects and sound effects.

Users can upload their own media, (video, still and audio) and store them online in their account. This media can be edited and incorporated into a new video mixing the stock footage and the users footage.

The simple interface allows users to view and preview the graphics and place them on a timeline.

The program has all the standard transitions and effects found in such non-linear editing systems such as Adobe Premiere, Premiere Cut Pro and Sony Vegas)

Videos are rendered in near-real time and delivered to the client storage area. Additionally, the videos may be downloaded and submitted to file sharing services such as YouTube.

UNLIMITED CAPACITY ARCHITECTURE

InstantWebVideos.Com is based upon the Amazon.Com Elastic Cloud Model allowing for unlimited disk storage and virtually unlimited compute power for rendering.

Using the Elastic Cloud System, Instant Web Videos can dynamically scale the web video creation and rendering as demands increase and decrease.

Like the Animoto.Com Web Site, (a similar type of service), the system can scale from 1 Server to thousands of servers in under 10 minutes.

The System Architecture is completely distributed and separated. The front end application the user experiences is completely isolated from the rendering back-end.

As a highly complex AJAX enabled application, the user spends virtually all of the time working disconnected from a server. Only when previews are required does the system go to a media server for the video, image or audio media.

Once a user is ready to request their video, a message containing details of their job is sent to the Amazon Message Queue System.

Each of the back end rendering systems polls the Request Queue when they are idle and looking for a job to render. All assets required to generate a video are on the a many Terrabyte SAN which is distributed across the globe in Japan, the United States and Europe. In essence, each rendering machine is a clone of one another and has the same assets available in their logical disk drives.

Once a job is completed, the video is stored on the Amazon S3 Network and an email is sent to the user who may play it directly or download it to their local pc.

The output format can be specified by the user (AVI, MOV, WMV, or FLV) and can be automatically submitted to various file sharing sites using web services in a similar fashion to the Tube Mogul web site.

name: Wizzgo
overview: Wizzgo was the first “on line internet recorder” launched in France in may 2008. Backed by french innovation investors, wizzgo’s team of ingineers have developed a proprietary technology of network PVR. Wizzgo technology was capable of delivering million copies of broadcasted program directly to the end-users internet-connected devices including smartphone, tvbox, computers. After five month of exploitation Wizzgo reached near half million users on the French territory. Despite its great success and its awards for its disruptive breakthrough service, Wizzgo had to stop because of lawsuits introduced by majors French broadcasters TF1 and M6.

name: Kompoz
overview: Kompoz is an online social network designed for music lovers to create songs with others from around the world. Kompoz is a community site with strong social networking features pinned around distributed music creation. Meaning this: songs are created in layers – drums, bass, guitar, keyboards, vocals, etc. But very few people play all of these instruments, so it’s hard to create a complete song unless you’re part of a band. Kompoz solves that problem. We provide the platform to create songs with a bass player in Sweden, a drummer in Ohio, and a guitar player in Kalamazoo. Kompoz members span over 80 countries and all 24 time-zones. The world is your virtual on-demand band.

overview:

It manages the stats, scores and spreadsheets for you. As a pool manager, all you need to do is to set up the parameters of your favorite sports pool, get your poolies to register on the site, and then have them enter your pool. You will then be able to sit back and enjoy your favorite sports while competing with your friends.

The site manages pools with many different formats to allow you to present a wide variety to your poolies. They currently support NFL football and NCAA March Madness playoff basketball.

name: Masstech Group
overview:
Masstech Group Inc. develops enterprise-level file-based video workflow solutions for television production, broadcast, and channel origination operations. Its solutions provide a framework for media lifecycle content management, business continuity and disaster recovery applications, and broadcast monitoring solutions for compliance recording. The company offers MassStore WAM Suite, a workflow based asset management platform, which allows for configurable automated processes, including file-based ingest, tape digitization, instream transcoding, production and news integration, business continuity, content delivery/distribution, and portal connectivity; MassChannel, a broadcast playout/automation appliance to deploy new channels, manage multicast programming, or provide business continuity for DR applications; and MassLogger, an appliance for professional broadcast monitoring. Its MassStore WAM Suite comprises M-Ingest that ingests content into the MassStore WAM suite content repository and moves it to shared folders, video servers, catch servers, NLE systems, and live ingest or playout devices; SAvI, which provides direct access from within the Avid environment to the MassStore WAM Suite of products; M-Connect that allows to transfer the content in and out of final cut studio from any format without going to tape; MassBrowse, an offline media preparation tool, which works with low resolution proxies or full bandwidth video files; and N-Connect that allows users to search and preview archived content within the MassStore WAM Suite and bring the content to the desired location directly from the news interface. Masstech Group also provides content repository, data movement, content transformation, and archive management services.

The company was founded in 2001 and is based in Richmond Hill, Canada. Masstech Group Inc. operates as a subsidiary of 1293551 Ontario Inc.

name: Valu Valu
overview:
Valu Valu provides quantitative ratings for stock market investors.

Valu Valu was founded in 2008, in Seattle, WA and originally focused on dynamic pricing for consumer products. It shifted its core business in 2010, after having extensively back-tested the performance of its system on the stock market and for the years 2005-2010.

Valu Valuâ€™s originality resides in mixing traditional stock data (such as P/E ratio, earnings growth, momentum or volatility) with data-mined Web 2.0 information (e.g. stock popularity, company mentions). The main goal is to identify contrarian stocks on the verge of becoming popular.

Valu Valu proprietary algorithm automatically weights each factor, then synthesizes the attractiveness of a stock on a scale from 0 to 100, called the V2 rating. A simple strategy that build a portfolio of top-rated stocks and re-balances this portfolio on a periodical basis almost systematically outperform the market.

V2 Ratings, when delayed by 2 weeks, are freely and publicly available on ValuValu.com
tag_list: stock-market, quantitative, trading, investment, strategy, data-mining, artificial-intelligence

name: Gemzies
overview:
Gemzies -from “gems”- wants to help people getting started on the Internet, on serious topics. To do so, Gemzies aims to â€œstartâ€ at the point a Wikipedia-page â€œendsâ€.

Gemzies-pages are focused on a single topic. On that topic, they provide a structured and community-rated list of suggested sites, videos, images, news and books.

Gemzies-pages are created and maintained by fellow experts, who want to show their expertise to the rest of the world. Gemzies provides a â€˜virtual stageâ€™ for these experts, providing for expert ranking lists, expert search, and expert â€˜trackingâ€™.

Gemzies thus adds Digg-type rating, and Delicious-type tagging, to serious content focused on any single topic.

The problem There is no shortage of content on the internet. For every subject you can check thousands of websites, all giving you more or less the same info.

At this moment there is no website easily allowing experts to collectively gather, review and tag all kinds of serious â€˜web favoritesâ€™ (sites, videos, images, books, news), on any possible subject, in a single, structured page.

The solution: Gemzies-pages Gemzies-pages are focused on a single topic. They contain a structured overview of suggested relevant websites, videos, photos, books and news on that topic, all in just one view.

Gemzies-pages are filled and maintained by fellow experts, die-hard fans, or anyone with a serious opinion, on anything from Al Gore to ZZ Top. Anyone can apply to start a new Gemzies page, providing a clear affinity with the subject, and providing the topic isnâ€™t commercial or explicit.

Gemzies-pages need the passion, a bit of commitment, and the expertise of individuals who want to show their knowledge on Internet content to the rest of the world. By its very nature, Gemzies-pages will thus contain topics that people have a passion for, like sports, music artists, professions, science, hobbies, global issues, etc.

Unlike other initiatives, Gemzies does not pay a vast editorial staff to build the ultimate human powered link directory. Instead, Gemzies offers â€˜15 minutes of fameâ€™, highlighting both the authors, and the most valuable contributors, to a Gemzies page.

A virtual stage for experts Our contributors add and review entries, simply for the sake of helping others getting started.

Experts who contribute to Gemzies-pages, are ranked on a â€˜virtual stageâ€™. Their contributions can be tracked, thus reflecting their expertise to the rest of the world. What comes from that is up to the experts themselves…

Visitors can easily search for experts, and their individual contributions. Experts can be â€˜bookmarkedâ€™, informing visitors when new entries have been made by the expert, all depending on the privacy settings chosen by the experts.

Creating Gemzies pages Page creation is a simple process; it takes an average user 30 minutes to publish a first version of a Gemzies-page, containing at least 10 relevant entries (videos, sites, images and books on a single topic). Gemzies takes care of page structure, look & feel, video display, etc.

The creator of a Gemzies page is recognized as â€˜authorâ€™ of the page. After publication, the Gemzies-page is â€˜openâ€™ to the rest of the world, to add new entries and review existing entries. Fellow experts who contribute to the page, are automatically added in the experts ranking list.

Gemzies provides tools to suggest relevant content for new entries, using APIs from Google (to suggest relevant websites and books), and Youtube (for videos).

Finally, a Gemzies page automatically displays the latest news on the specific topic (currently based on Google News).

Content tagging and rating Similar to e.g. Delicious, contributors can add tags to new entries for a Gemzies-page, or suggest additional tags to existing entries. These tags support other users to browse the Gemzies-page. The tags are also fed into a search engine (basic, for now), enabling visitors to search for relevant content across the entire Gemzies database.

Similar to e.g. Digg, visitors can â€˜voteâ€™ on the suggested entries from others. Based on these votes, the most popular sites, videos, images and books will appear â€˜on topâ€™ of their category. Unlike Digg (and many of its clones), we allow our visitors to â€˜voteâ€™ for anything but news, since we consider news to have a much shorter-lived life span, when compared to sites, videos, etc.

Page quality Gemzies fully understands it needs to grow towards a tipping point, in order to increase the relevancy of its content.

To quickly judge the “quality” of a Gemzies page, it will be ranked with an overall quality indicator, ranging from 1 to 5 Gemzies. These Gemzies are earned based on a.o. the number of active contributors, and the average rating of entries by visitors and fellow experts.
tag_list: social, community, expert, bookmark, wikipedia, topic, videos, images, news, books, ranking, serious, topics, favorites

name: Tengaged
overview: Tengaged is a Reality Social Network where game and social platforms are completely embedded, providing a unique environment where every action is both social and part of the game. Unlike other online games or social networks, Tengaged is completely based on “reality games.” Reality games are interactive games involving multiple participants that revolve around a story that takes place in real-time, and evolves according to participants’ actions.

name: DanceShowoff
overview:
A video sharing website dedicated to dance lovers and enthusiasts.

Danceshowoff.com is a social networking site for people to enjoy all genres of dance techniques, learn how to dance, watch amazing talented and skilled dancers, and check out many styles of dancing. People can register to join and benefit by networking with other registered users, share/upload videos, rate and comment, as well as save your favorite video clips.

Danceshowoff.com thrives to continue improving the website with useful features and to be able to interact with everyone who signs up to become a member.

name: GoGo Lingo
overview:
GoGoLingo is the fun and easy way for your child to learn a foreign language, featuring games and activities that customize to your child’s personal learning curve. While your child is focused on having fun and progressing through the game, powerful technology works behind the scenes to create an interactive and adaptive curriculum, provide helpful hints, and incorporate review in creative ways to ensure learning.

It was acquired by Rosetta Stone in March 2012.

name: Know Your Venue
overview: KnowYourVenue.com is a start-up that looks to be the premier site for venue information. Currently offering unique information about roughly 40 venues; mostly pro sports stadiums and arenas. KnowYourVenue.com is now adding amphitheaters and NASCAR tracks and performing arts venues to the site. Venue information includes parking, restaurants, hotels, insider tips, prohibited items, average costs of attending an event and tickets. As this grows, KnowYourVenue.com will be the best and most complete guide to venues in the United States.

external_links: [{"external_url":"http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gawkk","title":"Wikipedia Entry for Gawkk"},{"external_url":"http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gary_Culliss","title":"Wikipedia Entry for Gary Culliss"}]
name: Gawkk
overview:
Gawkk.com is a community-based social video sharing website that specializes in allowing people to collect and share videos with their friends. Gawkk differs from other video sites, such as YouTube and Metacafe, because it does not host videos directly but instead lists videos from any hosting site on the web and displays the embedded videos in public channels created by the community. The site gets its videos from user-submission of the video URL or embed code, selected RSS feeds and selected web crawling.

Gawkk organizes videos around channels, and members can subscribe to public channels that group videos in chronological order relative to a particular topic, such as a TV show, movie, celebrity, musical artist, comedian, etc. Members can save videos to their own personal video channel, follow other members’ channels and share their saved videos with friends that follow them back, similar to the web service Twitter. Gawkk also includes other social community features, such as the ability to vote videos up or down, with videos that receive the most votes being promoted to the home page for the entire community to see, much like the news site digg.

The privately-held company was founded by Gary Culliss and Thomas Mango in 2007 and is headquartered in New York, NY.
tag_list: social-video-discovery, social-video, video, video-sharing, video-community, twitter, video-channels, channels, friends, follow, following

artaculous connects the world of art!

artaculous enables professional artists as well as businesses and groups from the art sector to build an effective and digitalised networking of old and new contacts. Wether for commercial use or to make your own stuff public, our task is to always deliever you the right tools.

Through a pragmatic design and the highest measure in functionality our focus lies on the artist and not the platform itself to give you all the space you need.

artaculous is meanwhile an art networking and presentation platform which offers a home for basically all kinds of art. This introduces brand-new possibilities to cover all the different requirements employing only one platform.

name: iKultur
overview:
Instead of seeing people starting up blogs everywhere on the internet, we’ve come up with a new option.

iKultur is just one big blog with a big group of people maintaining it. The visitors get new stuff to read about several times every day, in categories such as fashion, movies, music and books. And it’s easy to share our articles on various social networks like MySpace and Facebook.

One other thing is that our site doesn’t look just like any blog, it’s supposed to have the look and feel of a news site.

name: FilmSuggest
overview:
FilmSuggest helps users find movies they may like based on stated preferences. FilmSuggest uses the Internet Movie Database (IMDb) to procure titles, genres, actors, directors, plots, and MPAA ratings for each movie. Additionally, FilmSuggest uses Amazon’s database for DVD cover artwork and to link to Amazon’s store for purchase of DVD titles. The Google Charts API is also used within the site to display users’ preference trends in the Profile section of the site.

FilmSuggest implements several multi-faceted technologies to function, including cascading style sheets (CSS), asynchronous javascript and XML (AJAX) requests, an open source relational database management system (MySQL), and a server-side cross-platform HTML embedded scripting language (PHP). Crucial frameworks used are the Prototype javascript framework and the Scriptaculous javascript library, which together implement advanced javascript techniques to present and manipulate data. Additionally, Javascript Object Notation (JSON) is used to streamline multi-language information passed between the server and browser.

name: Sky Italia
overview: SKY Italia is an Italian digital satellite television platform owned by News Corporation launched on 31 July 2003. It is similar in many ways to BSkyB’s Sky Digital in the United Kingdom and Ireland, and like that network it is a major sports broadcaster.

name: WidgetCircles
overview: WidgetCircles launched the first of its series of self-publishing web platform - PersonalMediaBook (PMB) is an intuitive desktop widget that enables consumers to manage and share personal multimedia content over the web for free. Users can get the free copy of the PMB to start loading and organizing photos and video clips from files, cameras, or camcorders by way of drag and drop over the desktop onto the interactive PMB with intuitive GUI. Users can personalize and organize the content by adding titles, chapters, text, captions and even voice captions with the photos. PMB also enables personal blog with the multimedia content in enhancement to express stories, experience, memoirs, and keepsakes. The PMB is packed with features included in blog, sticky notes, photo album, and cam video sections to enable self-publishing in personal multimedia over the web.

name: Communiversity
overview:
Communiversity is a place for REAL students to share their college experience so that others can EXPLORE and learn what post-high school is really like.

Every school has its own unique community vibe, and the only true way to understand what each entails is to visit- which is expensive. The team at Communiversity strives to modernize the college search experience by offering a resource of honest feedback, comments, pictures and videos about college life from REAL STUDENTS so that prospective students can better know what to expect in higher education.

Prospective students use and interact with this content to gain a better understanding of what college is life is truly like apart from traditional resources available today. Communiversity has aggregated nearly one million pieces of content throughout the web. College related Flickr images and YouTube videos are all displayed on school profiles and updated in dynamic real-time feeds. Application brochures and college websites give only a partial picture, Communiversity fills the gaps with active content for the full flavor. Communiversity is 100% user centric and focuses on current and prospective college students, alumni and parents.

The company was founded in 2008 by Michael Sprague and co-founder Jonathon Gray. Both founders bring a unique combination of technology and business skills, mixed with backgrounds in community websites, web development and architecture, web analytics and social networking.
tag_list: college, campus, university, college-life, higher-education, prospective-student, student, alumni, pictures, videos, ugc

name: GREE
overview:
GREE provides Japan’s leading mobile social network, and is at the forefront of mobile technology. GREE was ranked as Japan’s fastest-growing tech company by Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Ltd. in 2009 and 2010.

GREE, following its acquisition of OpenFeint in April 2011, is expanding globally and will soon offer a single, worldwide mobile social gaming platform. Combined, GREE reaches over 190 million players and offers over 7,500 game applications for smartphones.

GREE aims to build the leading mobile social gaming ecosystem for users and developers worldwide.

name: RGB Networks
overview: RGB Networks, Inc. provides network video processing solutions. Its video intelligence architecture (VIA) based solutions include broadcast network processor for grooming, statistical multiplexing, transrating, digital program insertion, and digital overlays; dynamic bandwidth manager for personalized architectures, such as video-on-demand and switched digital video; and modular media converter for ASI-to-gigabit Ethernet conversion. The company’s VIA solutions also comprise modular video processor, an IPTV solution to deliver Internet protocol-based video services; simulcast edge processor for digital simulcast edge decoding applications; and universal scalable modulator, a multi-service digital edge QAM modulation and upconversion solution. Its video processing solutions enable multiple system operators and video service providers to implement switched digital networks.

name: MyOtherDrive
overview:
MyOtherDrive offers secure online backup, private file sharing, and entertainment. Their online backup supports 128-bit encryption and scheduled, unattended backup operation. MyOtherDrive sharing services offer public sharing, private sharing, and no sharing. Publicly shared content is indexed and searchable.

They have the lowest price offering in the industry. The support free accounts, which can store up to 2GB. For $4.99 per month, users can have 100GB, file linking, fast transfers, AES 128-bit encryption, and scheduled unattended backup. They also offer larger storage accounts and business / government accounts as well.
tag_list: online-backup, online-storage, file-sharing, private-sharing, file-linking, video-sharing, media-sharing, secure-links, file-hosting, photo-sharing, photo-album

acquisition.source_description: GlassBOX Television Inc. announces Blue Ant Media Inc. to Acquire Controlling Interest
name: GlassBox
overview: GlassBOX Television Inc. is being built to own and operate cross-platform digital broadcast and VOD channels. There is a twist. GlassBOX is run by a couple of veteran Internet guys who are focused on making use of new technologies to engage the audiences and to deliver the channels and content across the globe in innovative ways. GlassBOX studio is near Toronto, Canada, where they produce their own content with emerging artistsâ€¦ the up and coming stars (both on and off the screen) of comedy, music and short form entertainment. The first channel, BITE Television, is three years old and has played a key role in defining a new generation of multi-platform and interactive television services. The Emmy award-winning format for BITE TV is one they are building upon, investing in and looking to duplicate in their forthcoming multi-platform channels. GlassBOX is committed to supporting new talent, developing great content and making the best use of new technologies to help drive audiences for their creator, carrier and advertiser partners.

overview:
Mobitween, a Zed Group company, is a developer and publisher of Flash based games for mobile and online worlds. The company works with mobile operators, handset manufacturers, leading publishers, media companies and third party developers.

Mobigamz, the world’s first Flash Lite based mobile gaming portal, is a client-server vending machine that replicates the web browsing model enabling players to download, play, rate and post hi-scores through a rich-media and customizable Flash Lite client.

name: Technicolor
overview:
Technicolor Home Entertainment Services, is the worldâ€™s largest manufacturer and distributor of DVD and CD. The business provides DVD and CD replication services to Hollywood studios, independent rights holders, software developers, original equipment manufacturers (OEMs), and game publishers.

Technicolor Content Services is the worldâ€™s second largest provider of pre-production, production, post-production and distribution services to the broadcast, cable, film, advertising and ancillary home video and DVD markets. TCS provides a wide array of end-to-end Content Services and Media Services, including: On-location services, Sound services, Visual effects, Post-production, Digital preview screenings, Digital intermediates, Digital Cinema and home entertainment mastering, Game design & visuals, Animation Preservation and restoration, duplication & distribution, worldwide language versioning.

Technicolor Digital Content Distribution offers custom and bundled content services including content acquisition, management, versioning/preparation, and distribution in a secure digital environment. This division delivers broadcast services for 225 TV channels (studio and news production services, scheduling, playout, disaster recovery), media services for many major content providers (mastering, international versioning, DVD and Blu-ray disc authoring, restoration services, duplication, digital content ingestion and distribution for TV stations, hotels, airlines, and other markets) and broadband digital distribution.

Technicolor Media Networks Technicolor Media Networks comprises three leading businesses in the fast-growing retail and advertising sectors: Premier Retail Networks (PRN), Technicolor Enterprise Services, and Screenvision (a cinema network joint venture between ITV plc and Thomson). Technicolor Media Networks operates more than one million displays in more than 40,000 locations â€“ from retail stores to cinemas â€“ worldwide.

name: Box Office Mojo
overview:
Box Office Mojo is a web-site with provides tracking of movies and stats around how well they are doing.

IMDB (a subsidiary of Amazon) acquired Box Office Mojo in July of 2008.

name: Remixin
overview:
Remixin is a creative community for musicians, composers, & DJs to share their music and remixes.

The community is a place to find music to remix as well as post music for others to remix. It is also a place for music lovers to discover new music and new versions of songs they may already know. Anyone can come to Remixin and explore the wide variety of music styles and remix types available.

Community Members may share ideas and keep up with friends’ music. They may also network and promote their music by connecting with other like minded members to spread their music through iterative remixing.
tag_list: remix, remixes, music, music-production, dj, mix

name: Koblo
overview:
Koblo is a global music system. Based on open-source workflows, Koblo helps you record, remix, and promote music across the web, for free.

Koblo is a recognized innovator in the audio technology industry. Originally founded in 1998, Koblo developed the Studio9000 bundle of audio plugins, originally distributed with Digidesign’s Pro Tools software. The Studio9000 garnered quite a following with professional and independent musicians, and its sounds can be heard on many songs to this day.

Koblo returned in 2008 with new software, a social network, and a new vision; to provide you with the best music editing and recording software we can create, and a place to promote the music you make with that software, meet people who make music, and to showcase your talents. This begins with Koblo.com, where you can make a profile for your band, upload music and meet other bands, and participate in the building of a community based on music, not masquerading as caring about music.
Our DAW (Digital Audio Workstation) software, the Koblo Studio, is entirely open-source and available for Mac and PC, and soon Linux. It is freely editable and can be changed to meet the needs of those who use it. Our audio plugins and effects are cross-platform and work with all major host programs, giving you firepower to create great tracks.
tag_list: synthesizer, synth, daw, plugin, software, music, audio, open-source, cool, free, remix, collaboration, social-network, fun, pro-tools, ableton, mac, pc, au, rtas, vst

name: DBL LLC
overview:
DBL LLC is a privately held gaming community company. The company has emphasized an atmosphere of creativity and charity, which has helped them to provide unbiased, accurate and assessment of innovation for video game, digital media and technology users around the world.

The company is currently developing several prototype digital content and social network websites that will provide an innovative user content engagement strategy to the Digital Marketplace-instantly delivering products, promotional incentives and digital content. Serving and engaging their end users is at the heart of what they do and remains our number one priority.

The company goal is to develop instant digital content delivery in concert with dynamic social network tools that significantly improve the end-users interaction with the internet. In pursuing this goal, the company believes it will have a positive impact on the marketplace, even if the near term financial returns are not obvious. For example, the company will make their business model widely available to potential advertisers in order to promote more cost effective digital marketplace advertising, enabling a global reach of their product or services. Subscription will be the principal source of revenue, and the subscriber will be provided relevant and useful tools rather than intrusive and annoying content. The company’s goal is to provide users with an excellent opportunity to communicate effectively with advertisers and participate in the process of developing successful products and services.

name: Babelio
overview: Babelio is the french leading social network for booklovers. It aims at building powerful book recommendation tools dedicated to the french market.

name: Hunchers
overview:
Hunchers.com is a platform for hosting Sport Prediction Communities. Sport Prediction Communities consist of very enthusiastic and loyal members who discuss upcoming sporting events; they then compete with their virtual peers to see who will better predict the results of these events.

Hunchers.com takes care of the whole prediction process: it publicizes upcoming events, records member predictions, announces the results when they become available and keeps track of the points members have accumulated. In addition, in order to garner the growing worldwide popularity of sports, the site was designed with multilingualism in mind to ensure a large potential user base.

Hunchers.com presently covers soccer, basketball and American football, though is designed to support all kinds of sports with Tennis and Baseball next to be implemented.

Being an active member of a Sport Prediction Community fulfills an individual’s need for belonging, need for interaction, and based on the quality of their predictions, that individual’s need to be appreciated by his/her peers.

But can crowds better predict the results of sporting events than a handful of experts? Well, a book published in 2004 with the intriguing title “The wisdom of the crowds” says that they can. We intend to answer this question very soon.

name: Twiturm
overview:
Twiturm.com is your source to share your music with fans and friends on Twitter, Facebook, Myspace and more.

With Twiturm, sharing your music is a simple and pretty much instant process. Log in with your Twitter credentials, browse to a mp3 on your computer, fill in a few details about your mp3 and click submit. From there we tweet a link that your friends and fans can click and instantly hear your music.

Optionally, you can connect your Facebook account and post directly to you Facebook stream. A link and embedded player is available to your friends and fans so they can hear your music without the need to leave Facebook.

Twiturm is the concept of a musician for musicians. Built with the artist’s needs first, Twiturm has quickly turned in to a very useful and reliable source for the independant musician.

Twiturm is not intended to be used as a place to share music that you didn’t create. Twiturm is not for their music it’s for your music. Twit Ur Music - Twiturm

name: Socialbomb
overview:
Socialbomb’s platform connects your audienceâ€™s mobile phones, blu-ray players, computers, and connected devices to their friends and the things they love.

Every brand manager wants to build apps that will kickstart conversations across the world’s Facebook pages, Twitter streams and iPhones. Socialbomb helps developers and creatives build those apps. They provide a single API that communicates with many social networks at once, so developers can spend their time on the core application instead of programing for each individual service.

The Socialbomb engine is a RESTful API that lets customers exchange data dynamically with specific services. They push data to Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Flickr and other social networks, and then pull information back into their customers’ applications for richer features and more meaningful analytics. The Socialbomb API can provide detailed feedback about which content users like, comment on, and share.

They also provide a webâ€based administration and analytics suite to manage and measure the apps running on their platform. Customers can add publication channels, edit the services they make available, and review user activity metrics.

name: Tudou
overview:
As one of the most recognised Internet brands, Tudou was the first UGC video sharing website launched in China.

The slogan “Everyone is living director” convened original strength, making Tudou far ahead in the UGC counterparts. The 2.0 strategy proposed by CEO Weidong Yang is aimed to focus more on the the lifestyle and growth of young users as they work to get their voices heard on mainstream network media platforms.””

Tudou went alive on April 15, 2005. Led by its founder Wang Wei, Tudou was listed on the NASDAQ on August 17. The merger of China’s two biggest online video companies has been finalised after shareholder meetings on August 20, 2012 approved the deal and the new entity will be named Youku Tudou Inc. Tudou.com completed its fifth round of financing 40 million dollars in 2010.

According to iResearch, the number of monthly unique visitors to Tudou’s site increased to approximately 227 million in May, 2013 from approximately 182 million in December 2010. As of May, 2013, Youku Tudou Inc has the absolute advantage in terms of user base.

Major rivals are Sohu, PPTV and iQiyi.

With hundreds of unbiased stories from real people and an inside look at different industries, job seekers can finally get a feel for the working world before they enter it.

NB CareerPlayer is currently in public beta

name: Sports Reference
overview:
Sports Reference maintains websites providing top notch statistics and resources for sports fans everywhere.

Their aim is to be the easiest-to-use, fastest, most complete sources for sports statistics anywhere. Sports Reference websites include Baseball-Reference.com, Basketball-Reference.com, Pro-Football-Reference.com, Hockey-Reference.com and Olympics at Sports-Reference.com.

name: RazeTheWorld
overview:
RazeTheWorld is an online PC gaming and hardware oriented blog and community.

The website was founded by Logan back in June of 2008, containing a blog where news is posted, and a forum consisting of thousands of users. Since then, the site has expanded exponentially, moving to other areas of entertainment, such as game events, live streaming, and online video.

RazeTheWorld features two groups of blogs. A main blog, where official writers maintain their standpoint on games or hardware, talk about current events, or post current news regarding the industry. RazeTheWorld also features a Community Blog, where any member of the community can voice their opinion in the form of a news article, blog, or rant.

RazeTheWorld utilizes youtube as a means of relaying additional news as and general wackiness to the masses on their channel. Most of the videos consist of news, gameplay videos of upcoming or newly released games for PC, or other general nonsense.

Part of what makes RazeTheWorld special is their intent to drift as far away from other gaming websites, making it a unique community, where users can voice their opinions and debate on different things in areas other websites fear to tread. The writing style of the authors often make the blogs or videos informative, yet fun and entertaining.

RazeTheWorld also features several game servers for PC games, hosting weekly or bi-weekly “events” in which members of the community put their skills to the test with site moderators and other community members in games like Team Fortress 2, and Counter Strike: Source.

acquisition.source_description: ZeniMax Buys Game Developer id Software
name: id Software
overview:
id Software is responsible for some of the best-selling and most critically acclaimed video games of all time. Located in Mequite Texas, since their founding in 1991.

Ushering in a new era of interactive entertainment with genre-defining blockbusters like Wolfenstein 3D, DOOM and QUAKE, id has secured itself a place in gaming history as one of the fathers of the modern video game.

They were one of the first game shops to make the shareware distribution model work.

It all began on May 5, 1991, when id Software, fresh off the heels of its success with the Commander Keen series of titles, gave the PC gaming world a glimpse of the future with the shareware release of Wolfenstein 3D. A shot of pure adrenaline, Wolfenstein 3D thrust gamers into a frenetic first-person universe of relentless action that would forever change the face of gaming.

Widely recognized as the original first-person shooter, Wolfenstein 3D was later inducted into the Computer Gaming World “Hall of Fame” for shaping the overall direction of the video game industry.

Then, on December 10, 1994, id unleashed DOOM on the world. A technically stunning opus of heart-stopping action, unspeakable horror and pure gaming bliss, DOOM heralded a paradigm shift in video games. Hardcore PC games were going mainstream.

Selling millions of copies and chalking up tens of millions of downloads as shareware, DOOM remains one of the most popular PC games ever. And the title’s impact on the gaming world is still felt today.

With DOOM, id Software put the shareware distribution model on the map, with the game’s runaway success owing a debt to the growth of Internet distribution. The company has continued to support shareware and other non-traditional means of distribution, influencing the way companies market and sell video games.

DOOM also introduced multiplayer gaming to the masses, allowing players to compete in intense 4-player LAN or head-to-head modem competitions.

id Software didn’t stop there, the team of innovators also made DOOM’s source code available to their fan base, encouraging would-be game designers to modify the game and create their own levels, or “mods.” Fans were free to distribute their mods of the game, as long as the updates were offered free of charge to other enthusiasts. The mod community took off, giving the game seemingly eternal life on the Internet. In fact, id discovered many of their current employees and development partners based on mods that were created and distributed over the Internet.

DOOM and its sequels went on to enjoy tremendous sales on virtually every gaming platform available - from the Sega Genesis to the Game Boy Advance.

The next quantum leap in PC gaming came from id Software in 1996 with the release of QUAKE. Based on an all-new graphics engine, QUAKE was the first truly 3D video game, allowing players to interact with the virtual worlds created by id like never before. Gamers were free to look and move in any direction, giving the game designers at id the freedom and ability to create incredibly immersive environments in this epic, single-player game.

id Software continued the tradition of QUAKE, with QUAKE II in 1997. Supporting multiplay for up to 32 players simultaneously, QUAKE II was a watershed hit for the company, selling more than one million copies, despite it’s steep hardware requirements. By now, it had become clear that id’s games were reason enough to upgrade, or even buy, personal home computers.

In 1999, the easy-going guys from Mesquite further cemented their place in gaming lore with the ultimate deathmatch experience, QUAKE III Arena and the QUAKE III: Team Arena add-on pack. Designed to be the ultimate multiplayer experience, QUAKE III Arena has become the defacto standard for professional gamers and is the game of choice for tournaments around the world. A QUAKE III Arena tournament is the centerpiece of id’s annual QuakeCon tournament and LAN party, played every summer near the company’s headquarters in Mesquite. QuakeCon 2001 winners alone pulled in a combined $50,000 in cash and prizes.

In 2001, id Software teamed up with Gray Matter Interactive and Nerve Software to develop Return to Castle Wolfenstein, a re-imagining of the original classic, Wolfenstein 3D. Built around the Quake III Arena graphics engine, Return to Castle Wolfenstein introduced a new generation of gamers to the epic series that started it all. In its first two months of release, Return to Castle Wolfenstein shipped over one million units worldwide, and has been widely acclaimed as one of the best computer games of 2001.

The company also has enjoyed success licensing its revolutionary technology to other developers. To date, id’s game engines have powered blockbuster titles from other producers, including Call of Duty, Soldier of Fortune, Half-Life, Medal of Honor: Allied Assault, Star Trek: Elite Force, Heretic, Hexen and more.

In August of 2004, id Software released the next chapter in the DOOM legacy, Featuring a new, mind-blowing gaming engine from John Carmack, bringing a terrifying new storyline based on the original masterpiece.

description: Music Streaming, Ad Revenue for Artists
name: Kerchoonz
overview:
Kerchoonz is â€œA modern Record Dealâ€ for bands and artists where fans can listen to music for free, but the bands get paid for each stream via an advertising share that they receive from the site. Bands can also sell their music directly from their profile player and set the price for their own download sales.

Kerchoonz also offers an online shop for bands, allowing bands to sell not only their digital downloads, but also their physical CDâ€™s, T-shirts, even their old gear through their own social networking profile on the site as well as in Kâ€™Ching, the new on-line direct sale and auction shop at http://www.kerchoonz.com/kching Regular non-artist members can also sell used and new items on Kching and set up a store on their Kerchoonz profile.

Bands and fans can join Kerchoonz using their Facebook ID and connect their Facebook with Kerchoonz. Got a new song? Upload it to Kerchoonz and it automatically updates both your Kerchoonz feed and your Facebook feed! New video, new blog or new gig dates? Post it to Kerchoonz and it will quickly show up in your Facebook friendâ€™s feed!

Kerchoonz is also partnering with Twitter. So, members will be able to easily retweet songs, videos and even links to their store and products that they are selling.

Kerchoonz helps artists spread the word quickly giving them record company tools like K-widgets (mini websites that can be pasted all over the web to help artists promote their music). Kerchoonz also promotes its artists and bands web-wide through events like Kerchoonz Live and online PR strategies that help get your bands material out in front of radio, press and promoters. Kerchoonz is free to join and launches officially this month!

Kerchoonz is FREE to Join and is completely non-exclusive. Bands have 100% control of their copyright

name: D2C Games
overview:
D2C Games, Inc. (D2C), based in San Mateo, CA, is a leading digital download publisher of interactive entertainment for console and handheld game platforms. Founded in 2006, the company develops and publishes products worldwide. The company is a licensed Sony and Apple publisher and is licensed to develop and/or publish for Nintendo and Microsoft game platforms.

D2C Games is led by industry creative visionary and “Game Making God” Scott Orr (source: Wired Magazine May 2001). His experience spans more than 25 years in the industry as designer, producer and executive. In addition to Mr. Orr’s successes, D2C’s team has individually and collectively been responsible for creating and developing some of the most successful game franchises ever created, including MADDEN Football, NASCAR, NHL Hockey, Knockout Kings, NCAA Football, Jungle Strike, World Wrestling Entertainment, Medal of Honor, The Simpsons, Crash, Spyro, F.E.A.R., and No One Lives Forever.

name: Gogogic
overview:
Gogogic makes massively multiplayer worlds that are free-to-play and accessible from everywhere. Focus is on Mid-Core MMOGs that can be played both online and through iOS devices.

The company is currently working on Godsrule, a highly anticipated cross-platform fantasy MMO, coming soon to Facebook and iPad. In a lush, player-driven world, the game drives players into forming clans, fighting in a unique multiplayer battle system, exploring an ancient world, and building their empire.

Godsrule takes the latest RPG trends into full account and parts of it should feel comfortably familiar to both experienced players and social MMORPG enthusiasts alike.

Official Godsrule page at playgodsrule.com

name: SAMP2
overview:
SAMP2 is an abbreviation of Sound, Animation, Message and moving pictures. SAMP2 is a web application that empowers the individual creativity of individuals. Every individual with an internet connection can make a SAMP2, which is an animated message which is created by combining an animation with upload pictures, messages, sound and video. The animated message will be send and shared with the world enforcing it’s viral force.

The rapid growth of the internet and the requirement and level of usage of and demand for innovative scripting and editing methods is the driving force for SAMP2. Creating innovative clips of any content can and need to be executed instantly, across borders and at acceptable cost, enabling businesses and individuals to deliver new and enhanced communication services and providing people with unlimited creativity. Due to its unique render software SAMP2 creates the personalized video almost realtime. The created SAMP2 will be published in a personalized library to the world.

SAMP2 enables users to add content like animations, pictures, messages, music and video and will trust users to become co-developers. It’s services becomes better the more people use it and it will harrness collective intelligence. Every individual will be an artist and their creation will be found for a long time through the customer self-service long tail principle.

name: Video-Alerts
overview:
Video-Alerts is a simple service that allows you to get email notifications when new videos are available, using keywords (or channels). The service is free and currently supports YouTube only.

Video Alerts can be useful to bloggers who want to be the first to find out about new videos in their niche, information officers, or anyone really - can be used to follow your favorite musician, investment portfolio, local events, etc.

name: Cinelan
overview:
CINELAN is filmmaker-driven, video publisher dedicated to delivering new audiences and ongoing revenues to documentary filmmakers through the worldwide syndication of professionally-produced, three-minute films.

Meeting the content needs of syndication partners and brands for high quality and engaging content, CINELAN is building the worldâ€™s largest premium library of â€œmust seeâ€ three-minute stories (all non-fiction) on a range of topics that include world affairs, environmental issues, entertainment, technology, and humor. Mainstream audiences will access CINELAN films through content-rich websites, digital cinemas, TV, and mobile devices. Our syndication process offers filmmakers painless access to quality distribution, immediate funding and a reliable revenue stream.

name: Independent Comedy Network
overview:
The Independent Comedy Network is a new media comedy brand. We work with professional talent to develop and distribute original comedy series online and beyond.

ICN operates under the basic improvisational comedy principle of YES, AND. In improv terms this means that whatever is presented on stage by one actor is heard and accepted by a fellow actor (YES) and then built upon (AND). This concept is the primary building block for all great improvisational comedy.

acquisition.source_description: ClearOne Acquires NetStreams
name: NetStreams
overview: Headquartered in Austin, Texas, NetStreams is the undisputed world leader in digital entertainment networks based on Internet protocol (IP) technology. NetStreams’ IP-Based & IP-controlled systems, designed for residential and commercial use, handle any number of digital or analog sources and deliver uncompressed content, including high definition audio and video, to an unlimited number of zones. By combining content and control signals in one data stream, NetStreams systems offer new levels of affordability, simplicity, reliability, and expandability, benefiting both installers and end-users with lower costs for installation, set-up, and support.

name: Sabi
overview:
Sabi’s learning games take a refreshing approach to applying AAA gaming techniques infused with a new learning model.

Sabi is a spin-off from Microsoft Corporation. The co-founders were members of a research team that collaborated with Dr. John Bransford’s learning science team for three years to evolve game designs and technologies into a new approach in children’s learning. Microsoft maintains an equity investment based on the technology transferred from the research project to Sabi.

The Sabi team was able to start a C-Corp, ship a game, and realize revenue during it’s first year of operation.

Sabi isn’t just about creating learning games. The Sabi team is passionate about what it means to takehow kids play and how kids learn to the next level. Team members have shipped many successful AAA games for video game consoles and also have the three year experience of exploring into how children learn with the learning science team.

name: Comixology
overview:
Founded in 2007 with the mission of bringing comics to people everywhere, comiXology — in just five short years — has revolutionized the comic book and graphic novel world. From creating the industry leading platform for digital comics to tools and services for brick and mortar retailers, comiXology has lead the charge in exposing new audiences to the rich history and culture of comic books.

With the development of the Comics by comiXology digital comics platform — available across iPhone, iPad, Android, Kindle Fire and the Web — comiXology provides the easiest way worldwide for people to enjoy comics at just the click of a button! Regularly ranking as the top grossing iPad app in the entire iTunes App Store, Comics by comiXology was recently selected as a preloaded app on Amazon’s Kindle Fire.

Providing digital comics across multiple platforms, comiXology will not stop until everyone on the face of the earth has been turned into a comic book fan.

For more information, please visit www.comixology.com.
