name: LoomTV
overview: LoomTV improves searching, watching and sharing of online videos as it goes new ways with its content variety and interactive design. Users can simultaneously search and collect videos from YouTube, GoogleVideo, Dailymotion and other hosts. In order to put videos in the center of attention, there are special features like the fading out of control elements. Registered users can watch videos nonstop from different hosts and add them to their channels. The browser and Adobe Air download version of LoomTV are for free and available in six languages.

name: Dog Files
overview:
The Dog Files is a brand new high-definition web video series that travels across America showcasing all the incredible stories and events about America’s best friend, dogs.

Launched in June 2008, The Dog Files is now a web portal featuring news, lifestyle, health issues and grooming tips for people and their dogs, with plenty of warmth and humor to spare. Anchoring the site is The Dog Files series itself, shot in beautiful HD with top flight post-production from GraphicPlanet Creative.

Currently the five to eight-minute episodes are posted once a month, but sponsorships and syndication pickups will allow Kenn to post episodes with greater frequency in the coming months.

name: StuVu
overview:
StuVu.com provides student reviews of colleges and universities through student generated videos, photos and reviews.

StuVu (as in Student View) is a free service that creates a community for college students to share videos, photos and reviews of their college experiences with prospective students to give them a true student’s view of what it’s like to attend their colleges and universities.

With information on over 6500 of America’s four-year, two-year, vocational and online colleges/universities. StuVu gives you the chance to hear from the real campus experts.

name: i-Jet Media
overview:
i-Jet Media is one of the world’s leading distribution networks and publishers of social games.

Founded in 2005, the company published its first game projects in 2007. In April 2009, i-Jet Media launched Happy Harvest on the largest Russian social network Vkontakte.ru, and the title remains the most popular and profitable social game in the history of the Russian market.

Nowadays, more than 70 million users playing several dozens of social games created by 40+ developers and published by i-Jet Media on 30+ social networks across the world.

Offices of i-Jet Media are situated in Silicon Valley (CA, USA) and Beijing (China), as well as in Ekaterinburg, Chelyabinsk, Nizhny Tagil and Ozersk (Russia). Employees: 150+.

The company is developing European, Asian and American markets.

name: RealD
overview:
RealD is comprised of three divisions: Cinema, Professional (aka “Pro”) and Consumer.

RealD Cinema supplies equipment and technology for the projection of 3D movies.

RealD Pro service researchers, scientists and developers in a great many industries, providing 3D technology to enable the simulations and inventions of cutting-edge products.

RealD Consumer works with companies integrating 3D technology into appliances that will soon appear in the home, in the office and in public spaces.

name: Music For Busy People
overview:
Music For Busy People (MFBP) is an invite-only online music community. The once cult email list now has a web presence.

Led by Max, a former DJ and Rolling Stone employee, the group receives fresh music recommendations by email and can contribute by suggesting songs.

There is also a waiting list for the group that members can vote on, as well as other limited but expanding web-based community features.

name: Bandloop
overview:
Bandloop is a community of bands and music fans working together to share the latest concert information. Bands can add tour dates and messages, while fans can track updates from their favorite bands and enter concert and venue information on their behalf.

Bandloop offers customizable calendar widgets for bands, fans, and music bloggers, and plans to release an API and iPhone application in the near future.

acquisition.source_description: Cisco buys IP-based video surveillance company, BroadWare
name: BroadWare Technologies
overview: As of June 11, 2007, BroadWare Technologies, Inc. was acquired by Cisco Systems, Inc. BroadWare Technologies, Inc., a network video systems company, engages in the development and delivery of platforms and end-to-end browser-based solutions for collecting, recording, routing, and managing live and archived surveillance video. It offers Media Platform, a suite of server-based technologies for management, distribution, and storage of video surveillance data in a network environment; and Application Server, which enables users to determine levels of authority for viewing cameras, creating or viewing archives, and controlling movable cameras. The company offers Command Server, a digital matrix switch that allows each operator and intelligent application to control the video being displayed on various monitors; and Media Server that enables distribution, archiving, and management of video feeds. In addition, BroadWare Technologies provides specialty professional services, education and training, and support services. The company provides its products for use in applications, such as military bases, unmanned vehicles, embassies, corrections, border control, perimeter montoring, law enforcement, airports and seaports, homeland security, traffic montoring, and public infrastructure montoring, as well as corporate security, retail, public transit systems, gaming, health care, colleges and universities monitoring, petro-chemical, utlitites, and financial services. It serves airports and seaports, transportation systems, and various federal agencies and military branches. The company, formerly known as Graham Technology Solutions, was founded in 1995 and is headquartered in Santa Clara, California.

name: Natasha
overview:
Natasha is a Tokyo-based web service company that offers Natalie as its main service. Natalie focuses on delivering news from the Japanese pop music industry in English to a global audience. The site has been completely revamped and reopened on December 25, 2008.

Natasha is also offering Comic Natalie, a service that provides news about Japanese comics, DVDs, figures, pop art and similar producs. Comic Natalie is currently Japanese only.
tag_list: j-pop, japanese-pop, news, tokyo, japan, entertainment, news-distribution

name: DigiDock
overview:
Japan-based DigiDock is a provider of applications for the iPhone and iPod Touch.

Reversi Sister, a Japanophile version of the board game Reversi (Othello), is the first application offered by DigiDock in English.

name: Bandbox
overview: Bandbox was founded in 2007 by musicians who thought there had to be a better way for musicians to make a living. There had to be a better way for musicians to sell music without the middlemen. There had to be a better way for musicians to control the sale of their music.

Shacknews covers games across every major platform with well-researched news and in-depth previews and interviews, and is home to a large community of dedicated gamers who actively discuss news and feature content.

name: Selatra
overview:
Selatra is mobile gaming specialist, providing content, download platforms and storefronts worldwide.

Founded in 2002 by a group of Telecommunicationsâ€™ industry professionals who have developed purpose-built technology to manage mobile device recognition, optimized storefronts, and the licensing and distribution of quality games.

As a partner, we offer publishers a direct link to Network Operators and the biggest digital content retailers who use Selatra to power their services.

We currently distribute more than 200 publishers of Android and Java-based applications in 55 countries via our platform, On-Device-Portals and storefronts.

name: MediaNama
overview:
MediaNama provides news & analysis of Telecom, Internet, Media and Gaming businesses in India.

Founded by journalist Nikhil Pahwa, MediaNama gives an independent perspective on the convergence of Media and Telecom for decision-making executives within India, and those looking to invest in India’s emerging Telecom and Media market.

Prior to starting MediaNama, Pahwa was the Editor of contentSutra, the India focused site from ContentNext Media.

name: Tvinci
overview:
Formed in 2007 especially for the advent of Over-the-Top TV (OTT TV), Tvinci’s award-winning platform enables its customers – TV operators, telcos and media companies – to create a personalized, social TV experience for end-users consuming premium content across various devices. The company specializes in high-end solutions for the smart management of content and user experience, and has deployed its platform for leading brands like Liberty Global, Orange, Elisa and others worldwide.

Tvinci provides pay TV operators a white-label platform for Over-the-Top TV across devices. It is the only platform that offers both an OTT back-end and an extensive user experience management system that drives TV applications for the delivery of live content and VOD on smartphones, tablets, connected TVs, set-top boxes and virtually any device. Its new OTT 2.0 Platform enables viewers to personalize their experience on any video enabled connected device including the living room TV or set-top box with a finger tap, thus offering users the option of bringing their social network into the TV experience.
tag_list: video, internet-video, internet-tv, turnkey-video-solution, custom-internet-tv, ott, multi-screen-video, monetize-video, online-video, connected-tv, iptv, stb, mobile-video

name: Mugasha
overview:
Mugasha is looking to make it easy to listen to Electronic Music podcasts and long sets from high profile DJs.

Similar in concept to Hulu but for electronic music sets. Users can stream high quality music, view tracklists, skip and replay tracks, and jump to any specific song within a set.

name: VLADIcast
overview:
VLADIcast is a provider of Internet-based digital distribution systems. VLADIcast creates and manages white-label private video screening rooms and public video distribution sites for its clients.

VLADIcast’s flagship product is the GoScreening Platform. The GoScreening Platform is comprised of a set of web server and client technologies which allow VLADIcast to create PUBLIC and PRIVATE online video screening rooms. The platform serves as a code-base for high quality, high resolution video sharing applications. Examples of distributed video include not are not limited to: rough cuts, locked picture, short films, feature length films, trailers, and screeners.

VLADIcast’s encoding service prepares video content for online consumption. Videos are distributed as high quality streams, iPod/iPohone compatible downloads, and files that download directly to a DVD-R and play back on any DVD player.
tag_list: video, film, hd, dvd, self-distribution, distribution

name: CollegeClickTV
overview:
CollegeClickTV.com is the only site that brings the college experience home with such quantity and quality. We filmed students, professors, faculty, staff and even the local merchants.

We asked all the questions that you need answers to. Questions such as: Which professors are best and what courses to take? How to prepare for college life? Which frats and sororities are most philanthropic? How’s the school’s safety? What’s the school spirit like? What dorms are best? How to get student financing to pay for college?

Before visiting any college, visit CollegeClickTV.com. See and hear the student point-of-view, see the sights, feel the excitement and truly experience all that college life has to offer.

Or Mission: Get to know your top college picks without stepping foot on campus. Learn about the best dorms, the school spirit, night life, Greek life, campus activities and professors by watching streaming video! CollegeClickTV.com noticed a problem: It’s time-consuming and expensive to visit campuses all over the country. So we found the solution: We’re bringing the campus and peer reviews to your home.

Our Video Library: Quite frankly, with nearly 30,000 videos from 200 colleges, we are the largest content provider of exclusive student review videos. We also provide videos and information for adult learners. Learn more about continuing your education and start providing more for your future and family.

Our Partners: Some of the largest and most-respected names in the college markets, not only saw tremendous value in our content, but more importantly saw content that could be trusted. We’re proud that U.S. News and World Report, Kaplan Test Prep, CliffsNotes and University Advisors have all signed on and are providing our content to their customers.

name: KISS Intelligent Systems
overview:
KISS Intelligent Systems is a UK based software company. The Companies main focus is the development of a forth coming IPTV platform. The platform combines a new Managed Peer to Peer distribution technology with a seamless graphical user interface, to provide a unique user experience.

The company has also founded two open source projects which provide some of the technologies used in the IPTV platform. AMPE is a video engine for .net which provides native support for Ogg Vorbis and Theora and any other format via plugins. OHM is a cross platform interface for the Apache Clustered Database Hbase.

The company is self funded via software development and consulting work it carries out for clients.

name: AutomatedGamer
overview:
AutomatedGamer monitors your personal game list against video game news from across the internet. AG’s game classification technology scans game news sites across the internet, automatically sorting the news by video game, and analyzing what type of news it is. They detect new game trailers, screenshots, reviews and other information; then deliver the latest updates to members monitoring those games.

Additionally, the system calculates an “AG Score” for released games. A new review from a source has been detected, AutomatedGamer runs that review score through our proprietary averaging algorithm, and present subscribers with a reliable indicator of how great each game is.

name: Geewa
overview:
Geewa develops and operates real-time casual competitive browser-based games for web, mobile phones and interactive TV.

The Geewa 3.0 platform (released in May 2009) provides full social gaming support, incorporating a web messenger (in-browser IM), original “animated avatars”, virtual goods, micro-payments, player competitions and more.

In 2010 Geewa released its first game on Facebook called Pool Live Tour. The game is continuously growing in popularity and as of September 2011 amongst the Top100 Facebook Applications with over 1.200.000 DAU.

Geewa’s business model is based on 2 main revenue streams. The first one is user generated micro-transactions and virtual goods. The second one is advertising (primarily premium ad positions, i.e. pre-roll and post-roll with stable 10% CTRs).

Based in Prague, Geewa is enabling players around the world to compete in real-time. As of September 2011 Geewa features about 7mil unique visitors per month either directly on Geewa.com, Facebook or via partners sites using Geewa’s white-label multiplayer gaming platform.

Geewa is a 2008 Red Herring 100 Europe Winner and a Global Red Herring 100 Finalist.
tag_list: multiplayer-game, game, casual-game, flash-game, mobile, iptv, flash, prague, central-europe

name: Turtle Entertainment
overview: Turtle Entertainment was founded in 2000. The company quickly grew to be the European leader in the sector of online gaming and electronic sports (eSports). The Electronic Sports League, operated by Turtle Entertainment, is active in 20 different countries worldwide. The league portal www.esl.eu reaches above 1,5 million unique visitors a month generated by more than 900,000 active members. Turtle Entertainment has 170 employees and is located in Cologne, Germany. Ten international license holders operate the ESL worldwide. Turtle Entertainment owns the majority of the Chinese eSports league PGL (Pro Gamer League) since 2007. Important business partners of Turtle Entertainment are global corporations such as Intel, Dell, Volkswagen and adidas. Turtle Entertainment markets its products worldwide using these specific brands: Electronic Sports League (ESL), ESL Amateur Series, ESL Pro Series, ESL Major Series, ESL European Nations Championship (ENC), ESL WC3L Series, ESL TV, Intel Extreme Masters, Consoles Sport League, United Consoles League, eSport Schulmeisterschaft, eSports Award and ESL Sports. Until December 2008 Turtle Entertainment has paid out more than three million Euro prize money.

name: Major League Gaming
overview: Major League Gaming (MLG) is the global leader in eSports. The company operates MLG.tv, the #1 online broadcast network for professional level competitive gaming; the MLG Pro Circuit, the longest-running eSports league in North America; and MLG: Play, the largest cross platform online gaming tournament system with 8 million registered users across the globe. MLG is one of the fastest growing digital networks worldwide with over 600% growth in audience over the last three years. Each month, the company reaches millions of highly-engaged fans via web, mobile, connected TVs and gaming consoles making it the definitive property for major advertisers to reach young men (80% 16-34 year olds; 90% male, and over 40% HHI $100k+: Comscore). For more information: www.mlg.tv.

name: Culture Unplugged Studios
offices: [{"description":"Culture Unplugged Studios","address1":"Office #2, 4th Floor, Oakwood Premier,","address2":"81, Mundhwa, Koregaon Park Annex, ","zip_code":"411036","city":"Pune","state_code":null,"country_code":"IND","latitude":null,"longitude":null},{"description":"Culture Unplugged Ltd.","address1":"56 West Coast Road,","address2":"Glen Eden,","zip_code":"0602","city":"Auckland","state_code":null,"country_code":"NZL","latitude":null,"longitude":null},{"description":"Culture Unplugged Ltd.","address1":"c/o LINK TV","address2":"901 Battery Street, Suite 308","zip_code":"94111","city":"San Francisco","state_code":"CA","country_code":"USA","latitude":null,"longitude":null}]
overview:
“Culture Unplugged” is not just a name of a studio, it is a mission - a vision and aspiration to integrate disparate parts of the self and the global human society. It aims to achieve this, primarily by leveraging the power of new media and extending the effort to offline events and actions. But above all, achieve the mission by being the seeker of truth “herself” on the journey her vision charts ahead - not just be an organization, but be the way of being - as referred here as “She”.

At present, Culture Unplugged efforts are focused on enabling networks of socially & spiritually conscious content and its creators. With presence in India, USA, UK, Indonesia and New Zealand, we are dedicated to bring authentic/independent voices of diverse cultures to global audiences. We are committed to contemplate and contribute to our personal as well as collective spiritual need of the time. Our focus is on the inner+inter cultural expression. Our aim is to work toward unity & harmony through all kinds of man-made divisions.

In brief, Culture Unplugged, by and for global community of conscious storytellers, culture explorers and world citizens to reflect on issues and life experiences in contemporary world - a new media studio focused on producing as well as promoting socially & spiritually sensitive stories/films that does not merely express but pulsate to energize, enchant, enlighten, engage or embrace the humanity in us all. Festivals :

We debuted in May 2008 with our first online film festival. Till date, we have launched 9 festivals. At present, our plan is to sponsor 4 themes for these festivals: 1. We Speak, Here. 2. Humanity Explored, 3. Green Uplugged, 4. Spirit Enlightened. They focus to observe our external world, social issues prevalent today, and meditate on the spiritual state of the human consciousness at present - influencing our culture and nature, within and without, at present and of future.

Content Production :

We are focusing on producing digital/HD content. Our productions aspire to be low Cost & global without any preconceived limits on form or length of the content which presents creative spirituality at work. We also invite collaborations across borders on documentary productions on specific social issues. We believe in innovation through peaceful subversion of the proverbial precepts. We DO NOT wish to produce to fill the spaces in media channel, but fill spaces within us.

filMedia network :

We have also launched another online platform recently, that caters to upcoming as well as established film-makers, looking to reach out to wider audience for social mission and/or find new markets & connect with global producers. With this platform, we wish to facilitate cross-pollination of ideas, spirit and knowledge among storytellers, content producers, professionals from social/scientific arena and global audiences.

Distribution :

Our studio wishes to distribute films/media which shares Culture Unplugged’s vision & mission, from willing independent artists and filmmakers primarily from Asia, MiddleEast, Africa but certainly not limited to these regional borders only. As our efforts are non-commerical at present, for distribution, we work with our partner distributor who is global and shares our mission, vision and understands our intention to offer transparent, fair and just partnership to film-makers/producers.

It is our intent to promote the content inspired by true events/stories or those innate cultural expression by storyteller touched by local life experience (in all forms : short films, shows/pilots, features, documentaries and music videos). At present, we promote & distribute the talent + content from the participants of the Culture Unplugged festivals to television & alternative distribution channels across the globe. If you wish to distribute with us but haven’t participated in festival, please send us your screener copy. Our distribution model is designed to provide a fair and democratized platform that is transparent and open. Partners :

International organizations such as Link TV, IRIN, NDTV, UNDP(India), MTV EXIT, USAID are our core partners. Other partners include TERI, WWF(India), MINUSTAH, UNICEF(Hait), Pop!Tech Institute, University of Michigan, The Aspen Institute, UNODC, UN.GIFT, AFO, Oxfam Hong Kong.

name: Quickflix
overview:
Quickflix is an Australian online movie subscription company with a choice of over 39,000 film, TV series, documentary and sporting titles across 400 genres in DVD and high definition Blu-ray formats.

Quickflix delivers rental DVDs to anywhere in Australia free of charge (next day in most major cities) to its 40,000+ members and there are no late fees or return deadlines.

Since 2004 Quickflix has delivered over six million DVDs and now delivers almost two hundred thousand DVDs each month.

Quickflix (QFX) was listed on Australia Securities Exchange in 2005.

overview: Video Ezy was founded in Australia in 1983 and quickly established itself as an innovative video rental and retail outlets. Video Ezy owns 26 corporate stores and is franchisor to a further 430 stores throughout Australia. It is master franchisor to a further 260 outlets in New Zealand, Thailand, Indonesia and Singapore.

name: BCmoney
overview:
BCmoney MobileTV is digging its heels in and preparing for the coming seachange in the media distribution landscape, with a particular focus on semantic web and mobile technologies.

With its unique revenue model, innovative ad units, and game-changing technology ideas, it is sure to be a major player in the coming transition from the Broadcast to Broadcatch, and, from Pay-per-View (PPV) Unicast to Peer-to-Peer (P2P) Multicast models for media distribution, each of which will be increasingly prevalent in the coming decade (2010-2020) and beyond.

The company is less than one year old but is already promoting a strong sense of Corporate Social Responsibility with its free advertising program for non-profit organizations and its planned live web/broadcasted fundraising event for the Canadian Breast Cancer Foundation.

name: Fliggo
overview:
Fliggo is instant video communities.

Fliggo offers anyone the ability to create their own video-uploading site, and share the videos either privately or publicly. Fliggo hosts and streams the videos, and gives site owners easy management tools to customize and monitor activity on the site. While the basic service is free, Fliggo charges for commercial features such as serving ads on a site or controlling the domain that it is on.

Create the next YouTube or just a private place to share your videos. Sites created with Fliggo are highly customizable, with many privacy and moderation options.

name: Phlook
overview: Phlook transforms photos on a blog/website into interactive social media.

name: Uwink
overview: uWink, Inc. operates as an entertainment restaurant company in the United States. The company primarily operates and develops an interactive entertainment restaurant concept, called uWink. The uWink concept enables customers to order food, drinks, and games from the uWink Game Library and other digital media at the table through touch screen terminals. It also licenses SNAP!, a countertop video game terminal technology; and Bear Shop, an entertainment vending platform technology for animated point of purchase vending. The company was incorporated in 1999 and is based in Van Nuys, California.

description: Metacast is a Tokyo-based web company.
name: Metacast
overview:
Metacast is a Tokyo-based Internet company that currently offers a total of four online video- and TV-related web services. Tagiri, Saguri, Terebi Burogu and its flagship product Mitter.

The company’s goal is to centralize consumer-generated metadata, which Metacast defines as “any kind of information based on activity and experience”.

Metacast’s newest product is Jingoo, a Firefox or Internet Explorer add on that serves as an application window on the right of your browser. In this so-called “Jingoo Zone”, users can play games, shop, view tweets etc. Jingoo is currently Japanese only (November 2009).

name: Obsessed TV
overview:
Obsessed TV is a first-of-its-kind web talk show that will entertain and enlighten while revealing the personalities behind its exceptional interviewees.

Samantha Ettus and Gary Vaynerchuk have created transported the personal expose format pioneered by Barbara Walters and Larry King into the purely digital medium, in an effort to celebrate the most intriguing personalities of our time.

With its intimate one-on-one interview format, Obsessed TV is a conduit for the stories that have never been told anywhere else. Obsessed TV brings together carefully selected experts, bestselling authors and celebrities. If Samantha is Obsessed with them, you will surely become obsessed too. Samantha handpicks and interviews each guest, engaging them with her trademark passion while inducing guests to share their personalities and their professional and personal paths in a comprehensive and compelling way for the very first time.
tag_list: interview, video, celebrity, expertise, entertainment, wine, culture, entrepreneurship, personality, behind-the-scenes

description: Video network for people and businesses.

name: Visual Avenue
overview:
Visual Avenue is a video network for people and businesses. The company creates online video shows that are based on other media properties.

Current shows include:

1) The TV Star Maker: Hosted by TV executive and author of Starring-You, Marta Tracy. 2) Craving Confidence: Hosted by Patricia Stark and based around confidence from the boardroom to the bedroom and everywhere in between. 3) Why Hasn’t He TV: Hosted by TV personalities and book authors, Matt Titus and Tamsen Fadal.

description: A Rotten Tomatoes, movie rating game
name: Tomato Picker
overview: A community-based game that predicts movie ratings from Rotten Tomatoes.

name: Embedr
overview:
Embedr is a free service that lets you build custom video playlists from a variety of online clip sources and gives you the opportunity to aggregate the entire playlist into a good-looking widget which you can easily share on your blog or website.

Itâ€™s an elegant solution for those times you want to embed multiple videos in a blog post or on any web page without cluttering your site and forcing visitors to scroll down in order to watch all the clips youâ€™re sharing. Creating widgets is ridicously simple, but we should note Embedr doesnâ€™t host videos and can only pull videos from third-party services like YouTube, MySpace Video, DailyMotion, MetaCafe, Veoh, Vimeo, Blip.tv and more. The maximum number of videos you can add to one playlist is 100.
tag_list: video, embed-videos, video-sharing, video-embed, video-playlist, video-playlists

Their technology eliminates the common limitations associated with digital media distribution solutions over both private and public networks, maximizing their customers’ existing infrastructure investments, and enabling expanded revenue opportunities.

description: Video clue based Movie Trivia game
name: Scene This?
overview:
Interactive Social Media Developer.

First title published : “SceneThis?”

Audio & Video clues based Movie, Music, Sports Trivia and Educational Quiz Game. Create, Share or Take. Challenge friends. Test your knowledge and theirs.

name: Spadester
overview:
Spadester is a fast growing community for playing spades online with your friends. At Spadester, you can play the most popular spades flavors: four individual players, three individual players (known as Cutthroat), and partnership that is played with two pairs. The Spades table contains great graphics, flash animations and Chat build-in window so you can discuss with your partner while playing.

You are invited to create your own table with different game attributes. Such as: time limitation (from 5 minutes to 60 minutes), score (up to 500 points) for each game flavor and more.

You can find on the site the Spades Rules section for beginner or intermediate players. There is also a section with articles for professional spades players. Players are invited to contribute to expand our community by writing articles on our Players Articles section and sharing their experiences on the Forum.

No monthly fees. No trial version. Unlink other spades products, we provides a full Spades game application for free and further more a ticket to a fast growing community. Spadester provides a high quality product with support personnel 24/7, a well designed graphic interface, an active forum and solid ranking system.

name: Fragegg
overview:
Fragegg.com is a social gaming portal for the MMO community. Users can play MMOâ€™s collect our own virtual currency and participate in the fragegg avatar game.

Fragegg tries to facilitate the communication between gamers playing in different online games by creating a platform where a gamer is constantly updated about his friends achievements.

The Fragegg team Fragegg was founded â€žby gamers for gamersâ€. The team behind fragegg is dedicated to serve the needs of the gaming community. A team of currently 12 people is working on the fragegg project looking forward to create the best solution to provide good quality games and enable the gamer to be always up to date with his/her friends game activities.

name: Fabchannel
overview:
There is a lot of great music in the world. Much more than you hear on popular radio and television. Because of formats, timeslots, playlists and other old media concepts you are not getting what you should.

There are bands out there that are going to change the future of music. And bands that already did. Very few of them are getting airplay these days.

One thing that they are doing is touring the world and playing live.

Fabchannel.com brings you a wide variety of live music in sound and vision. From upcoming acts to big stars playing rock, hiphop, folk, avant-garde and everything in between.

With a team of dedicated, music loving directors, editors, programmers and promoters Fabchannel has built one of the biggest online concert archives in the world. 900 full-length concerts, festivals, performances, debates and lectures can be freely experienced in the Fabchannel video on demand archive. Live from the famous Paradiso and Melkweg Amsterdam.

Originated from Paradiso and with the continuous help of the Paradiso and Melkweg staff, Fabchannel provides you with the music and the tools to watch it.

We record, you choose.
tag_list: concert, online-concert, music, online-music, webcast, concert-webcast

overview: PBMCube offers genre news, games index, and 20,000+ free unique online games – arcade, cartoons, casual and game tutorials, source codes cheats and featured role playing games (rpg) from many game developers. Play games on various platforms such as PC, MAC and mobile and in various formats: flash, shockwave, roms, trial download, java and javascript.

overview:
VocalBuzz is a new social network for amateur and professional singers from all around the world wide web of music. This is a place where you can share and connect to talented vocalists and their vocals.

VocalBuzz is a free service created by a consortium of agents and performers.

name: UQ Events
overview:
UQ Events has embraced the web 2.0 world by providing digital event listings for the Vancouver area.

UQ Events provides an easy to use web platform that allows venues and companies local to Vancouver to get the word out on an event. Listings include an event calender, media inclusion and a RSS feed for each profile.

name: Gamecarte
overview:
Gamecarte is an online gaming platform focused in providing video games, simulations through the cloud.

Gamecarte is also a connectivity tool which provides gaming content to multiple devices such as PC and mobile phones, in a fashion that is optimized for that particular device. We believe in the power of video games and simulations and that they can be an extremely transformational and effective tool used in business, education and science as well as be the greatest form of entertainment.

We have developed Gamecarte Sudoku and Gamecarte Sudoku according to us is the most advanced Sudoku game in the world. What we have implemented in this version in regards to features is the most advanced and as a result not available anywhere else. Gamecarte Sudoku is a multi-device product, what this means is that a user can play the same game on multiple devices, example you can start the game on a PC and continue that same game on the mobile phone and the game is optimized for the phone or vice versa. Users can save a game using either a PC or mobile and again load that game at a later stage on their PC or mobile phone. Gamecarte Sudoku is the only multi device Sudoku game in the world.
tag_list: video-games, simulations, software, games, puzzles, science, business, education, cloud, mobile, pc, multi-device

Keyone Productions is a creative digital media business specialising in creating online media content for their target audiences.

Established in March 2006, Keyone Productions has developed to become a creator of high-quality content, with a passion for film that is evident within their work.

The business is operated by the partnership of Chris Leydon and Nick Cooper, who are able to produce content in a manner that is both professional and accessible.

As well as creating their own independent content, Keyone Productions also aims to meet the demands of commercial services, providing tailor-crafted content to fit the needs of any client.

name: Giftologia
overview:
It is so often we have no clue of what to present to your girlfriend, mother, friend etc… Some of us start to seek for a present at the very last moment and still do not have any kind of gift ideas, althrough good ideas are often beside us. Our main target is to assist you in those moments, when you don not even have a thought, but the gift is needed shortly..

So, now, by chooszing the cathegory of relationship (ex. brother, boss), and clicking “OK”, you will get hunderds of fresh ideas, and it is some kind of a gift brainstorming!

After that, you can select the most appropriate ideas by clicking on “+” at the top-right angle of each idea or start to search it in web by clicking on the idea link.

Please, do not be a 100% consumer, share your gift ideas with others by clicking “Add your idea”.

We hope that our project will make your gift more desired!

name: Panfu
overview:
Panfu is a safe virtual online world for children. Here they can play educational games, meet and chat with friends.

When our children surf the Internet, they should, above all, be having fun and surfing content which corresponds to their age and development. In the virtual world of Panfu, young Internet users between the ages of 8 and 12 years will find a wide range of free and child-appropriate online games including a safe and supervised chat tool, learn languages and the option to care for a virtual pet. Every child in Panfu can individually stylize their own panda and set up and decorate their own tree-house. Creativity is particularly encouraged in Panfu. Panfu is colourfully designed and advertisement free to members (Gold Pandas). In addition to the exciting online games children will also have the chance to socialise with children of their age through chatting and developing friendships. Parents can take a virtual tour of Panfu, which provides an overview of all the games and learning possibilities.
tag_list: virtual-worlds, children, language-learning, games, educational, multiplayer

name: Avocado Entertainment
overview:
Avocado Entertainment is a top-ranked social and mobile game publisher in Korea.

The company was established in early 2006, and rapidly grown, by professional online gaming product managers, web programmers and designers, previously worked at Yahoo! Korea.

With outstanding creativity and technology backgrounds in online game and internet platform, we are developing and publishing high quality social and mobile games for the social networks and mobile app stores in Korea.

We are interested in licensing high quality overseas social and mobile games to bring into Korean market and also looking for a business partnership with talented social and mobile game developers and studios.

We have been establishing an extensive business partnership with worldwide famous game developers until now.

Contact us to discuss partnership opportunities.

name: Say Design
overview:
Say Design’s core passion is game innovation, invention and design.

With nearly a decade in online Flash development and experimentation, Say Design has pushed the envelopes in terms of cross-platform development and innovations for games. Say Design works with most of the top entertainment brands and portals delivering a wide range of development and game licensing solutions. These range from custom Flash games to browser-based MMO’s and virtual worlds. Say Design brings game designs to a very wide gamut of platforms and devices including: XBox 360, Wii, DS, Mobile and of course PC & Online.

Although Say Design provides a one-stop shop for game solutions including licensing game engines, the biggest value brought forward is exceptional game concepts and creative ideas that both engage and entertain casual and casual-core audiences.

name: AnySource Media
offices: [{"description":"Anysource Media, LLC","address1":"70 E. Swedesford Road Suite 120","address2":"","zip_code":"19355","city":"Malvern","state_code":"PA","country_code":"USA","latitude":40.054547,"longitude":-75.515376}]
overview:
Founded in 2006, AnySource Media is a rapidly-growing, innovative technology company enabling consumer electronics manufacturersâ€™ to bring a wide range of Internet-delivered video directly into their devices.

AnySource Media provides an Internet-enabled TV (iTV) platform, called the Internet Video Navigatorâ„¢ (IVN) to silicon companies and consumer electronics manufacturersâ€™ of HDTV worldwide. The IVN platform includes embedded software inside the HDTV, a full-spectrum of both branded and user-generated video content delivered over a direct Internet connection, as well as a targeted advertising and user management system managed at the IVN data center. Similar to a video RSS reader for television, the IVN data center communicates with a wide-range of content providers to collect the information necessary to populate the friendly IVN user interface on the HDTV screen. The content description data is enhanced and normalized so the navigation experience is simple and consistent. The navigation data is then delivered to the TV along with advertising, preferences and other transaction information.

name: ToonUps
overview:
ToonUps is a digital entertainment company whose mission is to create online games and apps to brighten the world. Since the turn of the century, ToonUps has created a rich array of products in the business, prosumer, and consumer marketplaces, all designed with the purpose of uplifting people through optimism, altruism, and fun. From social gaming to business training, our innovative content brings these core themes to new markets.

This vision is backed by the extensive experience of the ToonUps team. Our management has

  • Managed rapid corporate growth in an international teleservices organization
  • Lead IPO at RMH Teleservices in 1996 (RMHT, NASDAQ)
  • Functioned as corporate consultants to Fortune 500 companies in training and process improvement
  • Expertise in the personal growth, self-help, and inspirational arenas

It is the intention of ToonUps management to leverage its considerable experience and expertise to create products that succeed by enhancing the lives of all our customers.

name: SCVNGR
overview:
SCVNGR is part game, part game platform. Playing SCVNGR is all about going places, doing challenges and earning points. Players discover cool new places, find fun new things to do, share their activity with friends and can even earn virtual (and sometimes real-world) rewards! Individuals and institutions can build on SCVNGR by adding custom challenges at their favorite places!

Start playing SCVNGR now at www.scvngr.com.

Today, Owlient offer its product to passionates of horses (http://www.howrse.com), fish-breeding (http://www.aquariow.com) and childhood (http://www.babydow.com), over five languages (french, english, german, spanish and russian). Owlientâ€™s efforts are directed toward designing new passion games and extend its international offer.

name: TrewCap
overview:
PrideMe.com is a military oriented website which networks military members and veterans with their families, friends, and supporters. This website has highlighted features such as Mil Matching, Video Chat, Video Uploads with categories, Classifieds, Member Blogs, Military Forum, Peer Search, Job Search, Friend Invite, and Groups and Units.

The main concept of PridMe.com is to not only develop a network but to develop a query of connections between members according to there location, fields of expertise, and interests. Blocks will be posted to each members profile control panel according to particular interests chosen by member during website registration or when member profile is edited.

Member will also accumulate â€œPridesâ€ (points or kudos) for completing certain actions such as starting a Group or posting a blog. They will be able to receive â€œPridesâ€ from other members who can give 1 â€œPrideâ€ to a blog, picture, or video that they enjoy. These prides will be tallied on a normal bases and members with the most accumulated during a given periods will be reward with Profile Highlights, Unit and Group highlights, video highlights, and more.

name: Arimaz
overview:
Arimaz SA is developing products and innovative technologies related to entertainment robotics, interactive toys and networked objects. These new type of devices are at the boundary of the virtual and real worlds. They are a key element in creating new types of interactions between people and digital content, such as information, games or social networks. Our team has developed a set of enabling technologies:

  • Our main solution is the Arimaz comObject services gateway, a client-server architecture to connect any object with web services and online content. For example, this solution enables simple objects to receive messages such as emails or to fetch information such as news headlines from the Internet.
    • Arimaz has also developed the nanoAPI embedded core, a low cost electronic module to enable the creation of interactive and networked devices. This powerful solution is a basic block to create devices with autonomous mobility, multiple ways to communicate with the user (sounds, lights, motions) and supports a large variety of sensors.
    • Finally, we are developing an Artificial Personality Engine to breathe life into animated objects. This embedded software solution is able to manage behaviors of artificial (or virtual) agents, such as entertainment robots or toys.

name: Umoo
overview:
UMOO is a virtual online trading platform for Financial Entertainment, combining the fun of Internet based multiplayer games with the thrill and opportunity for reward offered by the stock markets. Players of UMOO enjoy a fantasy stock market game where risk is minimal and the opportunity to trade, compete and win is real.

UMOO’s concept follows the ebb & flow of the S&P500 stock market index using real time quotes. Traders compete against each other instead of the markets to win. Once entering a trading competition, players receive virtual money with which to build and manage a virtual stock portfolio based on real stock market data. The objective of the players is to make the highest returns on their portfolio, just like in real life. Throughout the duration of the tournament, players are benchmarked against the performance of other players and at the end of the tournament the winners are those who have the highest relative returns. UMOO offers absolutely anyone a real opportunity to win; you can learn more about our competitions here.

UMOO offers real- time market data and a variety of research tools & information which are available on the UMOO platform. All the data and information provided by UMOO is there to help players compete effectively and fairly while improving their financial trading skills.

UMOO is for everyone, from professional traders to the absolute novice, the UMOO game can be played by anyone who wants to take part in online investing without the risk, UMOO offers you a great place to learn trading skills and compete for wealth, recognition and entertainment.

highdefnow is an online High-Definition video platform allowing content providers to integrate and monetize stunning HD video on the web. With the power of cloud computing highdefnow can produce 720p HD video that is streamable across a 2Mbit/s connection with a picture quality significantly better than other services.

highdefnow’s platform makes it very simple to ingest broadcast-grade material either through web upload or physical ingest. This material can then be embedded easily into any website.

name: Z2Live
overview:
Z2Live is bringing the next generation of gaming to mobile. The company builds highly social games that leverage the Free-to-Play model. Z2Live was founded in July of 2009 by Damon Danieli - a 14 year Microsoft veteran - and David Bluhm - a long time veteran of mobile content and entertainment - along with the backing of Madrona Venture Group. Lou Fasulo joined the company in its earliest stages to build-out and lead the company’s studio and publishing capabilities. Today, the company maintains dedicated studios and technology resources in Seattle, WA for building both mass-market social games along with more traditional 3D multiplayer games that fully leverage the advanced capabilities of new mobile devices.

The company’s first product, Trade Nations, has built one of the largest game communities on mobile having logged over 500 million game sessions since its launch. This highly social simulation / city builder game has garnered widespread recognition and has remained as one of the top grossing games on Apple’s AppStore since launch.

The company’s second game, MetalStorm, has widely been recognized as best in its category and became one of the top ranked and top grossing games on iTunes within 3 days of launch.

Both games lead their respective categories in terms of critical acclaim, user ratings, popularity and monetization.

Z2lIve also benefits from an advanced community layer that facilitates in-game, player-to-player transactions and highly social game mechanics. The Z2Live community layer supports the most advanced set of community features including in-game email, text chat, voice chat, real-time multiplayer, player icons, achievements, badges and a full social graph that is integrated with Facebook and twitter.

name: preAmped
overview:
As the ticketing industry has become less centralized and artists choose between social networks, keeping track of concerts is difficult and time consuming. preAmped brings together the information you need to never miss a concert and to never rock alone.

On January 1st, 2009 preAmped.com was released as a public beta with a few simple goals: Make it easy (for users who just want to know whatâ€™s going on) Make it comprehensive (what you need to know in a single place) Make it deep (get users involved in the local scenes)

preAmped.com is a website that caters to the occasional concert fan by exposing simple searching features backed by a vast database of artists, venues, events, locations, and users. Functionality takes off with a collection of pages revolving around a single event to capture the experience. Users can check out the artists, post comments, see who is attending, get venue information, post pictures, purchase tickets, and listen to music. By linking these items to a single event we can create a sense of a ‘local community’ around concerts. Imagine capturing the concert from the viewpoint of the fans at a single show then tracking that around the country and throughout the years.

preAmped currently has over 350k artists, tracking 250k events from all over the net. A complex system has been designed to merge and clean web data to give the user a simple presentation. Every venue has an address that has been standardized, geocoded, and validated via external systems. Users can go directly to their favorite artist or check out their city no matter the size.

The site is also on top of the latest trends and technologies. Every event, city, and venue page is geo coded, RSS feeds for each city, URLs are rewritten, and the team continues to explore vCard tagging and KML exports. preAmped is a new and growing site with an API to be released soon with the sole purpose of removing the overhead of data processing and spawning amazing new tools, widgets, mobile apps, and websites.

name: Dormtainment
overview: Dormtainment was created by college students for college students, for college student wannabes, and for those who just know a college student. Dormtainment is an online hang-out spot where you can share laughs, voice your opinions, or just escape from the everyday challenges of life. Dormtainment is FUN! It is the best online college entertainment around, with the funniest skits, the most interesting college-related blogs, and always something new added. Coming soon is an online radio show, contests, even more skits, etc. etc., etc. Youâ€™ll just have to keep logging on to find out whatâ€™s happening in the life of a college student. This is Dormtainment.com. So, take a break from the books. Sit back and prepare to laugh out loud! Oh, by the way, thereâ€™s some quasi-serious stuff, too (so the parents wonâ€™t think youâ€™re totally goofing off). Just Point, Click, and Enjoy!

overview:
Preview Networks is a content marketing platform for brands and content aggregation and syndication platform for publishers. We provide the tools for brands to centrally distribute and manage marketing and PR content across media destinations, devices, and commerce platforms; allowing media partners to automate content acquisition delivering audience and advertising revenue growth.

With 7 offices operating in 10 markets in Europe, we work with over 300 content companies to distribute more than 350 million video streams and 2.25 billion images across over 2,500 media destinations including websites, social networks, mobile apps, tablets, and connected TV.

The company is privately held and venture backed by Sunstone Capital.

For the most recent updates about Preview Networks visit www.previewnetworks.com

name: myconcertarchive
overview:
Myconcertarchive is an open collaborative concert database.

The goal is to build a big concerts archive while helping people to manage their list of past and upcoming concerts.

It was created after its founder searched the web for gigs he went to in the early 90’s and didn’t find any trace of.

Myconcertarchive is a website where everyone can list, review and share photos of such events and archive them forever.

End of 2008 myconcertarchive launched a Facebook application inspired by the famous “Cities I’ve visited” to bring something like “The concerts I’ve been to”.
tag_list: concerts, music, events, archive, facebook, database

name: The Escapist
overview:
The Escapist (www.escapistmagazine.com) is an online destination covering video games, gamers, the gaming industry, and gaming culture. Published by the Themis Media, it launched on July 12, 2005.

The website MMORPG.com noted that the website had become the “flagship brand” for Themis, which runs other websites and ventures related to the gaming industry, with the reputation of “a widely read and highly respected form of game journalism” and “paying writers top dollar”.

<b>Traffic<b><br> According to Quantcast, the site serves 1.5 million uniques users and 24.1 million page views per month as of April 2, 2009.

Video Series The Escapist hosts a number of ongoing video series, most of which pertain to videogames. Some of these include: Drawn By Pain Doomsday Arcade de-rez Zero Punctuation Unforgotten Realms Videogame Theater Kung Fu Grip Unskippable There Will Be Brawl Stolen Pixels A World of Her PWN

Writers The Escapist features writing by well-respected game authors including Jerry Holkins (a.k.a. Tycho Brahe), Kieron Gillen, and John Tynes,. Tom Chick, Allen Varney, Jim Rossignol, Greg Costikyan, and Warren Spector.

Awards In October 2006, Editor-in-Chief Julianne Greer was named one of Gaming’s Top 50 Journalists.

In May 2008, The Escapist won the Webby Award and 2008 People’s Choice Award for Best Video-Game Related Website.

In March 2009, The Escapist was nominated for a Streamy Award for Best Animation in a Web Series.
tag_list: video-games, gaming, games, gamer, social-media, video, web-video, zero-punctuation

name: Intruders TV
overview:
Intruders tv is the leading provider of valuable insights through their unique approach to capturing Innovators on camera. Interviews are conducted by well known, experienced and international industry editors, hand picked by Intruders tv to convey credibility and respectability both with the innovators being interviewed and the audience watching the interview.

Intruders tv carries out interviews that range from 10-30 minutes at leading conferences around the world as well as interviewing on the premises of leading innovators. Intruders tv also work on behalf of leading companies to interview chosen innovators on key topics that are affecting our world today. Intruders tv also provides a Video on Demand service to specific audiences requiring tailored content as well as in different languages.

Intruders tv covers all the key industry topics in depth providing a compelling and comprehensive interview that can be easily accessed by any person wishing to learn and discover how others within the same industry have created success.

These interviews can be found on www.intruders.tv as well as other partner sites. Intruders tv is headquartered in the United Kingdom.

name: YiqYaq
overview:
YiqYaq is an online radio service streaming short micro-podcasts of user-generated content.

Users create channels based on personal interests and then record, upload, or import audio directly from their computer or the YiqYaq iPhone application. Listeners can tag any of these channels to create a blend of audio matching all of their varied interests. Because the clips are short (usually 30 seconds or less) the radio experience tends to be constantly changing.

Integration with twitter allows some of these channels to come directly from user’s tweets, through text-to-speech engines, to play along with all other original content.

name: ChangYou
overview:
Tao Wang is Changyou’s CEO and a director.

Mr. Wang has over 12 years of experience in the computer game industry in China and was one of the principal founders of Changyou’s online game business.

Prior to the Company’s carve-out from Sohu, Mr. Wang served as Sohu’s Vice President of MMORPG business.

Mr. Wang joined Sohu in December 2004 and was instrumental in the ramp up of its MMORPG business and played a key role in the success of TLBB.

Prior to joining Sohu, Mr. Wang worked at Sina and was the Managing Technology Director for its iGAME development and operations.

From 2001 to 2003, Mr. Wang served as the Vice President and Chief Technology Officer of Beijing Tian Ren Interactive Software Technologies Co. Ltd., a PRC games distributor and operator.

From 1998 to 2001, Mr. Wang was a project manager at Object Software (Beijing) Limited, one of the pioneer games and multimedia software developers in China, responsible for its PC console games, Internet games and multi-media educational software development.

From 1997 to 1998, Mr. Wang worked at Fuzhou Wai Xin Software Technologies Co. Ltd. as a software development engineer. Mr. Wang received a bachelor’s degree in Engineering from Hangzhou Industrial Electronics Institute.

name: QPoint

Vueflix is similar to YouTube, with a main difference: Vueflix aims to avoid censoring their content. To do this, the website is personally maintained and the middle-man is removed. Vueflix’s aims to present “truth without censorship.”

Due to the recent account deletions and suspensions at YouTube

You may now upload , share and watch truth and Patriot videos for free.

name: Myfitbrain
overview:
Myfitbrain is a company founded to deliver software to improve the brain at no cost to the end user. It does this by utilizing a unique (patent pending) advertising approach of incorporating a company’s brand and/or products into the game play.

Myfitbrain is innovative brain training software offered at no charge to users due to its unique advertising model. Myfitbrain, started with the premise of allowing everyone to benefit from fun software that stimulated the mind. In order for that to be possible, Myfitbrain came up with a new advertising model which allows advertisers to dynamically load products into the game pieces, significantly increasing product recognition when compared to traditional advertising methods.

Myfitbrain includes multiple types of mental fitness games focusing on different parts of the brain to sharpen the overall brain and encourage the generation new brain cells. While some consumers exclusively enjoy games such as Sudoku or crossword puzzles which stimulates some areas of the brain, stimulating many cognitive areas of the brain is significantly more beneficial. The learning management system built into Myfitbrain will maintain a player’s performance and drive them through the different games while challenging different cognitive abilities.

The patent pending advertising model will incorporate a company’s brand name or products (icons) directly into the playing of the brain games. During the course of play, users will be directly interacting with the icons. While people play the games, they will repeatedly say the icon name to themselves.

Myfitbrain will continue to develop more mental fitness games to keep the novelty of the game playing high which helps to stimulate the brain. Myfitbrain will work closely with its advertising partners and their agencies to develop challenging games that incorporate products into the games and that are stimulating to the mind.

The software was developed in conjunction with Kreeda Games India Pvt. Ltd., located in Mumbai, India. The system is hosted utilizing cloud technology to enable rapid expansion with a robust infrastructure.
tag_list: games, brain, advertising, mental, advertising-model, brain-games, mental-fitness

name: Newgrounds
overview: Newgrounds is an online community devoted to flash animation and music. It has one of the largest user bases in the world. It provides forums, blogs, and more. With the recent addition of medals, users can show off their achievements in some of the 37,000+ games as of this writing.

name: AggreGame
overview:
AggreGame is both a technology company, and electronic entertaiment media outlet. With a heavy focus on the video game industry, AggreGame is at face value a website and community geared towards gaming.

Under-the-hood and behind-the-scenes is AG Labs - the R&D arm of AggreGame. AG Labs has turned out a number of innovations in the social, real-time, and analytics space, most notably AggreTweet and Campaign Advantage.

AG Labs’ Campaign Advantage, launched in January 2012, is a product and service offering providing companies with better market intelligence with easy navigation. Instead of just getting access to Twitter data, Campaign Advantage provides more meaningful, processed data that shines a light on user engagement with a given brand.

You can preview Campaign Advantage at the following URL. Bear in mind, while we’ve chosen two gaming Goliaths of 2011 in this sample site, our process can be applied horizontally across many industries.

http://aggregame.com/direct/AGLabs/app/AGLabsMain.html

Launched late Summer of 2009 is AggreTweet, a Twitter app which captures all the gaming buzz / conversations as it happens on Twitter. All feeds are real-time streams based on the Twitter Streaming API, and all the hottest games are tracked. Simple graphs and trending charts are then generated based entirely off Twitter traffic, which offers an easy visualization of which games are leading others in terms of volume of tweets. Publishers & gaming enthusiasts alike can use these metrics for business or fun.

Since its launch, AggreTweet has proven to be a valuable resource in both historical analytics, but more importantly - trend prediction. Christmas 2009, AggreTweet successfully predicted NPD sales figures based purely on social media chatter. In 2010, Aggregame (leveraging AggreTweet’s technologies) forecasted record-setting numbers of tweets around the Electronic Entertainment Expo (E3 2010), predicting over 500,000 tweets during the week of E3. As it turns out, the Tweets rounded out just over 600,000. Read all about it at http://blog.aggregame.com.

AggreTweet has since exited public BETA, and is now closed off. All future inquiries, such as to request access to AggreTweet, should be directed to agbusiness@aggregame.com.
tag_list: video-games, gaming, ag-labs, campaign-advantage, analytics, news, gaming-news, feeds, aggregate, reviews, previews, gaming-forums, chat, podcasts, twitter, gaming-tweets, gaming-buzz, gaming-conversations

name: Sloshspot
overview:
Whether you are looking for the cheapest drink specials, the most popular club to see and be seen, or the most authentic local dive, SloshSpot’s targeted nightlife and entertainment search has your answer.

SloshSpot.com is the place to go online to discover what is happening in nightlife and entertainment. Organized around locations, events, and performances, SloshSpot provides a forum for searching out, sharing experiences of, and developing an online and offline relationship with the best entertainment and nightlife spots in your hometown or travel destination around the globe. When searching for where to go and what to do for fun, partying, and entertainment, SloshSpot is the only stop you need to make on the web before your night out. When the night is over, head back to SloshSpot to share pictures, comments, and ratings of the spots you visited.

Bar owners, venues, promoters, and performers can create unique and lasting relationships with their patrons and fans by creating a customized, premium presence on SloshSpot from which to promote events and services, as well as to interact with entertainment seekers the world over. Individual users can submit new spots that are not currently listed, and can even create, promote, and manage their own events through SloshSpot.

With a targeted focus on nightlife and entertainment search, SloshSpot is uniquely positioned to be the site where you come when you’re done working and you’re ready to play. With built-in social networking features such as event planning and notification, comments and ratings, photo and video sharing, and easy integration with mobile devices, email, calendars, and existing social networks (Such as Facebook…), SloshSpot will become both an essential entertainment and event resource as well as your new online nightlife and entertainment community.

name: ReverbDesk
overview:
ReverbDesk was developed because an online market for music production services in the music industry just did not exist. The aim of ReverbDesk was to provide music production services for the huge community of bands, artist, labels, venues and various other stakeholders in the music industry.

As the site was developed ReverbDesk added categories for music video production, performance, duplication services, web design, graphic design and music photography services. With the addition of these service categories the site aimed at offering an online marketplace for every type of professional service required in the music industry.

ReverbDesk offers an opportunity for freelance producers, audio engineers, music video producers, web designs, graphic designers, photographers and various other service professionals to find projects and jobs that are posted online by service buyers and employers.

Additionally it you are a recording studio, production company or any other type of service providing business you are also able to bid on projects and jobs in the marketplace.

ReverbDesk allows service buyers such as artists, bands, labels, music venues & various businesses to list projects online in a reverse auction marketplace. Service professionals search for projects and submit proposals to complete the service buyers requirements. A service buyer selects the preferred bidder and awards the project to the bidder.

overview: Scoreloop focuses on building the best mobile gaming technology to extend any game to the social arena. Scoreloop is neither a game developer nor publisher, and therefore does not compete within their market. Instead, Scoreloop cooperates with all players of the mobile gaming value chain - from game developers and aggregators, to publishers and portals - to maximize their gamers’ experience, improve their community’s cohesiveness, and provide them with additional revenue streams.

With multiple new games added on a daily basis, Play Free Online Games is soon to become a dominant force in the free online games market.

overview:
Busca Corp. is a Spanish-speaking Digital Entertainment Network, Founded by Ramon Toledo in 2006 as Busca Inc., LLC, and restructured as a legally chartered Delaware corporation in 2007. Based in La Jolla, California, with branches in Tijuana, Baja California, Mexico City, and Santiago, Chile; with the goal of becoming the number one Spanish-speaking Digital Entertainment Network in Latin America.

Along with its subsidiaries, (Level Up, Tarreo, Metatube adn SanDiegoRed, Busca Corp. provides users with access to a wide array of resources that promote social interaction, information distribution, and overall consumer gratification with such applications as blogs, reviews, previews, news, event coverage, and video.

Busca Corp has a solid growth in monthly unique visitors to the network (25M pageviews per month). More than 1,00,000 active registered users to the network.

In 2008 Level Up, won “2008 BEST MEXICAN 2.0 WEB SITE”. In 2010 it won the “BEST ENTERTAINMENT SITE” by the Mexican Internet Association. Busca Corp. has partnerships with MSN in Mexico and Latin America and Yahoo! and Televisa, among others.

Recently, in Decemeber 2012 SanDiegoRed was awarded best news site in Mexico by AMIPCI.

Busca Corp.’s network of online properties include: LevelUp.com, Tarreo.com, Metatube.com, and SanDiegoRed.com, respectively.

http://www.LevelUp.com is the #1 online video game community and social networking website in Mexico and Latin America, with over 2.8 million unique visitors and 10 million pageviews per month. The website serves Spanish-speaking users around the world, and features news, previews, reviews, original web shows and video trailers for the video game community.

http://www.Tarreo.com, which slang for “PC gaming” in Chilean, leads the way in Latin America, and has already positioned itself as the #1 PC gaming site in Chile. The website hosts forums that serve as an interactive tool for users who want to share their opinions on the latest video game trends locally and globally.

http://www.Metatube.com is a video streaming community tailored to Spanish-speaking audiences around the world. The website’s team of editors filters all videos and only selects the best and highest ranked content. Users also have the opportunity to share, rank, comment, and upload videos.

http://www.SanDiegoRed.com is a regional news and information website that tailors its content offering to U.S Hispanic audiences in high populated Hispanic regions. The website integrates social media tools and promotes user engagement and interactivity, and boasts major partnerships with media partners such as the Union Tribune San Diego.

Busca Corp. (http://www.buscacorp.com/) is a digital entertainment network in Mexico, Latin America and the U.S. Hispanic market. The company has offices in La Jolla and Silicon Valley, California; Tijuana and Mexico City, Mexico; and Santiago, Chile. Busca Corp is a culturally rich and diverse corporation, with over 60 employees dedicated to niche markets around the world, and to leveraging partnerships with leading firms, including MSN, Yahoo, Sony and the Union Tribune San Diego.

List of selected customers includes Electronic Arts, Namco Hometek, DTP Entertainment, ValuSoft, Kuju and others.

overview:
NaturalMotion Ltd is a leading games and technology company based in Oxford, London, San Francisco, and Brighton. Its high-end mobile games label, NaturalMotion Games, is one of the most successful and fastest growing mobile gaming companies in the UK.

The company creates ultra-high quality free-to-play games that combine polished gameplay with high-end 3D graphics.

NaturalMotion Games’ CSR Racing for iOS released in July 2012. It reached number 1 in the Top Free and Top Grossing charts in over 70 countries worldwide and was the only title featured on stage during Apple’s WWDC 2012 conference. The company announced that the game generated more than $12 million revenue a month

The company’s next title, Clumsy Ninja, was revealed during Apple’s iPhone 5 keynote.

NaturalMotion Technology produces leading animation software products such as the award-winning euphoria engine - a break-through in real-time character animation, and used in games such as GTA IV, Red Dead Redemption and Max Payne 3. NaturalMotion’s other run-time animation product, Morpheme, is the industry’s first graphically authorable animation engine. Morpheme is the most widely used animation engine in the console and PC games industry.

name: BIT TV
overview:
BIT-IPTV is a Live HD streaming social networking site for professional broadcasters who want the best video quality and more control over their platform. BIT-IPTV was started in order to be a provider that helps broadcasters keep their show at its peak performance while allowing them to profit from what they love. Player colors, text, background images, banners, etc. are left completely to the broadcasterâ€™s discretion. They can invite co-hosts and guests who are broadcasting simultaneously from across the globe. They can choose what (if any) ads to place on their page, where and for how long.

BIT-IPTV also provides a variety of options for users to monetize their videos and broadcasts. Pay per view, Video on Demand and links for Google Adsense, are all at the finger tips of every user. And, with connections to Twitter, myspace, Facebook, and the ability to upload YouTube videos and blog, BIT-IPTV is a formidable networking and marketing tool. Open to people from all walks of life, the BIT-IPTV platform levels the playing field and provides a forum for independent music artists, radio stations, and non-profit organizations, to mix with both the average user and bigger corporations.

Another priority of BIT-IPTV is focusing on integrating live streaming and HD quality. Making true HD streaming possible for both live and recorded events, BIT-IPTV strives to connect viewers and allow them to watch and interact with real time broadcasted events from across the globe. With a unique blend of video compression and streaming, videos require virtually no buffering time and can be viewed on mobile phones or screens of 40 inches or larger, allowing userâ€™s to reach audiences like never before.

overview: Aspiro has a unique position as the world’s only provider of both streaming music and TV services delivered as a complete white label service to partners. As the market leader in mobile entertainment in the Northern European region, Aspiro utilize over ten years mobile technology and retail experience, delivering its premium services to companies worldwide including T-Mobile, TelefÃ³nica O2, Telenor, 3, TeliaSonera, BBC, Aftonbladet, mBlox, TVNorge, Entel and VG. Aspiro is listed on the Nasdaq OMX Stock Exchange in Stockholm, with local presence in all Nordic and Baltic countries and the US. 2009 sales were SEK 441 m and the company has some 150 employees.

name: Campus Jerk
overview:
CampusJerk.com is a interactive website built for college students which combines college video sharing, college networking, anomyous gossip, college next morning stories, and video contest and giveaways into one location.

CampusJerk was developed for college students, and college campuses around the nation. We use a Campus Selector, located on our homepage, so users can select their campus (college) and it displays videos uploaded by other students that go to that college. They can visit and comment on the campus gossip, along with read and write funny/embarrassing/amusing stores from last night, last weekend or anything like that.

We hold video contest, where users can submit videos they have uploaded that fit the contest description, and fellow users vote on the videos and we give away great prizes such as I-Pods, travel vouchers, plane tickets, concert tickets, sporting event tickets, etc.. If you have a great gift idea, we would love to hear it! (membership@campusjerk.com)

For any questions/concerns/ideas/advertising inquiries, please visit our site www.campusjerk.com and visit the HELP tab for company department info, or submit an inquiry via our Contact US tab located on the footer of the page for general Inquiries!

In Open Studio, all images available for gifting are uploaded by users â€“ and in the process, contributors build their own virtual portfolio where they can display their work and receive comments. Anyone is welcome to join the community, from professional artists to art lovers to people simply looking for a unique virtual gift.

name: Mind Taffy Design
overview:
Mind Taffy Design specializes in highly data-optimized, client-side rendered new media content design and development for leading international brands and manufacturers.

Hardware Platforms upon which content programming is delivered includes PCs and Laptops, Mobile Phones and Smart Phones, PDAs and UMPCs, e-Signage and Digital Signage, Set-Top Boxes and Home Media Center Appliances, and similar devices. Content programming leverages DSP hardware technologies inside the hardware including the GPU for OpenGL, MIDI and Audio Synthesizer for OpenAL and Speech Synthesis, and DV codecs for ipTV.

Open Source Platforms used to display the content include all popular browsers (IE, NS, FireFox, Opera, Chrome, Flock, etc.), Mobile Browsers (OperaMini and Opera Mobile), Cross-Platform Content Deployment Platforms (JavaFX and Java3D for Browser, PC and Mobile) and Game Deployment Platforms (Torque for PC, Mac, Linux, Wii, xBox, iPhone, PSP) amongst others.

Mind Taffy Design content is characterized by interactive photoreal uncompressed (looking) graphics often rendered on the client-side in data footprints ranging from 8KB to under 1MB. Clients include the largest international companies (Sony, Samsung, Tyco, Nokia, IBM, SUN, DEC, DELL, Mitsubishi, Epson, TEAC, CTX, KDS, Micron, Compaq, SGI, Western Digital, ViewSonic, etc.) and brands (Trinitron, Nexio, Nav-U, EloTouch, etc.).

Mind Taffy Design recent projects include two HD touchscreen i3D brandgames for Tyco Electronics and the innovative HD ipTV Live Concert streaming website www.MyHDTVclub.com which is slated to feature artists from MTV, Disney, InterScope, Warner, Universal, Live Nation, Sony BMG and several other networks. The entire site is already optimized for mobile viewing and is less than 1MB in data footprint.

name: MP3 Obsession
overview:
MP3 Obsession.com reviews and compares cheap mp3 download websites to give you the good and bad of each one.

The site allows you to browse through millions of tracks and albums, starting at 9Â¢ per track.

You can then download cheap mp3s from one of the various companies that the site has reviewed. Before you make a decision, you can see how much each site is offering the mp3 for, what payment methods they accept, and you have a chance to read the review before you make your decision.

The site also has artist discographies, biographies, events, and more.
